REHSEARCH ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung für die Vermittlung von Fach- und Führungskräften. Wir vermitteln in den Bereichen IT, Ingenieurwesen und Pflegeführungskräfte in Festanstellung.

Who we are

Codepan is a boutique AI Lab building cutting-edge, AI-driven products and solutions.

We believe in augmenting humans with smart algorithms and look for technologies that co-exist, augment and enhance, rather than replace, humans.

Codepan is pioneering in building the AI Operating System of the future to enable organizations to build and scale Machine Learning products. Our mission is to transform the way organizations use data and technologies to harness the true potential AI holds.

We seek exceptional minds, creative thinkers and proactive doers to join us on this fascinating journey. Are you one of them? Come and join us!

We offer you...


a focused, innovative and collaborative environment that leverages diverse perspectives
a place to thrive through autonomy, challenging tasks, work on latest technology trends as well as collaboration with industry leaders and experts
a unique opportunity to co-create the future of AI in pioneering an AI Operating System
a company culture built on integrity, trust, joy, openness and passion
a flexible schedule and remote working opportunity
an attractive compensation package and various employee benefits
fun team events including hackathons
a beautiful office in a waterfront repurposed warehouse in Berlin-Kreuzberg

About the Role

The Data Engineer is responsible for building, maintaining and evolving the data warehouse and data mart environments. This includes designing the physical and logical architecture of the data warehouse, designing and implementing a data quality strategy, developing ETLs to extract data from various sources, monitoring the performance of the environment, providing training to end-users on best practices for using the ETLs, and resolving any issues that might arise. At Codepan, you would be working together with Data Scientists and Software Engineers to create real-world solutions for customers.

Tasks

As a part of the team, you will…


work in a cross-functional team of Software Engineers and Data Scientists in an agile environment
play a major role in architecture of machine learning platforms and their data needs
be one of the key technical decision-makers, and provide technical guidance and mentoring to help members of your team grow
be part of a team that emphasizes transparency, collaboration and skill development to master technical challenges

Requirements

In terms of skills and experience, you have...


a University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
a minimum of 3+ years of professional experience working as a Data Engineer
strong experience with Python and the wider corresponding ecosystem
strong knowledge of the python data stack (i.e. Pandas, numpy, scipy, pyspark)
proficient in database design and integration of different data sources
solid experience with Queueing Systems in a production environment
hands-on experience with Azure Databricks, ML-Flow and Azure Machine learning studio and Azure Delta Lake
knowledge of recent infrastructure ecosystems including cloud technology providers, Kubernetes, infrastructure automation, and are able to work independently on such environments
proficient written and spoken English language skills

As a plus, you have...


interest or prior experience in machine learning, manufacturing and IoT
proficient written and spoken German language skills
proficiency in machine learning algorithms

As personal qualities, you have...


keen curiosity and intellectual agility
strong sense of ownership, can-do attitude and creative solution-orientation
integrity and altruism
readiness to self-reflect and learn from mistakes
enthusiasm to work in a diverse team and an agile environment
excellent communication skills

Curious? Come join us! Jessica Fraser is looking forward to receiving your application or answering your questions

post_title: Senior Data Engineer - based in Luxembourg
description:
Next Gate Tech leverages the latest cloud technologies, providing clients with a consistent, consolidated and independent source of data, enabling them to streamline their day-to-day processes. This data comes from multiple unharmonized/unstructured sources. Through our analytics tools we help drive efficiency and reduce risk through eliminating the need for multiple point solutions and legacy databases. This enables firms to manage their governance and controls independently and consistently, while at the same time lowering their technology and manual expenditure. 
Senior Data Engineer - based in Luxembourg *Data is the core of what we do. Nowadays, we know that models can be only as good as the data ingested. At Next Gate Tech, we work with various structured and unstructured data from different sources and providers. We capture financial data from diverse vendors and collect large datasets from our clients.**Consequently, our data team oversees the quality of the data flow feeding our models and the technology we provide to our clients daily. They work to optimise the efficiency of financial data extraction on tens of thousands of cross-asset instruments and manage the orchestration of different data flows. They optimise and constantly enhance our internal financial database, which is the core of our analytics.**To support our fast-growing company and the growth of the daily volume of data, we are looking for a Senior Data Engineer that will join the data team. If you have a solid background in handling financial datasets and are passionate about searching and implementing best practices in data management and data ingestion, join our team!**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES**

Data workflow development and management
Developing technical solutions for data collection via APIs
Handling our internal financial instruments databases and oversees the daily flow
Represent the company in the discussion with the third-party financial data providers
Gathering the business needs of the various units requesting and using data collection
Monitoring production and maintenance

*
*PROFILE**

Master’s degree in a technical or quantitative field
+5 years of experience as a Data Engineer handling financial dataset
Past work and/or educational experience in the field of Finance is a must
Proficiency in working with financial data vendors and managing their relationship.
Experience with creating and maintaining Python packages
Understanding of numerical programming (using libraries such as numpy, pandas, scipy…)
Knowledge of databases and database management (SQL/NoSQL)
Strong understanding on working within cloud environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English

**TECHNOLOGIES**

Python 3.7+
Experience with Cloud Solutions, such as GCP, AWS, Azure…
Experience with financial tools, such as Thomson Reuters Eikon, Bloomberg Terminal, Datascope…

**WE OFFER

An exciting and dynamic work environment at the cutting-edge of its industry
An entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to make a direct and strong impact with new ideas
The ability to work at the intersection between two very promising and fast-growing fields, Finance and Technology
Flexibility and independence in work organisation and schedule

Next Gate Tech is an equal opportunity employer*
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Our Company

What if... your work would empower change in an industry that essentially impacts the prosperity of the entire world? Forto is in business to exactly do that - disrupt logistics! Simplifying global trade has been our mission from day one. Our exponentially growing team of more than 550 technology and logistics experts, forge ahead each day with the goal to deliver a highly transparent, frictionless and sustainable digital supply chain.

Our company is headquartered in Berlin, Germany, and currently has in total 12 offices across Europe and Asia, including Copenhagen, Hamburg, Ho Chi Minh City, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Shanghai. Leading manufacturers and e-commerce brands are among the 2.500 customers using Forto’s digitally-focused offerings as part of their supply chain delivery. Among the fastest growing logistic start-ups in Europe, Forto's recent investment round (June 2021) placed the company valuation at more than $1.2 billion.

At our core, we are in love with progress and cannot cope with the standstill. We leave old paths and look for new roads. We are constantly striving for ways to be even better tomorrow. We are facilitators, we are explorers, we are visionaries. If you are looking for something extraordinary to work for - join the crew to become a part of our pioneer expedition.

Your role

As a Senior Data Engineer at Forto, you build Forto’s data infrastructure that supports global scalability, reliable operations, and a high degree of automation.

You will


Decide, build, monitor, and maintain our cloud-based data infrastructure surrounding DataLake/Data Mesh Architecture.
Collaborate in a cross-functional team of Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and Product Managers to deliver Data Products for our customers.
Help our teams to develop, implement, and maintain reliable, sustainable, high-performance data ingestion and data-processing systems.
Support us to be an innovative company in logistics by building world-class data systems

What you bring


4+ years experience in data engineering, Big Data experience is a plus
Solid work experience with SQL and Databases
Experience in any of the programming languages like Java, Scala, or Python (preferable) and the passion to write clean code
Experience building ETL/ELT with batch and real-time pipelines on core principles of good data quality
Experience with any one of the cloud infrastructures like GCP (preferable) / AWS / Azure
Ideally, you have experience working with BigQuery or Redshift, Airflow or DataProc or Matillion, and real-time analytics using Apache Spark. Further technology in our stack includes: Kubernetes, Cloud Functions, Data Studio
Experience designing, developing, and deploying microservices or serverless applications with quality code with unit testing to production following CI/CD frameworks including CircleCI, Github.

Forto is an internationally growing company

At Forto we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, support them and cultivate them to the benefit of our employees, products and our communities. Forto is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

\--- \| --- \|


Company language: English
15+ offices across Europe & Asia
800+ employees
30+ nationalities represented
2500+ customers

Why Us - You can look forward to


Personal & Professional Development: Through strong ownership from the first day you will experience a steep learning curve, grow on a professional level and take the next steps to being an Expert or People Lead.
Impact: We are leading the digital transformation of a whole industry and share a high awareness for environmental issues on all levels especially supported by our management.
Team: Join a team of over 30 nationalities and different backgrounds from Tech, Logistics, Business and more. What really matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity.
Working culture: Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring is on our daily agenda.

Data Expert wirst du nicht an der Uni. Theorie ist gut, aber der direkte Praxisbezug ist elementar. Denn nur so lernst du, komplexe Daten von Grund auf zu verstehen und für Kunden und Kundinnen verständlich aufzubereiten. 
 
 Wir bieten dir den einfachen und unkomplizierten Einstieg in die Welt der Daten. In nur 12 Monaten bereiten wir dich auf viele Herausforderungen vor und machen aus dir einen echten Data Expert. Du lernst von unserem erfahrenen Team aus Data Engineers, Data Scientists und Data Consultants. 
 

Darauf kannst du dich verlassen:


Betreuung durch einen erfahrenen Mentor oder eine erfahrene Mentorin
Regelmäßige Teilnahme an internen und externen Schulungen und Veranstaltungen
Individuelle Anpassung deiner Meilensteine je nach Lernfortschritt
Agile Arbeitsweise mit flachen Hierarchien
Zielsetzung des Programms: Übernahme in eine unbefristete Festanstellung
 Aufgaben 
 
 Als Trainee Data Engineer (m/w/d) brennst du für alles rund um die Themen Data, Cloud und Technik. Stück für Stück binden wir dich in unsere Projekte ein, in denen du dann, gemeinsam mit deinem Team, die Schnittstelle zwischen den Cloud Services und unseren Auftraggebenden bildest. Dabei lernst du, wie du als technische Ansprechperson hinsichtlich der Umsetzung von bestehenden und neuen Cloud-Anwendungen berätst und übernimmst perspektivisch folgende Aufgaben: 
 


Übernahme der Planung von kundenspezifischen Cloud-Infrastruktur-Anforderungen sowie Implementierung dieser in Projekten
Erarbeitung von zukunftsfähigen Public-Cloud-Architekturen
Aufbau und Betrieb von Docker- und Kubernetes-gestützten Umgebungen: Container-Image-Verwaltung, automatisierte Pipelines
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit deinem Team aus Data Engineers, DevOps-Spezialisten und Data Consultants
 Qualifikation 
 


Abgeschlossenes Studium oder Ausbildung
Bereitschaft zur Weiterentwicklung im Bereich DevOps
Erste Erfahrungen mit Programmiersprachen, wie z. B. Python oder Java
Hohes Interesse an Multi-Cloud-Umgebungen (Azure / AWS / Google) sowie an Kubernetes und Docker
Agiles Mindset sowie die Fähigkeit, sich in neue Bereiche einzudenken
 Benefits 
 


Hier kannst du dich wohlfühlen. Dein Arbeitsplatz befindet sich in unseren stylischen 2-4er Büros in Köln-Ehrenfeld. Wir stellen dir eine moderne IT-Umgebung mit Cloud-basierter Infrastruktur und mobilen Arbeitsplätzen (Notebooks). Zusätzlich gibt es kostenlose Getränke wie Kaffee und Wasser sowie Obst. Außerdem bieten wir:
 \- Altersvorsorgen, Jobtickets und weitere Sozialleistungen 
 \- firmeneigenes Fitness-Studio 
 \- vergünstigte Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club 
 \- JobRad-Leasingangebot 
 

Wir sind flexibel. Wir leben eine wertschätzende und freundschaftliche Kultur mit regelmäßigen Teamevents. Du kannst so sein wie du bist und auch so ins Büro kommen (kein Dresscode). Darüber hinaus kannst du jede Überstunde ab der ersten Minute ausgleichen, deine Arbeitszeiten flexibel gestalten und je nach Situation Home Office machen.
Du bestimmst mit. Im Agilen Mindset bauen wir mit dir das Unternehmen auf. Zusammen arbeiten wir an effizienten Workflows und Strukturen. Wir diskutieren in offenen Runden über die Unternehmensstrategie und machen Entscheidungen und Geschäftszahlen transparent.
Wir fördern Weiterentwicklung. Durch interne und externe Weiterbildungen erhöhen wir regelmäßig dein Know-How und bereiten den nächsten Schritt in der Unternehmensentwicklung vor. Dabei profitierst du genau wie wir von einem Team aus schlauen und erfolgsorientierten Köpfen.

Interesse? Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei uns:
 Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung. Um es einfach zu halten, verzichten wir gerne auf ein Anschreiben, denn wir brauchen von dir nur: 
 


Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf,
Dein gewünschtes Eintrittsdatum,
Deine Gehaltsvorstellung
Und in einem Satz, was du von deinem Job bei taod erwartest.
 Bei Fragen kannst Du dich gerne an Natalie (01577-7534434) und Jeannine (01573-3248453) wenden. 
 
 Schon gewusst? Auf unserem Instagramprofil fr113nds geben wir Dir noch mehr Insights aus unserem Arbeitsalltag. 
 
 Schwerbehinderte werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

info_remote: Sport Alliance GmbH - Home Office - Remote
description:
Du willst in einem agilen und schnelllebigen Team in der FitTech-Branche etwas bewegen? Wie wäre es mit einer Mentalität, die deine Meinungen und Ideen schätzt? Wenn du zur Automatisierung der Data Pipelines beitragen und mit einem gleichgesinnten Team die besten Lösungen für unsere Kunden schaffen möchtest, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Sei ein Teil der digitalen Transformation der Fitnessbranche.

Tasks


Unterstütze bei der Entwicklung, Erstellung und Ausführung von Data Pipelines, unter anderem mit Apache Airflow und Apache Spark
Leiste deinen Beitrag zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung und Erweiterung unserer Datenarchitektur
Bringe neue Ideen ein und behalte dabei das große Ganze unserer Ziele im Auge
Lerne wie Du zusammen mit Experten aus verschiedenen Abteilungen datengesteuerte Anwendungen und Dienste für unsere marktführende Fitnessplattform entwickelst
Versetze die gesamte Organisation in die Lage, verwertbare Erkenntnisse aus unseren Daten zu gewinnen

Requirements


Den Wunsch qualitativ hochwertigen und produktionsgerechten Code zu erstellen
Gute SQL-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Python
Eine selbstorganisierte, strukturierte, konzentrierte sowie zielorientierte Arbeitsweise
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch und idealerweise auch in Deutsch

Benefits


Einen attraktiven Arbeitsplatz im Herzen von Hamburg und flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort möglich
Ein eigenes Fitnessstudio zur kostenlosen Nutzung, inklusive Personal Trainer und Physiotherapeut für alle Mitarbeiter
Unser eigenes CashBack Sportprogramm 'MySports', mit dem wir deine sportlichen Aktivitäten bezuschussen
Hohe Eigenverantwortung, schnelle Verantwortungsübernahme und Leads, die mit dir auf Augenhöhe kommunizieren
Versorgung mit Getränken, frischem Obst und Zwischenmahlzeiten
Ein attraktiver BAV-Zuschuss sowie eine subventionierte Nutzung von öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln in Hamburg
Flache Hierarchien und ein motiviertes und dynamisches Team

Klingt gut?

Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und bewirb dich gleich online bei uns.

Babbel is driven by a purpose: Creating mutual understanding through language. This means building an ecosystem of language learning offerings that helps people connect across cultures. Babbel, Babbel Live and Babbel for Business provide users with the most effective solution to be able to communicate with real people, in real situations. The key is a blend of humanity and technology.

More than 60,000 lessons across 14 languages are hand-crafted by 180+ linguists, with user behaviours continuously analysed to shape and tweak the learner experience. And it works: Studies with Yale University, City University of New York and Michigan State University prove its effectiveness. From headquarters in Berlin and New York, 750 people from more than 65 nationalities represent all the differences that make humans unique. Babbel is the most profitable language learning app worldwide, with more than 10 million subscriptions sold. For more information, visit www.babbel.com or download the apps in the App Store or Play Store.

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering and Analytics team in Berlin.

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Engineer, your mission will be to change the future of language learning while working in a stimulating environment. Working together with motivated colleagues, you will be collaborating and diving into different disciplines to broaden your knowledge in other fields of expertise as well as share your own. You will contribute to great architecture and build the base of easily extendable and well maintainable systems.

You will


Have a chance to shape our data architecture
Help us design and build scalable data services
Create and manage our databases and warehouses (MySQL, Snowflake, DynamoDB, Databricks Lakehouse)
Automate our infrastructure (AWS, Terraform, CDK)
Help us implement new, near real-time streaming pipelines
Participate in our knowledge sharing sessions - we are a learning company inside and out

You have


Good knowledge of AWS environment
Good command of Python
Familiarity with Terraform
Experience with Spark or Databricks Lakehouse Platform
Good understanding of relational (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. DynamoDB) databases

You're experienced with (at least one)


Implementing a ETL pipeline using Spark
Building a streaming data pipeline
Implementing complicated CI deployment scenarios
Scheduling complex data flows with Airflow or dbt
Building customer-facing data reports with tools such as QuickSight

Some perks of becoming a Babbelonian:

30 vacation days and flexible working hours
BVG card or Swapfiets bike
Jobbatical and Sabbatical options
Many internal & external learning opportunities to choose from
A yearly Learning & Development budget
Visa and relocation assistance
Full access to Babbel & Babbel Live classes
Modern office in the heart of buzzing Berlin equipped with a family, music, faith and nap room
Various internal communities to be part of including the Femgineers+, DEI Ambassadors, Accessibility & Disability Group and more

Join one of the fastest-growing education technology companies and contribute in making learning a whole new experience. And of course: get full access to our world-leading language learning content!

Diversity at Babbel

As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs. Please state your pronouns at the beginning of your application, and let us know if you’d like to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.

Sounds good? We are already looking forward hearing from you! Check out our jobs page, our blog, and our techblog!

Company Description
We are on the mission to set a new industry standard for business-to-business payments. Every day we process hundreds of thousands of payment transactions and accumulate a massive amount of data.
At TIS we want to build the best data driven payment platform solution in the market that is effective and scales well offering deep insights to our customers and internal stakeholders.
Your role
As a Senior Cloud Data Engineer you will design, implement, and maintain our cloud-native, business-critical big data platform solution with our internal and external customers as the backbone of our analytical data platform at TIS.
You will work aligned with the Data Platform team that is responsible for the core data architecture of TIS.

Job Description

Create and maintain robust and resilient ETL pipelines to process massive daily volumes of data.
Scale our data lake leveraging AWS cloud technology.
Promote and protect the integrity of data according to law and company rules.
Support the adoption of the Data Lake within TIS squads.

Qualifications

Strong background with at least one Hyperscaler (AWS, GCP, Azure). Preferred AWS, especially S3, Lambda, Glue, Athena, StepFunctions, IAM.
Familiar with RDBMS and/or data warehouse technologies.
Experiences with data processing pipelines and data governance.
Proficient with Python3 or JVM based language like Scala.
Experience in data protection and security topics.
Experience with automation of IaC using tools like Terraform.
Strong knowledge of professional software engineering skills (SOLID, Clean Code, Separation of Concerns).
Strong communication skills in English
About TIS
TIS is reimagining the world of enterprise payments through a cloud-based platform uniquely designed to help global organizations optimize outbound payments. Corporations, banks and business vendors leverage TIS to transform how they connect global accounts, collaborate on payment processes, execute outbound payments, analyze cash flow and compliance data, and improve critical outbound payment functions.
The TIS corporate payments technology platform helps businesses improve operational efficiency, lower risk, manage liquidity, gain strategic advantage – and ultimately achieve enterprise payment optimization.
We’re on a mission to set a new industry standard for business-to-business payments. Since 2010, TIS has been combining its treasury management heritage with cloud architecture and bank connectivity expertise to help global corporations, banks and consulting firms optimize outbound payment processes.
Working at TIS
As part of our culture, we pursue new ideas, we think big, embrace the impossible [INNOVATION] and we are free to make our own decisions [EMPOWERMENT] by communicating precisely [COLLABORATION] and supporting each other to exceed our high standards [EXCELLENCE].
We respect both our personal and professional life so they would amplify each other.
Flat hierarchies and direct contact to the management with regular feedback sessions in a very modern company what gives you a great opportunity for open collaborations and to be an “entrepreneur within the company” to play a critical role in TIS´s success story.
Working in our Product & Engineering division will let you experience best agile practices for software development and implementation. And, our value for quality would always challenge you to bring out the best of yourself.
And last, but not the least, we offer great remuneration and social package
Additional Information
Plamena Grigorova
Global Talent Acquisition & Onboarding Specialist
2 Pozitano Sq.
BGR -Sofia 1000
T +359 876 737 765
Get it touch!

Job Description:
We are looking for a Technical Data Engineer (d/f/m) within Airbus (Commercial Aircraft) located in Hamburg . You will be part of the international team within the Technical Data Community for aircraft maintenance/material documentation with a possible start date of July 2022 .
In this position, you are responsible to develop and deliver aircraft maintenance/material documentation to enable safe operation and an efficient accomplishment of maintenance operations for customers. You are in charge of documenting cabin and cargo design changes in technical data products and you support our customers who are operating and maintaining the aircraft.
Your core activity is to provide continuous and efficient support to our customers and to follow the production of technical data products for civil aircraft programs.
In this position, you are responsible to monitor the subcontracting management, ensuring on time - on cost and on quality delivery of technical data products.


Your main tasks and responsibilities:
You answer to customer queries with a strong focus on quality and on-time responds
You are responsible to manage and monitor subcontracting activities
You work in close cooperation with numerous interfaces
Validation and release of technical data is one of your core business
You participate in continuous improvement projects within the technical data perimeter for transnational process standardization/harmonization
Your educational background:
Engineer Aeronautical/ Mechanical degree or equivalent
Experience in subcontractor management
Affinity for new technologies or digitalization
Experience in technical publications/technical data domain is a clear plus
General knowledge of aircraft systems and/or aircraft maintenance experience would be advantageous
Experience in Manufacturing Engineering is a plus

Your hard skills and qualifications:
 Reading and understanding of technical drawings and engineering documents
Data analytics
IT-Tool knowledge (SAP, MS Office and G-Suite)
Your soft skills:
Analytical thinking and structured working methods are very important for you
To deliver good quality in your daily business is both essential and easy for you
You like to work autonomously
Practical problem solving is not just a phrase to you
You are a flexible person who is open for new working methods and new processes
You like to work in a transnational team and you are a real team player
You have an open and positive mindset and good communication skills
Your language skills:
English at negotiation level
German advanced level
French is a plus
Business travels:
This position involves a willingness to travel on an occasional basis (e.g. three times a year within Europe/Worldwide)
Your benefits:
Challenging tasks and unique high tech products and services
Good work-life balance in a big international company
Flexible working hours and working time compensation
Compatibility of family AND career
Attractive salary
Company pension and much more
Come and join our team!
Please apply for this position online via our Airbus Careers website ( www.airbus.com/careers ).
We kindly ask you to add your CV, your motivation letter incl. your salary expectations, your notice period and all relevant certificates. We give preference to disabled candidates with the same qualifications.
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Airbus Operations GmbH
Contract Type:
Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido

Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

In den Projekten unserer international agierenden Kunden arbeiten wir an vorderster Front. Big Data, Cloud Computing, IoT und moderne Webtechnologien sind unsere Spielwiese.

Hierfür suchen wir ab sofort tatkräftige Unterstützung für unser junges und dynamisches Team als ETL / Data Engineer (m/w/d).

Aufgaben

✓ Konzipieren & Implementieren von ETL / Data Pipelines mit gängigen ETL-Werkzeugen wie Informatica, Talend, KNIME, Oracle Data Integrator, SSIS oder mittels Skripting (Python, Impala, SQL)

✓ Mit welchen Tools und Sprachen Du für uns arbeitest, hängt von Dir ab: wir suchen die Kundenprojekte passend zu unseren Mitarbeitern aus, nicht umgekehrt!

Qualifikation

✓ Du bist offen für neue Technologien

✓ Du bist ein Teamplayer

✓ Du hast erste praktische Erfahrungen (oder mehr)

✓ Agil ist kein Fremdwort für Dich

✓ Idealerweise hast Du auch bereits Erfahrungen mit Big Data, CI / CD, Cloud, Git und Virtualisierung

Benefits

✓ Spannende Projekte

✓ Flexible Arbeitszeiten

✓ Bis zu 100% Homeoffice abhängig vom Projekt

✓ Umfangreiches Equipment, auch zur Privatnutzung

✓ Freie Getränke & Obst an unserem modernen Standort

✓ Wir sind ein Team ohne extra Hierarchie-Ebenen und komplizierte Prozesse, wie auch 4,9 ⭐ bei Kununu zeigen

Wir sind die committance AG: Eine mittelständische IT-Unternehmensberatung im Dreieck Köln Frankfurt Koblenz mit bewährtem Geschäftsmodell, jungem ehrgeizigem Team und Startup-Charakter.

Bei Fragen erreichst Du uns telefonisch oder per WhatsApp unter +49 2602 91927-0.

Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
You will be part of a team whose focus is to solve cutting edge AI / MLproblems and deploy models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. You will be working on designing the data infrastructure and solve other interesting bottlenecks that are challenging at Zoom's scale.

Responsibilities :
Design and implementation of data infrastructure for Machine Learning (ML) projects for our Research and Development Org
Assembling large, complex data sets and make the data more discoverable and easy to be used by the AI / ML team to support various Machine Learning initiatives. This includes unifying pre-processing work flows for data for different AI tasks.
Build and manage data sets, also by identifying and using suitable big data technologies, such as Apache Hadoop, DVC, Apache Drill,
Write tools to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Python, and SQL
Deploy, develop and maintain tools for data collection, data crawling and data annotation, e.g. as web applications using Django and Angular or similar technology.
Along with looking at external sources of data, build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.
Requirements :
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields
Experience in building and optimising data pipelines
DockerExperience with AWS cloud services, e.g. S3Experience working with large data volumesBroad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystemKnowledge of technologies like DVC or HadoopGood understanding of one or more of the following : Python, JavaScript, C++, Django or Angular

Please note : This job opportunity is based out of Karlsruhe, Germany

Dein Beitrag zu unserer Mission
Als Data Engineer (w/m/d) unterstützt du die Sunvigo GmbH im operativen Tagesgeschäft.
Konkret heißt das:
Du sorgst für den Aufbau, die Verbesserung und die Pflege unserer serverlosen AWS-Cloud-Architektur unter Verwendung von Best Practices ('Green-Field'-Projekt)
Du entwirfst, erstellst und verwaltest eine skalierbare Dateninfrastruktur für eine wachsende Anzahl von Datenquellen aus verschiedenen Teams bei Sunvigo
Du stehst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Analysten aus verschiedenen Teams, um deren Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und sie in die Lage zu versetzen, bessere Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen
Du arbeitest an spannenden neuen Projekten, die von neuen Datenpipelines aus IoT-Diensten bis hin zum Aufbau komplexer Tools für unsere Teams reichen können
Du definierst Standards für Arbeitsmethoden und -prozesse in Bezug auf Architektur, Tests, Dokumentation und mehr
Du arbeitest eng mit dem Product & Business Development- und dem IT-Team zusammen
Das bringst Du bereits mit
Du hast Erfahrung (>3 Jahre) mit verschiedenen Datenmanagementlösungen, Datenpipelines und Datenmodellierung
Du hast einen Bachelor-Abschluss in einem datenorientierten Studiengang wie Informatik, Informationswissenschaften, Ingenieurwissenschaften, Computerwissenschaften oder einem ähnlichen Gebiet
Du verfügst über gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Programmiersprache (z. B. Python) und SQL und bist in der Lage, hochwertigen, wartbaren Code zu erstellen
Du hast fundierte Erfahrung mit AWS-Cloud-Diensten (S3, Lambda, ECS, Glue, Athena) und API-Gateways
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und können sich schriftlich und mündlich mit technischen und nicht-technischen Kollegen verständigen
Du übernimmst gerne die Verantwortung für Projekte und ziehst diese bis zum Ende durch
Du hast den Ehrgeiz, dich ständig in der Welt der Business Intelligence weiterzubilden
Du bist sicher in den Sprachen Deutsch und Englisch, fließend in Schrift und Wort
Folgende Bewerbungsunterlagen benötigen wir von Dir: Lebenslauf, alle relevanten akademischen und Arbeitszeugnisse beginnend mit dem Abiturzeugnis. Ein Anschreiben von Dir ist nicht notwendig.
Das bieten wir Dir
Die Möglichkeit, nicht nur Geld zu verdienen und in einem coolen Startup zu arbeiten, sondern mit deiner Arbeit etwas wirklich Sinnvolles zu tun und einen Unterschied zu machen

+49 221 82828846
UNSERE MISSION – SONNENSTROM FÜR ALLE
Die Sonne ist eine unerschöpfliche Energiequelle. Sie zu nutzen ist der Schlüssel, um die größte Herausforderung unserer Generation zu lösen: den Klimawandel. Millionen von Hauseigentümern in Europa wollen Sonnenstrom vom eigenen Dach beziehen und könnten so einen wesentlichen Teil des europäischen Strombedarfs decken. Doch für viele Menschen ist die Nutzung von Sonnenstrom heute noch zu kompliziert und aufwändig.

Unsere Mission ist es, Sonnenstrom für alle zugänglich zu machen, indem wir die Nutzung für Endkunden als erstes Unternehmen in Deutschland radikal vereinfachen. Wir betreiben und vernetzen Solaranlagen auf den Dächern unserer Kunden zu virtuellen Kraftwerken, die unsere Kunden-Community mit Sonnenstrom versorgt – ganz einfach aus der Steckdose.

Willst du zusammen mit uns eine nachhaltigere Energieversorgung für alle aufbauen und deinen Teil zum Kampf gegen den Klimawandel beitragen?

Join us

CHRONEXT (www.chronext.de) ist die erste E-Commerce-Adresse für Luxusuhren. Wir haben bereits mehr als 100.000 Uhrenliebhaber weltweit mit einer großen Auswahl direkt verfügbarer Traumuhren begeistert und wachsen weiter. Dazu verknüpfen wir das Beste aus Digitalem und Stationärem und gestalten so den Uhrenhandel neu. Mit unserem Büro in Köln und weiteren Büros wie Zug, London und Hong Kong sind wir weltweit aktiv und expandieren weiter. Genauso international wie unsere Standorte, sind die Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten. Knapp 30 Nationen mit verschiedenem kulturellem Hintergrund bilden das Team CHRONEXT.

Für die Erweiterung unseres Teams suchen wir am Standort Köln zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Vollzeit einen

SENIOR DATA ENGINEER (M/W/D)

DEINE VERANTWORTUNG


Du kümmerst Dich um unser derzeitiges Data Warehouse und verantwortest die Qualität unserer Daten
Du entwirfst und planst unsere zukünftige BI-Architektur in einem kleinen Team und in enger Zusammenarbeit mit der Geschäftsleitung
Du arbeitest eng mit Business Stakeholdern zusammen, um diese zu schulen und mit maßgeschneiderten BI-Lösungen zu versorgen
Du kommunizierst die Arbeitsergebnisse des BI-Bereichs in die Firma hinein
Du stellst für dein Team jeden Tag einen Mehrwert, indem du deine Mitarbeiter förderst, Ihnen Entwicklungsperspektiven aufzeigst und Sie auf Ihrem Weg begleitest

DEIN PROFIL - BEI UNS ZÄHLT, WIE DU TICKST.


Du hast mindestens 5 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung im BI-Umfeld und hast bereits ein kleines Team geführt
Du bringst eine ausgeprägte Affinität für Daten und ein sehr gutes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen mit
Du bist vertraut mit modernen Cloud-Technologien (insb. AWS) und hast bereits erfolgreich BI-Projekte ganzheitlich implementiert
Du weist sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python, SQL und mindestens einer weiteren Programmiersprache auf. Versionskontrolle mit Git ist für dich selbstverständlich
Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrungen mit Containeranwendungen (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD Workflows, OLAP Datenbanken (insb. Redshift) und Scheduling Lösungen (Airflow)
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch

Ein dynamisches und stark wachsendes Unternehmen mit internationaler Ausrichtung, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten & einer hybriden Home Office Regelung, einem hochmotivierten Team und kurzen Entscheidungswegen, sowie eine spannende und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit mit breitem Gestaltungsspielraum

We are looking for (Senior) Data Engineer to join our Local Shops tribe. Build with a superb team of tech experts the next generation of E-Commerce quick-delivery services. Together we empower our vendor partners worldwide (50+ countries) to scale their businesses online. If you are ready for the latest-generation E-Commerce adventure, eager to solve tech challenges and deliver your solutions to customers around the globe, an international tech-company is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!
About Local Shops Tribe
We are a highly motivated team of tech experts building the best-in-class local shops delivery platform. The local shops tribe is developing solutions (assortment, pricing, promotions, fulfillment, inventory management, sales reports and insights, prediction models, etc.) so that our global vendors can sell their products on our consumer facing platforms (Foodpanda, PedidosYa, Yemeksepeti, Talabat, more). Our vendor customers - from corner shops to big supermarkets - expect a high quality of services which are accessible with mobile, web and api interfaces. Our autonomous (“we build it, we run it”) cross-functional squads deliver fast, often and data driven so that we ensure continuous improvements along the customer journey.
Join our Local Shops tribe now and become a Delivery Hero!
Your Mission:
Work on products that help our local shop vendors to digitize their businesses and sell their products on our customer facing platforms
Work within our teams to build data products and data mesh architectures
Implement best practice data quality assurance mechanisms
Enable more efficient ad hoc queries and analysis
Build data pipelines to feed machine learning models and decision engines for real-time and large-scale offline use cases
Work closely with analytics and product leads to scale data
Ensure consistency between various platform, operational, and analytic data sources to enable faster and more efficient detection and resolution of issues
Analyze our applications performance and understand customer behavior
Contribute to our tribe architecture and support to strategically evolve our systems landscape so that it can serve our business and customer needs
Collaborate with backend developers, frontend developers, mobile developers, data experts, UX/UI designers, product managers to continuously improve functionality, usability, reliability and performance of vendor facing applications
Your Heroic Skills:
Strong passion for top-notch software development and delivery
High sense of responsibility to run software for millions of users: we build it, we run it
Good skill in communicating with stakeholders
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
4+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, data science, or related field with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets
Experienced with SQL
Very experienced with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Good knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles
Good understanding of data management fundamentals and data storage principles
Knowledge of distributed systems as it pertains to data storage and computing
Knowledge of object-oriented concepts and design patterns
Good skills in writing clean code and exception handling
Experienced with testing frameworks and testing methodologies (e.g. tdd)
Experienced with CI/CD pipelines to deploy fast and often
Good understanding of logging, monitoring and alerting system
Experienced with agile methodologies and a very good understanding of its importance for high performing team
A strong motivation to help colleagues across team borders to foster a healthy tech culture
Proficient english language skills
Why Delivery Hero?
Develop your skills with your educational budget for conferences and external trainings.
Exchange ideas and meet fellow developers at regular meetups, in our active guilds and during our Developer Exchange Program.
Join company parties, hackathons, cultural and sports events.
English is our working language, and our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe, working in diverse, cross-cultural teams.
Save responsibly with our corporate pension scheme.
Daily fruits, cereals, beverages, tea and coffee in our lounges.
Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our inhouse trainings.
Enjoy massages, get your haircut in the office, join our free yoga classes or take a timeout in our nap room.
About us:
Delivery Hero Tech is playing an exceptional role in the large growth of our company. Our Tech teams leverage a diverse stack to create cutting-edge solutions which cover the full customer experience - starting with a great online search experience and ending with a real-time delivery at your doorstep.
Read about the latest updates from our Tech & Product teams on our blog.
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global on-demand delivery platform. We have grown rapidly from inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network and we’re now innovating and creating new verticals such as groceries, pharmacies, flowers and other convenience articles in multiple markets.
Our awesome international team already operates in 40+ countries worldwide and we are exclusively looking for the best people to join us on our mission to ‘always deliver an amazing experience.’ If you’re an enthusiastic problem solver and hungry for a new adventure, an exciting job and multicultural workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!
At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.
Have we caught your attention? If you are looking for an environment where our company DNA is defined by our values, please send us your CV.

Work location: FULLY REMOTE within Poland

(with possibility to use our offices in Zielona Gora or Warsaw)

FULL-TIME

WHAT YOU WILL DO

As our Data Warehouse Developer you are responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data warehouse, which is just coming into existence. On top you are accountable to gather business requirements to meet business analysis and to ensure proper functioning of Business Intelligence team. You are expected to document all implemented ETL’s, the structure, data sources and procedures. You are responsible for monitoring and reporting on data quality, investigating and troubleshooting causes of incompatibility between applications which collect and utilize the company's data.

What you can expect:
Collaborating with various teams across the company to align development work to enterprise data strategies
Designing and implementing ETL procedured (Azure Data Factory) for intake of data from both internal and outside sources and ensuring the data is verified and its quality is checked
Maintaining and developing data marts, data objects and data models
Ensuring data integrity, performance of quality, and resolution of data load failures
Carrying out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis
Discovering new and creative ways to improve our day-to-day business with focus on efficiency and scalability

WHAT YOU BRING IN

Minimum of 5+ years of relevant professional experience
2+ years of experience with Azure SQL DB, Azure Data Factory and related Azure services
Experience working in reporting and analytical tools (best: Power BI)
Advanced knowledge and understanding of data warehouse concepts
Proficiency in ETL development
Ability to design and conceive solution frameworks independently
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Ability to obtain, analyze and synthesize information from multiple sources
Excellent problem-solving, analytical and critical thinking skill
Proficiency in English (both, verbal and written)

Additional qualifications

C# knowledge as a plus

WHAT WE PROVIDE

The DEVELOPMENT of each exponDOer is of the upmost importance to us:

You will be assigned to a buddy, who will support, advise and simply be there during there for you during the first 4 to 6 weeks of the onboarding.
Your opinion makes a difference, and you will help us to shape with us expondo’s future.
We provide free user accounts for both Udemy for Business and Babbel to promote your constant development.

We offer all our employees the FREEDOM to work how it is best suited to their needs:

Whether it will be remote, from the office or a hybrid of both, we will support any decision made and provide the needed hardware to work in comfort.
If you decide to work at one our locations, all the recommended protective measures are in place for a safe working environment.
Your working hours will be flexible.

In our CULTURE we respect our employees’ needs and care for each other:

We care about everyone’s physical and mental health, and that is why we provide the best possible conditions for a sustainable work-life balance.
We also grant expondo sponsored psychological support for all our employees around the clock.
You will be a part of a diverse team in which good humour, mutual support and respect are highly valued.

The expondo group is an international e-commerce company with more than 400 employees. We are a renowned manufacturer and online retailer of niche products created by experts for experts, operating in Europe and having locations in Germany, Poland, Hong Kong and China. Our focus is to provide our customers with an appropriate and scalable service.

To be a part of the extended expondo family is to be a part of an ambitious and dynamic global company. What lies ahead in terms of future is in the hands of our employees. It is their ideas, vision, skills, and talents which allow for us to succeed in this fast paced, globalizing world. It is the trust, partnership, and commitment that we have for each other which is the key to achieving further success, as we move forward together by owning our actions.

It’s time to get it done with expondo and the time is now.

Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated.


If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register, even if you feel that this particular opportunity is not the right fit for you.


Company Name: Contentful

Job Description

About the opportunity
At Contentful we collect and centralize all data from the different components of our microservice based platform. We enrich the data of our platform with the wealth of information that comes from Salesforce, Zendesk, and several other services that we use to interact and communicate with our users. As we grow we add services to our data aggregation pipeline and curate the collected data.
As a Data Engineer at Contentful, you will work on the Data Pipeline across the entire Contentful Stack together with our Infrastructure, Backend and Frontend engineers to ensure that data is consistently flowing and that it is collected in a form that allows for the generation of insights.
You will also be responsible for continually iterating and innovating our Data Warehouse, Data Lake and ETL procedures around them ensuring that the flow of new data doesn’t deteriorate performances. On the topics of ETL and data modeling, you will work closely with Data Analysts to understand in-depth the performance of domain models and analytical requirements.
Ideally, you have already worked on the Business Intelligence infrastructure of an online business and you’re looking for a challenge in a company that puts data-driven decisions at the center of its product and business.
What to expect?
Develop and maintain Data Pipeline Applications (data collectors that live within or outside the Contentful core infrastructure)
Maintain and evolve the Data Warehouse (AWS Redshift) and Data Lake (Athena) ensuring appropriate performance
Maintain and evolve ETL services to enrich data model and serve analytics and generation of insights using tools such as Airflow
What you need to be successful?
Solid, professional knowledge of Python, and/or Golang with TypeScript being an advantage
You can build applications to help and support data collection in a microservice architecture
Comfortable with Docker, as we are using it extensively
Experience with Athena, AWS Redshift and classic databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL)
You are familiar with AWS services and concepts (VPC, IAM)
Experience using Segment is considered a plus and knowledge of Airflow, Kubernetes and Terraform is a strong benefit
Experience with PubSub/Stream data RabbitMQ, AWS Kinesis, Kafka, Looker is considered a plus
You have strong SQL modeling and optimization knowledge for different analytics workloads and scenarios
Experience with ETL processing pipelines and design in batch and near real time
What’s in it for you?
Join an ambitious tech company reshaping the way people build digital products.
We set you up for success, equipping you with the latest and greatest hardware
Enjoy a full range of events, including workshops, Contentful-hosted meetups, guest speakers and team activities. Meet your team members from across the globe at our annual offsite.
Get fit! We offer a variety of health and fitness classes and a discount on Urban Sports Club.
Use your personal education budget to improve your skills and grow in your career. Join a free German class or one of our many internal learning initiatives!
We value our employees health and safety. Our teams are working remotely during the COVID pandemic.
Plus, Contentful socks! Oh yeah!
Who are we?
Contentful powers digital experiences for 28% of the Fortune 500 companies and thousands of global brands. Our content platform unifies content in a single hub, structures it for use in any digital channel and integrates seamlessly with hundreds of tools through open APIs. It lets developers and content creators work in parallel, increasing team efficiency and happiness. Companies such as Co-op, Spotify, Bang & Olufsen, N26 and Swarovski use Contentful to build their mobile and web products, voice controlled apps and more.
We’re growing rapidly and are backed by over $150 million in funding from top-tier venture capital firms like Sapphire Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, General Catalyst and Benchmark.
More than 350 people from 70 nations contribute their energy and creativity to Contentful, working from hubs in Berlin, San Francisco and distributed locations around the world.
“Everyone is welcome here” — it’s a celebrated component of our culture. At Contentful, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. We look forward to your application!
By clicking “Apply for this job,” I acknowledge that I have read the “Contentful’s Candidate Privacy Notice”, and hereby acknowledge and accept the collection, processing, use, and storage of my personal data as described therein.

post_title: Commercial Data Engineer, Group eCommerce - eCT
description:
Company Description
Handling billions of transactions annually, Nets is among the top payment processors in Europe. We keep a tight focus on making it even easier and more intuitive for our customers to handle digital payments and related services. This has made us a trusted partner to more than 700,000 merchant outlets, including 140,000 online merchant outlets, more than 260,000 enterprises and over 250 banks across Europe.
Changing the future of payments takes strong personalities
At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to change the future of payments, it’s not just skills and ambition that gets the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business, and colleague. What powers you at work?

Job Description
You’ll be powering eCommerce
As a Commercial Data Engineer, you’ll be building the foundation of our commercial data infrastructure; something that will allow us to unleash the power of data and derive insights that will help us steer Nets to double-digit growth in eCommerce. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll even find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.
Your key tasks and responsibilities are:
As our Commercial Data Engineer your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain the centralized data platform. The job includes tasks like:
Build and maintain large scale data pipelines
Identify, collect, and integrate data from various sources by building high quality data pipelines for analytical purposesSet up testing and tooling to continuously improve data quality
Create value for Group eCom by identifying opportunities and enabling data-driven decision-making
Make a significant impact by being one of the key players in developing high-quality European Commercial reporting

Qualifications
Skills, ambition, and that little personal twist make you succeed
Your professional skills and experience form most of your qualifications, but it’s also your personality that makes the difference at Nets. You are / you have:
Skilled with formulating clear problem statements, structuring complex problems, and identifying logical work packages to answer them
The ability to communicate complex topics in a simple manner
Self-starter who is not afraid to take the steering wheel and lead on projects
 A positive team player who is structured, pragmatic and enjoys getting things done effectively
Your qualifications include:
You have at least two years of experience working with data platform engineering or the likes of it.
You either have an education in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or Data Science or have experience that is equal from “The School of Life”
Experience with some parts of the tech stack is a must. That being Python, SQL, batch and data streaming tooling, Data Ops, CI/CD, Cloud architecture, or other aspects that will ensure that we can complete the mission from a tech point of view.
Knowledge of working on remote servers like Linux
Familiarity with processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management
Additional Information
Apply now to power your career
Apply with your CV as soon as possible and join our fantastic team, and if you want, you can attach a short video clip.
You can meet more of our personalities by visiting our careers page: Meet some of our personalities
We conduct background checks on relevant candidates through our partner Semac, www.semac.no

Die Erfahrung eines etablierten Unternehmens mit dem Mindset eines Start-Ups – eine Position mit hoher Eigenverantwortung und Gestaltungsfreiheit.
Zahlreiche interne und externe Fortbildungen.
Unbefristete Vollzeitstelle mit viel Raum für Entwicklung.

Kompetent, persönlich und initiativ - das ist die top itservices AG: Als einer der führenden IT-Dienstleister bringen wir top Fach- und Führungskräfte sowie Spezialisten zum passenden Unternehmen. Für Festanstellungen, auf Zeit oder für Projekte. Dabei bieten wir einen ganzheitlichen Experten-Service. Wir nehmen uns Zeit, Sie kennenzulernen und coachen und navigieren Sie auf Wunsch durch Ihren beruflichen Weg.  Nehmen Sie die Herausforderung an und besetzen Sie zusammen mit uns eine vakante Position als Big Data Engineer (m/w/d).
 Big Data Engineer (m/w/d)
 Berlin, München, Dortmund, Köln, Frankfurt, Hannover, Mannheim, Dresden | Festanstellung | Ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung
 Ihre Aufgaben:

 Entwurf, Erstellung und Pflege von datengetriebenen Anwendungen, Big Data Pipelines und Infrastrukturen auf cloudbasierten Datenplattformen
 Konzeption, Design und Entwicklung von digitalen Lösungen im Bereich Analytics und AI
 Definition und Anwendung von Best Practices im Bereich Big Data Analytics
 Aufbereitung, Bereinigung und Modellierung von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten
 Identifizierung von Big Data Use Cases und Klassifizierung geeigneter Technologien
 Evaluierung und Beratung zu modernen Data Plattform Architekturen


 Ihr Profil:

 Expertise in der Realisierung und Wartung datenintensiver Applikationen und Data Pipelines
 Know-how gängiger Big Data Technologien (z. B. Cassandra, Kafka, Hadoop / Data Lakes, Spark) sowie in ETL / ETL Tools und verteilten Systemen
 Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung und Datenverwaltung sowie in Datenbankabfragen (Data Warehouses, SQL, NoSQL)
 Kenntnisse in der Automatisierung und im Deployment mittels Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery und Infrastructure as Code (puppet, chef, ansible, Terraform)
 Routiniert in mindestens einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache (Java, C#, Python oder Scala)
 Wissen über moderne Datenintegrationsprozesse und Dateninfrastrukturen
 Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Stärke sowie Scrum Methodenkompetenz und DevOps Mindset


 Ihre Chance:

 Transparenter und schneller Bewerbungsprozess mit einer verbindlichen Rückmeldung binnen 14 Tagen
 Vertrauensvolle & persönliche Begleitung zu jeder Zeit – Partnerschaftlichkeit ist die Basis unserer Zusammenarbeit
 Zugang und Vernetzung mit interessanten Kunden, renommierten Unternehmen und zukunftsorientierten Projekten
 Individuelle Beratung und bedarfsgerechte Vermittlung


 Bewerben:  Erkennen Sie sich wieder? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Vorzugsweise über unser Online-Formular oder unter Angabe der Kennziffer 999-1017 per E-Mail an Frau Christina Wolff. Erste Informationswünsche und Fragen beantwortet Ihnen Frau Christina Wolff gern telefonisch unter +49 351 207609-21. Wir freuen uns bald von Ihnen zu hören!
 Radeberger Straße 1 01099 Dresden +49 351 207609-23

Startdatum

Ab Sofort

Die Position ist an den Standorten Berlin, Leipzig, Köln, Frankfurt a.M., Stuttgart oder München zu besetzen!

Deine Aufgaben

Deine Aufgaben als Senior Data Engineer bei at sind vielfältig! Einen kleinen Überblick findest du hier:


Entwerfe, entwickle, teste, debugge, automatisiere, dokumentiere und pflege Datenpipelines
Wähle die Technologien für die Implementierung von Data Analytics Use Cases
Entwickle Datenpipelines auf Basis von Cluster-Architekturen
Visualisiere Daten für verschiedene Zwecke
Bewerte die Datenqualität und führe wenn nötig eine Datenbereinigung durch

Dein Profil

Als Senior Data Engineer bei at solltest du folgendes mitbringen:


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Computer Science, Data Science oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mind. vier Jahre Berufserfahrung als Software Engineer, Softwareentwickler, Data Engineer oder ähnlichem Berufsfeld
Sehr gute Kenntnisse der Programmiersprachen Python, Java oder Scala
Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich der Cloud Technologien z.B. Azure oder AWS
Fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit Hadoop-Ecosystemen
Reisebereitschaft im Rahmen einer Consulting Tätigkeit
Idealerweise flüssige Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

Data bewegt uns! Was dich auf deiner persönlichen Journey erwartet, findest du hier:


Dein Start bei uns: Intensiver Onboarding- & Einarbeitungsprozess, unser AT Buddy Programm und individueller Einarbeitungsplan, Schulungen & Workshops für einen optimalen Start sowie Guthaben in unserem internen Merchandise-Shop
Deine Entwicklungs- und Karrieremöglichkeiten: Schulungen und Zertifizierungen innerhalb unserer DataAcademy, jährliche Mitarbeitergespräche zur individuellen Weiterentwicklung, Wissensaustausch innerhalb des Unternehmens, Zugang zu E-Learning-Plattformen
Unsere Unternehmenskultur: Stark wachsendes Unternehmen, einzigartige Teamatmosphäre, direkte Kommunikationswege, flache Hierarchien bis zu unserem CEO Alex, unterstützendes und sehr wertschätzendes Miteinander, enge und vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit, offene Feedbackkultur
Unsere Benefits: Qualitrain Firmenfitness sowie interne Sportkurse, Jobrad, Mental Health & Wellbeing Support durch nilo.health, Weiterbildungsbudget, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Vertrauensarbeitszeit mit flexibler Arbeitszeitgestaltung, hybrides Arbeitsmodell, at-Library, kostenlose Getränke, frisches Obst, Firmenevents und vieles mehr!

Ansprechpartner

Marie-Luise Thurow, Senior HR Manager: marie-luise.thurow@alexanderthamm.com

post_title: Technical Data Engineer - BNP Paribas Fortis
description:
If you’d like a career as a Technical Data Engineer at a major bank like BNP Paribas Fortis, but you don’t have the necessary knowledge and skills yet, we have great news for you. How would you like to get paid to learn the ins and outs of data engineering?
That’s right: we’re offering a data engineering learning program in which you acquire the necessary hard and soft skills to become a successful data professional AND two years of on-the-job learning at BNPPF with a paycheck from day 1!

As a Technical Data Engineer at BNPPF, you:
elaborate and document the chosen solutions, translating the functional requirements into technical specifications
work on new development or maintenance of code (using Informatica PowerCenter, Oracle, Kafka, Spark, Scala, Hadoop,…)
perform code quality review of your colleagues
support test management in the execution of tests (including bug fixing)
You’re interested in the financial sector and passionate about data. You’re enthusiastic and eager to learn. You’re available from July onwards to embark upon a learning journey within a high-paced environment that places ambition and fun high on its list of priorities.
You take end-to-end ownership of your tasks and activities
You have an Agile mindset: you’re a team player, you’re open to feedback, you enjoy contributing to cross-functional projects
You’re result-oriented, a problem solver, with a proactive attitude: you tackle problems immediately
You have an excellent knowledge of English and can preferably speak Dutch and/or French fluently as well
Exellys isn’t your typical recruiting or consulting agency, we’re a different breed. We are a tech talent incubator, which is every bit as cool as it sounds. Here’s what you can expect from us:
You’ll join an awesome community and enter one of our Smart Programs , based on where you are in your career and where you want to go. Did we mention you’ll get a personal coach as well?
Next to a generous monthly salary , you'll receive a company car or a flexible mobility budget and tons of other benefits (pension, daily compensations, etc.)
You’ll spend most of the time at (y)our client’s , except for regular Exellys trainings, fun events, tribe meet-ups, after works, knowledge sharing sessions, etc.
After two years of coaching and upskilling from Exellys, you’ll get the opportunity to join (y)our client’s organization as an internal employee . Or if you prefer to stay with us, you could explore our follow-up Smart Programs as well.
Are you interested in learning more about the job? About Exellys? About our remuneration package or training programs? Hit the apply button and we’ll tell you all about it. Don’t hesitate, just go for it!
