Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewellery brand?

Build high quality data and BI products on our Azure Paas data platform
At Pandora, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product owners, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing scalable data products on our global data platform together with other smart engineers in the organization.

Further to this you will:
Work closely with your colleagues within a product team to design scalable, efficient and stable products
Work closely with product owners to build and deliver features designed to support PANDORA to drive commercial business cases and efficiencies within reporting and analytics and other data driven use cases
Create and maintain high quality data pipeline architecture
Obtain relevant business and system knowledge to convert requirements efficiently to technical design documentation and conceptual data modelling
Ingest large, complex data sets, automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, improve data quality, etc.
Own your data products and track continuous stability and benefits
Live and breathe “build-once-consume-many” culture in which we enable others to use our data products for maximum value-add
Work with stakeholders and teams to assist with data-related technical challenges
Follow best practice and existing guidelines but also push the limits
Thrive in a fast paced environment and you get motivated by challenges as a true problem solver.

We are on a journey from IaaS based Microsoft/QV solutions to Azure PaaS with use of well-known tools and solutions like ADF, Data lake, Synapse, Analysis Services and DataBricks.

Team player passionate about data and engineering
Some would say that you are a real team player, product oriented, can-do attitude and with good stakeholder management skills. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, you are a confident communicator and have the ability to explain your solution design and tailor the message according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:
Relevant education in within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, or Statistics
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in Software engineering role with focus on data
Proven experience with ADF, Data Lake, Synapse, T/U-SQL, DataBricks, MDS, DAX, PowerBI and SQL Server
Experience with at least one object oriented or functional/scripting languages – Java, Scala, Python etc.
DevOps and CI/CD focus
Hands-on with git and coding best practice
Unit testing
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL
Experience with datawarehousing, dimensional modelling and cubes
Experience in building, and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and datasets
Experience in working with Azure, AWS or other cloud providers
Designed, built and delivered production ready data products at an enterprise level
Highly proficient in English and able to communicate with all levels
Agile mindset and experience of Scrum

It’s a plus if you have worked with:
Big data: Spark, Hadoop
Data pipeline and workflow tools: Airflow
Infrastructure: Kubernetes and Helm; we’re using Airflow running on Kubernetes
Stream-processing systems: Kafka or Spark Streaming

Your new team
You will be an essential part of the data engineering organization and Pandora’s extended Data & Analytics community. You will work within the data product engineering team in a virtual and agile based organization.
As we are a growing team, you will have the chance to influence our culture and working tools and work together with other data engineers, front-end engineers, architects, scrum masters, product owners and much more from Europe, India and Thailand.

Icing on the cake
You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora
Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 7,400 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 26,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated sales of DKK 19.0 billion (EUR 2.5 billion) in 2020.

(Senior) Data Engineer – BI & Advanced Analytics
Our passion at Lundbeck’s is to restore brain health so every person can be their best. By developing innovative treatments, we improve the lives of people and to better do so, we are expanding our capabilities within Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics. If you have great programming and problem-solving skills along with a love for data, we would love to meet you.
Join our team of data evangelists and take part in the journey of restoring brain health
As our new (Senior) Data Engineer you will join the BI & Advanced Analytics team currently consisting of 11 highly engaged colleagues. We bring products and services related to Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and Advanced Analytics to our more than 5,500 colleagues around the world with the aim of democratizing data to deliver insights and drive performance. We are part of Digital Delivery in Global IT and we support Lundbeck’s full value chain – from early research, to development, production, sales, and supporting functions.
Lundbeck offers a great workplace that is based on a flat structure, forming a collaborative working environment based on respect and equality. We employ dedicated colleagues and encourage continuous development. Together, we create the ideal conditions for you and your job, so we can create better conditions for patients.
Together, we are creating a brighter future for people living with brain diseases. That is our promise to each other and to the world.
Your role and key responsibilities
We are on a data mesh inspired journey to set data free and transform the culture of working with data in Lundbeck. We are building Lundbeck's next generation data platform and envision a modular data stack built on modern technology in a domain-oriented architecture. Every brain in the game is needed and we are now looking for the next great data engineer to join our growing team. Responsibilities include:
Build Lundbeck’s future data capabilities in cross-functional teams
Work closely with data scientists and -analysts as well as other stakeholders in Line of Business to translate defined needs into analytical capabilities
Work closely with data scientists and other stakeholders in Line of Business to translate defined needs into analytical capabilities
Create and maintain data pipeline architecture based on business needs and objectives
Develop and maintain the design, development and automation of ETL flows
Collaborate with colleagues in Global IT to help shape Lundbeck’s modern data platform, heavily influenced by the concept of data mesh
Evolve and promote the use of the newly established digital data platform
Help enforce data principles and best practices to increase the value of data throughout Lundbeck – such as the “FAIR Data Principles”
At as change agent between Global IT and Line of Business to continuously increase value of the collaboration
You will report to the Head of BI & Advanced Analytics. The position is based in our Headquarters in Valby, Copenhagen.
Qualification
The preferred candidate has the following personal and professional qualifications:
Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or similar
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a Software engineering role with focus on data
Proficiency in one or more programming languages, preferably SQL and exposure to DBT data transformation tool
Hands-on experience with Snowflake cloud data warehousing
Hands-on experience with Amazon AWS cloud and related services (S3, Lambda, Glue, Athena, AppFlow, etc.)
Experience with data ingestion frameworks and CDC (and tools like Fivetran or Qlik Replicate)
Experience with source control systems such as GitHub
Data catalogue and governance
Data pipeline orchestrating and monitoring
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum
DevOps and CI/CD, including infrastructure-as-code
Great interpersonal and communication skills
It’s considered a plus if you have experience with
NoSQL and graph databases
Python or R programming and machine learning platforms like AWS SageMaker
Data stream-processing systems like Kafka
Kubernetes infrastructure
Domain-specific knowledge of pharmaceutical Production systems (MES, LIMS, SAP), Commercial systems (Veeva CRM, Salesforce CDP and Marketing Cloud, and IQVIA), or clinical development and research informatics.
Want to learn more?
For further information, please contact Head of BI & Advanced Analytics, Stefan Holm, on or +45 30833048. Your application and CV should not be sent via email.
We also recommend that you have a look at our website, LinkedIn, and Instagram.
Sounds interesting?
Please click on the apply button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis and must be received no later than May 13th, 2022.

post_title: Commercial Data Engineer, Group eCommerce - eCT
description:
Company Description
Handling billions of transactions annually, Nets is among the top payment processors in Europe. We keep a tight focus on making it even easier and more intuitive for our customers to handle digital payments and related services. This has made us a trusted partner to more than 700,000 merchant outlets, including 140,000 online merchant outlets, more than 260,000 enterprises and over 250 banks across Europe.
Changing the future of payments takes strong personalities
At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to change the future of payments, it’s not just skills and ambition that gets the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business, and colleague. What powers you at work?

Job Description
You’ll be powering eCommerce
As a Commercial Data Engineer, you’ll be building the foundation of our commercial data infrastructure; something that will allow us to unleash the power of data and derive insights that will help us steer Nets to double-digit growth in eCommerce. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll even find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.
Your key tasks and responsibilities are:
As our Commercial Data Engineer your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain the centralized data platform. The job includes tasks like:
Build and maintain large scale data pipelines
Identify, collect, and integrate data from various sources by building high quality data pipelines for analytical purposes
Set up testing and tooling to continuously improve data quality
Create value for Group eCom by identifying opportunities and enabling data-driven decision-making
Make a significant impact by being one of the key players in developing high-quality European Commercial reporting

Qualifications
Skills, ambition, and that little personal twist make you succeed
Your professional skills and experience form most of your qualifications, but it’s also your personality that makes the difference at Nets. You are / you have:
Skilled with formulating clear problem statements, structuring complex problems, and identifying logical work packages to answer them
The ability to communicate complex topics in a simple manner
Self-starter who is not afraid to take the steering wheel and lead on projects
A positive team player who is structured, pragmatic and enjoys getting things done effectively
Your qualifications include:
You have at least two years of experience working with data platform engineering or the likes of it.
You either have an education in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or Data Science or have experience that is equal from “The School of Life”
Experience with some parts of the tech stack is a must. That being Python, SQL, batch and data streaming tooling, Data Ops, CI/CD, Cloud architecture, or other aspects that will ensure that we can complete the mission from a tech point of view.
Knowledge of working on remote servers like Linux
Familiarity with processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management
Additional Information
Apply now to power your career
Apply with your CV as soon as possible and join our fantastic team, and if you want, you can attach a short video clip.
You can meet more of our personalities by visiting our careers page: Meet some of our personalities
We conduct background checks on relevant candidates through our partner Semac, www.semac.no

Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
You will be part of a team whose focus is to solve cutting edge AI / MLproblems and deploy models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. You will be working on designing the data infrastructure and solve other interesting bottlenecks that are challenging at Zoom's scale.

Responsibilities :
Design and implementation of data infrastructure for Machine Learning (ML) projects for our Research and Development Org
Assembling large, complex data sets and make the data more discoverable and easy to be used by the AI / ML team to support various Machine Learning initiatives. This includes unifying pre-processing work flows for data for different AI tasks.
Build and manage data sets, also by identifying and using suitable big data technologies, such as Apache Hadoop, DVC, Apache Drill,
Write tools to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Python, and SQL
Deploy, develop and maintain tools for data collection, data crawling and data annotation, e.g. as web applications using Django and Angular or similar technology.
Along with looking at external sources of data, build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.
Requirements :
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields
Experience in building and optimising data pipelines
DockerExperience with AWS cloud services, e.g. S3Experience working with large data volumesBroad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystemKnowledge of technologies like DVC or HadoopGood understanding of one or more of the following : Python, JavaScript, C++, Django or Angular

Please note : This job opportunity is based out of Karlsruhe, Germany

Elements Global Services is an award-winning HR Technology and Services Company revolutionizing the way employers expand and manage employees internationally. Our mission is simple. To simplify global expansion through a revolutionary technology that removes the barriers of globalization to give our customers the speed to market to EXPAND their business, ONBOARD employees, MANAGE compliance, and PAY worldwide! Global expansion is becoming more and more a part of the modern workplace, and with that comes things like remote work and spread-out teams. As Elements is a truly global company, we take care of our client’s employees worldwide. From Chicago to Manila, from Johannesburg to Delhi and Hong Kong, we provide top-class benefits to all the employees we serve every day. With offices all around the world and teams spread out between multiple time zones, you too can benefit from the “Glocal” team strategy, giving our employees the flexibility, they need to do their very best work the best way they can.


Position Overview

A revolution cannot be done alone, and we need the best and brightest talent to continue our growth into the new modern workplace. We are looking to expand our team by hiring a new Senior Data Engineer a team player who is ready to make the role their own and bring their own ideas and innovations to the table. Reporting to the Director of Software Development you will be supporting our Product & Technology team by architecting and building Analytics tools based on Data Science and Machine Learning capabilities that provide insights to empower businesses to be successful and reduce risks.


Key Responsibilities

Translate business, analytics and reporting requirements into scalable solutions
Lead mid- and low- level design efforts
Design and build data analytics and reporting platform in the cloud
Develop automated, scalable, near real-time data processing pipelines
Implement data quality gate to ensure the accuracy of ingested data
Mentor junior and medior members of team to follow best practices. Conduct code reviews

About You

You have a bachelor’s degree in STEM
You have 5+ years of data engineering experience
You already led a team of software/data engineers or mentored/supervised junior engineers
You feel comfortable in an agile environment, where features were delivered following the CI/CD best practices
You have prior exposure to Databricks
You have development experience in Spark (Python, Scala, or Java) and end-to-end, near real-time ETL pipelines
You bring along your experience from past projects, where you were using with both SQL and NoSQL technologies
You have a good understanding of data modeling techniques
Confidence with Microsoft Azure (or other cloud) platform
Understanding of data governance and data security practices
Power BI (or other reporting tool) knowledge is a plus
Prior experience with on-demand analytics systems is a plus
Data mining/analytics/machine learning experience is a plus

What We Value

You have proven ability to lead a team of engineers, lead design discussions
You are happy to mentor junior engineers
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
You have fluency in English

What We Offer

Opportunity to work a company that is revolutionizing the market and is experiencing exponential growth.
Allow your inspirational ideas to come to life in a highly creative and executional environment.
Ability to work in an organization with over 40 nationalities all over the world, which embraces diversity, inclusion, and belonging at its core.
The opportunity to challenge in a high performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact.


This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required.

Elements will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Elements encourages applicants of all ages.

This role may be subject to a background check after an employment offer has been made and final employment will be subjective to a positive result, in addition, reference may be requested at the final stage of the process.

The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, Pécs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.

As a Data Analyst you can develop and support a new Service Monitoring tool for the network Laboratory of the Deutsche Telekom, which includes different kind of network devices for all customers of the Deutsche Telekom.

Founded by Mastercard and IBM in 2018, Trūata is a fast-moving tech start-up headquartered in Dublin, Ireland. Trūata engineers privacy-enhancing products and solutions that help major organizations to leverage the value of data while meeting the highest standards of personal data protection set out by the GDPR and other leading global regulations. Following our rapid growth in Europe over the last three years, we have expanded from our flagship anonymization service to offer a portfolio of software and SaaS solutions.

 The Role
 Trūata is recruiting for a Senior Data Engineer Contractor to join their Customer Operations team in Dublin, Ireland.  
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will build analytic tools / reports providing customer insights into their data. You will analyze customer use cases, creating design specifications taking into consideration data privacy regulatory requirements, develop analytical products, validate the insights gained, and ensure that results meet Trūata’s strict data privacy requirements.

 You will be a member of a highly skilled cross-disciplinary technical team, solving challenging data problems and working alongside your peers and external stakeholders to deliver customer data analytics projects in a way that is compliant to GDPR and similar privacy laws.

 This position reports into Trūata’s Customer Lead.  


What you will do


 Work with client stakeholders to gather requirements around their data analytics needs and use of data
Understand business objectives and customer requirements
Apply Software Engineering best-practices to build Big Data analytics applications that deliver value to our clients
Create and maintain design specification and test documentation.
Drive and increase adoption of automation, particularly automated quality checks in existing data products
Collaborate with members of the Data Science and Privacy Risk teams to further boost and document robust data privacy checks
Work with Truata Engineering and Product teams to identify productization potentials for analytics use cases applicable across a range of customers
Implement best practices for data management maintenance, reporting and security
Identification of risk assessment tests and configurations based on internal analysis and state of the art reviews.
Development of algorithms to implement required privacy enhancement controls for customer’s use cases and applications
Ongoing evaluation of data privacy controls for each customer, identification of area for concern



 What you need:


 Third level degree in a related discipline, e. g. Computer Science, Statistics, Data Analytics
8+ years experience in Software Engineering in a hands-on, developer role
4+ years hands-on coding experience with Apache Spark and related Big Data stacks / technologies
Expert-level knowledge of Scala, or Python, be able to compose applications from the ground up combined with a desire to code not just to spec, but write functional, beautiful, and well-documented code
Ability to debug complex data issues while working on very large data sets with billions of records
A strong desire to write code cleanly and efficiently and never be satisfied with just attaining a “good enough”.
Working knowledge of SQL
Understanding of DevOps tools and Git workflow
Direct experience with the entire data project lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, evaluation and presentation of results.
Ability to present technical concepts and results clearly to different audiences and stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and ability to work both on-site and remotely with the client stakeholders



 What is also good to have


Expert-level knowledge of Scala, or Python, be able to compose applications from the ground up combined with a desire to code not just to spec, but write functional, beautiful, and well-documented code
Hands-on experience with cloud services, e.g., Azure Databricks, IBM Public Cloud, Google Cloud, AWS
Working knowledge of Data Science tool chains and stacks, such as Jupyter, R 
In-depth knowledge of Big Data technologies including Hadoop, Cassandra, Kafka, Redis, Hive, Impala
Understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and how to run ML at scale
Experience with data partitions, transformation, and in-memory computations (large-scale join / group-by / aggregations) 
Experience with designing and building Spark applications and data pipelines, monitoring and optimizing Spark job performance
Industry experience in relevant verticals, such as financial services, travel / hospitality, and retail
Customer requirements gathering and KPI reporting / presentation of data science project outputs
Experience in data privacy, GDPR compliance and risk management.



 Life at Truata
 At Trūata, we celebrate our successes and grow from our learnings. We invest in smart decision making for our future, and we’re honest and ethical in everything we do. And with our eminently client-centric approach, our customers are the beating heart of our entire business model.
 Cutting-edge technologies. Challenging work. A fast-paced environment—and a warm, supportive culture. If you’re eager to learn, ready to broaden your mind, and passionate about innovating novel solutions to novel problems, Trūata might just be for you.

Senior Data Engineer
The Senior Data Engineer will primarily work with the lead data engineer, product owners, architects, engineering teams and BI developers to implement and drive forward our client's data & analytics goals. 
This is an opportunity to work as a 'hands on' data engineer, engaging with a variety of stakeholders in engineering teams and the business to deliver business critical solutions. You will collaborate with Data Architects and Data engineers’ firm wide to align to best practice and the firms Data management policy. 
You will have 

Proven experience working as a data engineer or software engineer working on data platforms. 
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to logically analyse complex requirements, processes and systems to put solutions in place. 
Strong SQL programming skills. 
Passion about using data to drive key business decisions. 
Great people skills, able to engage with a wide range of stakeholders at all levels.



You may have 

Hands-on experience working in a DevOps environment. 
Experience of Data modelling, data warehouse design, data lake concepts and practices. 
Experience of the Azure data platform. 
Experience working within data governance and compliance frameworks. 
Experience creating logical data models, preferably within the financial services sector. 
Experience using SQL Server and Azure SQL. 
Previously used Qliksense, PowerBI or equivalent visualisation tools. 
Python programming skills. 

In this role you will 

Build and maintain a cloud-based data warehouse consisting of information gathered from several systems. 
Assist data analysts and BI developers to create insightful dashboards and reports for customers.
Develop data Integrations using Azure analysis services and APIs. 
Integrate data points between Tax Systems and external/client applications. 
Design and build systems for use across multi-cloud platforms. 
Create data sources to be used by Business Intelligence tools. 
Working on data integration, data quality, data mining and ETL processes. 
Work as part of a scaled agile team.

Senior Data Engineer


The Data Engineer will be involved in the architecture, design, development and management of large scale, highly distributed, multitenant data stores and pipelines. In addition to building and maintaining these, the Data Engineer will also work to ensure that the data is easily accessible and available to data scientists and business users across the enterprise.


Main Duties



The candidate will work across the full SDLC following agile best practises


Enable data science and business units by implementing infrastructure and tools required to access and query large data sets


Design, build, scale and maintain big data pipelines and stores


Produce reusable components and microservices for completing data operations on cloud and edge


Produce detailed documentation such as user guides, technical reports, and presentations


Work on green field and legacy projects to different levels of quality i.e. proof of concept, alpha products, production quality products.


Collaborate broadly across multiple functions (data science, engineering, product management, IT, etc.) to readily make key data readily available and easily consumable


Explore and recommend new tools and processes which can be leveraged across the data preparation pipeline for capabilities and efficiencies


Mentor others in the use of tools and techniques


Qualifications Required



4+ years of progressive experience in delivering data engineering solutions in a production or R&D environment


Experience with distributed computing using Spark and PySpark or Scala.


Experience designing data models and creating scalable, optimised big data stores


Experience building and scaling big data ETL pipelines using tools such as Kafka, Spark, Airflow and Hadoop based stores


Experience creating infrastructure and systems on cloud, preferably Azure


Exposure to Kubernetes, Docker or other similar container-based systems


Experience building APIs to support data consumption


Excellent communication (verbal, presentation, documentation) skills, working with teams that are geographically dispersed, to produce solutions that satisfy functional and non-functional requirements

Qualifications Desired



Experience with data system security e.g data encryption, system network design etc


Experience in edge computing, creating and delivering data/components/microservices to edge devices


DevOps experience, particularly building CI/CD pipelines


Understanding of Machine Learning tools & processes


Experience with Data visualisation tools

description:
Job Description:

 We are currently seeking a Data Engineer to work on Asset Management’s Common Data Platforms. These data platforms utilized by 200+ applications are at the core of Asset Management’s systems.

 This is a hands-on role where you will understand the requirements, contribute to the development of specific product features including provisioning of datasets, develop consumption interfaces, build reusable components and resilient cloud-based services, provide insights etc. for our Investment Professionals.

 The Expertise We’re Looking For

 Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline
 Minimum of 2 years of experience in Oracle SQL & PL/SQL
 Some experience in data analysis
 Experience in SQL and PL/SQL performance tuning
 Exposure to Agile development practices


 The Skills You Bring

 Familiarity with logical data modeling and relational database design
 Data movement and ETL experience would be beneficial (preferably Informatica)
 Reporting experience in platforms such as OBIEE and Tableau would be a plus
 Unix scripting and AutoSys skills would also be a plus
 Data Warehousing knowledge would be advantageous
 Snowflake experience would also be advantageous
 Experience with a source control system
 Ability to work with project teams located in multiple geographic locations
 Whilst the role is database focused, some experience in any of the following would be a plus:
    
 Object-Oriented Software development with an understanding of associated development languages, specifically Java and/or Python, Spring boot plus familiarity with ORM frameworks
 Working experience with some or all of the following: AWS, Containerization, associated build and deployment CI/CD pipelines, Lambda development.
 Design of REST APIs and an understanding of microservice architectures and twelve factor application development
 Knowledge of UI Technologies such as Angular or JavaScript, and experience with automated CI/CD processes & package managers



 The Value You Deliver

 Contribute to the delivering of high quality, timely, cost effective and maintainable software solutions in an agile environment to meet functional and non-functional business requirements.
 Complying with and helping to adopt good engineering practices such as test driven development, code and design reviews, oracle xplans, CI/CD
 Work as part of a team in delivering complex technical features
 Communicate effectively in a team oriented environment
 You demonstrate a positive, collaborative attitude while delivering individually


 How Your Work Impacts the Organization

 The position aligns to the Asset Management Technology organization which provides worldwide technology and support to the Investment Management, Research, Trading and Investment Operations functions. This Data Engineer role involves developing consistent, reliable, maintainable, performance focused code for Common Data platforms leveraged by the applications supporting Fidelity’s Asset Management business.

 The team environment consists of a global Common Data team of approx. 60 associates working closely with members of the Data Modeler, DBA and Data Architecture teams.

 Why Fidelity?

 A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology
 More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide
 Access to top-tier technology platforms, tools and frameworks
 Challenging positions and numerous opportunities for personal and professional growth
 Competitive compensation and benefits package that includes bonus, health insurance, pension, life assurance and a variety of work/life programs


 Certifications:

 Company Overview
 At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. Fidelity established an Ireland presence in 1996 and we currently employ 1,300 staff across IT and shared services, with offices in Dublin (City West) and Galway (Parkmore East). For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityInvestments.ie.
 Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.


 We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
 Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact AccommodationsIreland@fmr.com.

About iptiQ
iptiQ EMEA Property & Casualty is a start-up within Swiss Re with the mission to make the insurance buying process easy, transparent and 100% digital. From cyber to smart home insurance, we pride ourselves on bringing you innovative insurance products that are ready for the future today. We work with established B2C and B2B brands to build tailored insurance service at attractive prices.


About the role
Glad you’re interested! We’re looking for a determined data engineer to help craft our digital solutions and change the way insurance is bought online. No more insurance talk that only a lawyer understands, we’re here to make a difference!
You would be designing and implementing data pipelines and data models in close collaboration with our analytics and other engineering teams plus improve our cloud base data infrastructure (Amazon AWS). Focusing on balancing scale and performance with a pragmatic approach
At the same time improve existing data models ensuring availability, governance and quality while implementing new business capabilities. Last but not least delivering high-quality code, focusing on correctness, simplicity, performance and maintainability.
This is what we will look for
5+ years of hands-on experience in building data pipelines and using data technologies,
Experience in software engineering in any modern language (Python, Java, Scala, Kotlin …) or equivalent,
Strong experience with SQL/NoSQL datastores. Experience of Timeseries DBs and other distributed systems is a plus
Willingness to work with individuals in different time zones and cultures, and familiarity with a fast-paced startup environment
Ability to speak and write English fluently
What we offer
We're a scale-up embedded within an organization known for its high-caliber talent and excellent benefits. So, you get the best of both worlds - a fast paced environment with a genuine work-life balance and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

We love challenges! Under this motto, our around 450 employees, of which about 80 are primarily concerned with data at locations in Amsterdam (NL), Cologne (DE), and Lithuania combine their know-how in the areas of strategy, data, creation, marketing, and technology – always on the lookout for outstanding solutions. As an award-winning Microsoft Gold Partner and Platinum Sitecore Partner, we also rely on high-quality technical expertise.

Data is hot, especially in these times. Many companies see the added value of data, but do not yet have a clear understanding of this. Macaw helps customers with this by inspiring and guiding them towards a future-proof and valuable data platform that can support all traditional and innovative data-driven workloads so that the customer has valuable information. We do this at Basic-Fit , Heineken, PWN, Vivat, Henkel and ABN AMRO, among others.

Working at Macaw as a Data Engineer

Together with 450 international colleagues, we focus on delivering the best digital solutions to make our customers successful. You will work in a team of 60 dedicated Data & Analytics professionals. We cover the full range of data: from traditional Business Intelligence solutions and Smart Data Platforms (SDP) to more advanced Analytics solutions with AI and Data Science. We choose to focus on the Microsoft BI Stack. Within the Data & Analytics team, we have MVP Marc Lelijveld.

We believe that working together is a combination of individual and team responsibility, while maintaining a professional working relationship. This entails addressing behavior and helping each other, finding balance with each other, sharing knowledge and of course celebrating successes together. We are a passionate club of professionals who work hard and have a lot of fun.

As a Data Engineer, you will
Advise our customers about the technical possibilities and conditions in the Data & Analytics field.
Together with your team you will design, realize and implement D&A applications, smart big-data platforms and self-service BI solutions.
You will be involved in the design of architectures and the built and deployment with Azure DevOps and Azure Services.
You will also configure ETL and Azure Data Factory pipelines and perform data engineering.

The colleagues in the team have extensive technical knowledge of existing technology such as the Azure Data Platform, SQL Datawarehouse, Azure Data Lake and Azure Databricks. In addition, we work with the latest technologies, such as Azure Synapse.

What are we looking for?

Because you will work for different Macaw clients, it is important that you follow the latest trends in the data field. In addition to the success of our customers, you also work on your own development. In short, as part of an expert and driven team of functional and technical Specialists, Consultants and Architects, you shape your future at Macaw in a way that best suits your personality and ambition.

Technical skills
SSAS, SSIS, SSRS
MS SQL
Python
Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks experience would be an advantage
What can you expect from Macaw?

An amazing role in which you can combine your technical skills and coaching skills. We also offer you:

Competitive salary, depending on knowledge and experience
Additional holiday days
Flexible working hours & work from home
Workation
Budget for home-office equipment
50% discount on lunch
Company Contributions for Supplementary Health Insurance (full-coverage by Compensa)
Own training budget and plenty of room for development and growth objectives, which you will determine together with your people manager
The annual trip abroad with the entire company and much more company events
Referral program and bonuses
Recognition and appreciation for your work
Well-known customers, attractive brands, and demanding projects that you can be proud of
Responsibility and scope for your own projects

Salary range: 3000-6000 gross

Location: Randstad
Hours: 32 – 40

By inspiring and guiding Macaw helps her clients towards a future-proof and valuable data platform that can support all traditional and innovative data-driven workloads. We do this at Basic Fit, PWN, Vivat, Henkel, ABN AMRO and many others.

Working at Macaw as a Senior Data Engineer

Together with 450 international colleagues, we focus on delivering the best digital solutions to make our customers successful. You will work in a team of 60 dedicated Data & Analytics professionals. We cover the full range of data: from traditional Business Intelligence solutions and Smart Data Platforms (SDP) to more advanced Analytics solutions with AI and Data Science. We choose to focus on the Microsoft BI Stack. Within the Data & Analytics team, we have two MVP’s Dave Ruijter and Marc Lelijveld.

We believe that working together is a combination of individual and team responsibility, while maintaining a professional working relationship. This entails addressing behavior and helping each other, finding balance with each other, sharing knowledge and of course celebrating successes together. We are a passionate club of professionals who work hard and have a lot of fun.

As a Data Engineer, you advise our customers about the technical possibilities and conditions in the Data & Analytics field. Together with your team you design, realize and implement D&A applications, smart big-data platforms and self-service BI solutions. You will be involved in the design of architectures and the build and deployment with Azure DevOps and Azure Services. You will also configure ETL and Azure Data Factory pipelines and perform data engineering. The colleagues in the team have extensive technical knowledge of existing technology such as the Azure Data Platform, SQL Datawarehouse, Azure Data Lake and Azure Databricks. In addition, we work with the latest technologies, such as Azure Synapse.

Because you will work for different Macaw clients, it is important that you follow the latest trends in the data field. In addition to the success of our customers, you also work on your own development. For example, you can use the Azure credits for Proof of Concepts or for your private projects. It is also possible to follow a specific training, which is paid from your Macaw study budget. In short, as part of an expert and driven team of functional and technical Specialists, Consultants and Architects, you shape your future at Macaw in a way that best suits your personality and ambition.

“Slowing down is my biggest challenge. There are opportunities everywhere within Macaw and there is so much to see and do, but not everything is possible at the same time!” – Roland Holtermann, Data & Analytics Consultant

What can you expect from Macaw?

An amazing role in which you can combine your technical skills and coaching skills. We also offer you:

A competitive salary and mobility allowance
29 holiday days, with the possibility to lead up to 33 days
Generous study compensation
A wide range of development and career growth opportunities
Recognition and appreciation for your work
What we are looking for
Higher education or academic background
You already work and live in the Netherlands
At least 5 years of working experience in the data engineering field
At least 3 years of working experience on Azure Data Platform, SQL Datawarehouse, Data Lake and Databricks
Solid knowledge of Azure Cloud
Interest in new technologies like Azure Synapse Analytics
Fluent in Dutch and / or English is mandatory
PowerBI knowledge is preferred

post_title: Senior Data Engineer - based in Luxembourg
description:
Next Gate Tech leverages the latest cloud technologies, providing clients with a consistent, consolidated and independent source of data, enabling them to streamline their day-to-day processes. This data comes from multiple unharmonized/unstructured sources. Through our analytics tools we help drive efficiency and reduce risk through eliminating the need for multiple point solutions and legacy databases. This enables firms to manage their governance and controls independently and consistently, while at the same time lowering their technology and manual expenditure. 
Senior Data Engineer - based in Luxembourg *Data is the core of what we do. Nowadays, we know that models can be only as good as the data ingested. At Next Gate Tech, we work with various structured and unstructured data from different sources and providers. We capture financial data from diverse vendors and collect large datasets from our clients.**Consequently, our data team oversees the quality of the data flow feeding our models and the technology we provide to our clients daily. They work to optimise the efficiency of financial data extraction on tens of thousands of cross-asset instruments and manage the orchestration of different data flows. They optimise and constantly enhance our internal financial database, which is the core of our analytics.**To support our fast-growing company and the growth of the daily volume of data, we are looking for a Senior Data Engineer that will join the data team. If you have a solid background in handling financial datasets and are passionate about searching and implementing best practices in data management and data ingestion, join our team!**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES**

Data workflow development and management
Developing technical solutions for data collection via APIs
Handling our internal financial instruments databases and oversees the daily flow
Represent the company in the discussion with the third-party financial data providers
Gathering the business needs of the various units requesting and using data collection
Monitoring production and maintenance

**PROFILE**

Master’s degree in a technical or quantitative field
+5 years of experience as a Data Engineer handling financial dataset
Past work and/or educational experience in the field of Finance is a must
Proficiency in working with financial data vendors and managing their relationship.
Experience with creating and maintaining Python packages
Understanding of numerical programming (using libraries such as numpy, pandas, scipy…)
Knowledge of databases and database management (SQL/NoSQL)
Strong understanding on working within cloud environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English

**TECHNOLOGIES**

Python 3.7+
Experience with Cloud Solutions, such as GCP, AWS, Azure…
Experience with financial tools, such as Thomson Reuters Eikon, Bloomberg Terminal, Datascope…

**WE OFFER

An exciting and dynamic work environment at the cutting-edge of its industry
An entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to make a direct and strong impact with new ideas
The ability to work at the intersection between two very promising and fast-growing fields, Finance and Technology
Flexibility and independence in work organisation and schedule

Next Gate Tech is an equal opportunity employer***
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

info_remote: Bestseller A/S - 542 reviews - Postcode 1012 in Amsterdam Centrum
description:
BESTSELLER E-commerce is on a mission - We are currently looking for a results-driven individual to join us on our exciting digital journey and contribute to boosting growth through digitalization in a global tech fashion company. Will you be our new DATA ENGINEER?

WHAT COULD YOU EXPECT FROM US?

A great way of working and team

At BESTSELLER E-commerce we believe in freedom with responsibility, so we own what we do and how we develop ourselves. We pride ourselves on a culture of trust, autonomy and continuous feedback that contributes to making a positive impact within an inspiring working atmosphere.

The team, part of a broader Cloud Department, is currently 4 Data Engineers working in scrum - with sprints of 2 weeks. The day starts with daily stand-up where the team aligns on what to focus on for the day. On a typical day, our data engineers are developing new integrations in python, provisioning infrastructure via terraform, writing custom Airflow operators and unit tests, releasing product increments, and monitoring the health of our data eco-system. You will be joining a result-oriented team with a culture of continuous feedback and knowledge sharing.


Different Benefits
We are a family-oriented company that takes care of their employees offering different benefits such as:
Competitive salaries
Relocation assistance for internationals
Budget for internal and external training opportunities
Flexible working hours
27 (+5) days of paid holidays per year
Extensive onboarding
50% discount on all BESTSELLER products
Catered breakfast and lunch in the office
Gym memberships discounts

WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?

Your profile
Have a university degree in Software Engineering or similar field
Have a DevOps mentality and have experience with code reviews
Can propose and implement technical solutions
Have experience working in agile environment

What we are looking for:
Strong experience with SQL and Python
Experience with Docker
Experience with code-based ETL tools such as Airflow
Experience with integration from/to Kafka, or similar event streaming platform.
Experience with MPP databases such as Redshift, Snowflake
Experience with AWS services like Lambda, CloudFormation, S3, Athena, Glue, IAM

Nice to have:
 PySpark / Apache Spark
Event Driven Architecture
Experience in Kimball and/or Data Vault modeling
Terraform

ABOUT US
At BESTSELLER, we are more than 15,000 people working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S.
At BESTSELLER E-Commerce, we are an international team of 170 people from more than 40 nationalities with the purpose to drive all e-commerce functions at BESTSELLER. With our office in the heart of Amsterdam as well as locations in Poland and Denmark, we are supporting all fashion brands of the BESTSELLER family and sell online in 15 countries around the world. We work in an environment where fashion meets technology. Challenging ourselves to offer the best experience to our customers and stakeholders and to work with the latest technologies is what drives us. As a team, we value autonomy and flexibility. We thrive in a flat organization, where everyone has the chance to grow and learn. For more information, please go to https://about.bestseller.com.

Website - https://about.bestseller.com/jobs/design-your-future/e-commerce

Instagram - @bestseller_ecommerce

APPLY NOW!
We look forward to hearing from you! Please apply directly using the apply button below or via our website. In case you have any further questions about the role, you are welcome to contact Beatriz Barrera at beatriz.barrera@bestseller.com

Voor een vooraanstaande opdrachtgever in Maarssen zoekt Greenmonkeys B.V. een Junior Big Data Engineer (m/v).Over het bedrijfBij dit bedrijf geloven ze dat mensen de toekomst maken. Ze zijn gespecialiseerd in het klaarstomen van rising stars. Ze kennen de wereld van IT en weten precies wat er gevraagd wordt. Met hun gespecialiseerde trainingen en certificeringen zorgen ze ervoor dat deze vraag perfect wordt ingevuld. Daarnaast leveren ze een systeem dat alle data binnen een bedrijf goed, automatisch en snel kan analyseren zodat ze de informatie direct kunnen gebruiken om hun processen te optimaliseren. In verband met groei van het bedrijf is er plaats voor een ambitieuze Junior Big Data Engineer.Over de functieIT en techniek doen jouw bloed als Big Data Engineer sneller stromen. Big data is waar het hier om draait. De technologie die ze hier ontwikkelen zorgt ervoor dat bedrijven snel en efficiënt bij hun informatie kunnen komen en de nuttige informatie gelijk kunnen gebruiken.Jij als Big Data Engineer zorgt ervoor dat dit systeem strak geïmplementeerd wordt bij 1 van de klanten. Hierbij zorg je ervoor dat de klant het analyseren niet zelf meer hoeft te doen. Jij zorgt ervoor dat het systeem de juiste informatie visualiseert. Dit doe je door een goed ontwikkelde dashboard te bouwen.Vanzelfsprekend komt er hier ook een stukje front-end development bij kijken. Een mooie combinatie van business analytics en functioneel- en technisch beheer. Samen met je team werk je aan de allerbeste oplossingen voor deze organisatie.Staan Code Academy en Tutorials Point bij jou altijd open? Laat het ons weten en we vertellen je graag meer over deze interessante ICT baan bij jou in de buurt!Wat breng je meeEen (bijna) afgeronde HBO opleiding Informatica, Computer Science of Data ScienceErvaring in Splunk is een préGoede communicatieve vaardighedenDe drive om jezelf continue te ontwikkelenAnalytisch sterkWat krijg je ervoor terugUitdagende functieLaptop en telefoonAuto of Openbaar Vervoer kostenvergoedingUitstekend salaris en voorwaardenDé kans om jezelf te ontwikkelenAls jij jezelf herkent in bovenstaand profiel solliciteer dan via de ‘solliciteren button’ en overtuig ons van jouw capaciteiten! We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op.Of voor meer specifieke informatie over deze ICT baan in de buurt: stuur ons via WhatsApp een berichtje, bel of mail ons!Harry Voss06 23465519Referentienummer 285Wat wij doen bij Greenmonkeys?Personeel werven, al vijftien jaar. Voor kleine, middelgrote en grote bedrijven, door heel Nederland. In die vijftien jaar was geen dag hetzelfde en geen mens gelijk. En precies dat maakt dat we met zoveel plezier ons werk doen en zullen blijven doen.Maar de laatste jaren zien we een grote toename in het aantal vacatures en dat geeft ons de mogelijkheid verder te kijken dan naar de inhoud van een baan alleen. De vraag naar een baan in de buurt neemt bijvoorbeeld toe, en ook daar willen we als Greenmonkeys aan meehelpen.We zullen geleidelijk aan alle vacatures van Nederland op ons platform samenbrengen, zodat werkgever en werknemer elkaar bij ons kunnen vinden en die baan in de buurt steeds dichterbij komt. Nieuwe kansen, waarbij iedereen wint. Een baan in de buurt levert onmiddellijk belangrijke voordelen voor jou op. Want met minder reistijd zorgen je voor meer vrije tijd, minder files en minder CO2 uitstoot. Ons streven is helder: als je op zoek bent naar een (andere) baan, dan moet je die óók in de buurt kunnen vinden!Dus: denk je wel eens aan ander werk of heb je een prima baan maar ben je elke dag uren onderweg? Ellenlange files, tochtige perrons of uitpuilende treinen? Stel je dan voor dat er bij jou in de buurt nét zo’n leuke baan is, of misschien wel een betere! Op onze website staat een groot aanbod vacatures door heel Nederland.Last van het heen en weer? Go Greenmonkeys!Ook voor sollicitatieadvies of inzicht in onze anonieme vacatures op onze website kun je contact met ons opnemen. Wij helpen je graag bij het vinden van jouw ideale baan!Vanwege COVID-19 worden interviews veelal virtueel afgenomen, of in overleg op locatie.Soort dienstverband: VoltijdsSalaris: €2.500,00 - €4.000,00 per maand

Functieomschrijving
For a project we need a data engineer. We expect this project will have the duration of 6 months. The context of the team is the Domain Data Store team(s) that are working on preparing the data for our Business Insights on our Retail and Wealth clients, who work close together with the teams working on preparing data for the campaigns (marketing automation) for Retail and Wealth.
Note: more than 1 team is mentioned as based on request and need, we might shift someone from Wealth to Retail or vice versa.
With the following results:
We are looking for an (experienced) data engineer who can advise on and implement technical solutions for our Azure data environment.
The activities entail onboarding and curating sources on the domain data store via EventHubs. And design and implement solutions for different consumption patterns, like campaign automation, BI and ad hoc analysis, in order to acquire the highest level of compliance, user management, data quality and query performance.
Relevant knowledge skills & competences:
Expertise in Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, Python, PySpark, SQL is a must
Expertise in Apache Airflow and Azure Data Factory is a strong plus
Expertise in EventHubs is a strong plus
Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets
Experience in Data Modelling and ETL processes
Experience in Agile and working in SCRUM teams
The candidate should work independently with a minimal supervision.

Higher education, bachelor degree

JOB DESCRIPTION DATA ENGINEER
Will you use your knowledge and experience to make machines come to life in the cloud? Do you have knowledge of Industrial IoT? Grow with Royal Kaak!
As a Data Engineer, you work and think about the development of the current data platform with which Royal Kaak monitors and improves the production lines of their customers. You are working on further expanding the data pipeline and giving structure to the data so that it can be easily used for dashboards, reports, or analyses. You will also contribute to the development of an API that provides access to the data.
As a Data Engineer, you strengthen the Software Development team in setting up, developing, and improving the cloud-based data platform. You will contribute to the development and implementation of data-driven solutions. You will translate needs into products in close contact with users. You work pragmatically by using the right tools, techniques, and technologies. You also contribute to improving the reliability, efficiency, and quality of the platform. In close contact with the users, you will translate needs into software and data products.
ARE YOU THE CANDIDATE?
You have a completed HBO education in Computer Science or similar;
You have experience with cloud-based data solutions and you have good knowledge of SQL;
You have knowledge of and experience with building and maintaining databases;
You have knowledge of and experience with Python, or equivalent platforms;
You can translate data into insightful dashboards;
You speak fluent English and are willing to learn Dutch.
WHAT THE COMPANY CAN OFFER YOU
You will work in a challenging, technical environment and you will be part of the R&D department. There is plenty of room to develop and grow. Royal Kaak offers you a good salary and excellent fringe benefits, including 27 vacation days, 13 ADV days and flexible working hours. In addition, they offer you training opportunities to develop your expertise. You get a place in a social family business and you work in a leading organization with an international character, where the working atmosphere is pleasant and informal.
COMPANY PROFILE
Your new employer Royal Kaak is one of the most important manufacturers of complete automated production lines for the industrial bakery industry worldwide. They are a dynamic family business and have a leading market position in various markets, regions and countries. Together with qualified experts, they continue to work on expanding the market position and solutions portfolio.
DO YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE?
Location
Terborg
Contact
Rein te Winkel
+31 6 82 48 34 38

post_title: Vi søker Data Engineer til AI and Analytics teamet i Cognizant
info_remote: Cognizant Technology Solutions Norway AS - 14,648 reviews - Lysaker - Remote
description:
Bli kjent med Cognizant Technology Solutions Norway AS 
  



At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Big Data Engineer to join our Artificial Intelligence & Analytics Team.

 About Cognizant Digital Business – Artificial Intelligence & Analytics

 We help our customers leverage Artificial Intelligence and analytics in building technology solutions to improve the quality of human life. We are the market leaders in the data and analytic space with 22,000+ information & data management, AI and analytics professional helping more than 650+ customers across the globe to build and run intelligent businesses, using an AI-first, human-centric, platform driven and design thinking approach

 For more information? Please visit https://www.cognizant.com/ai

 About role
 You as Data Engineer will be part of the strategic drive to in working along with multi-discipline teams through the full delivery lifecycle of complex data products and pipelines with a clear understanding of large-scale data engineering and data science solutions, deliver use cases for one of our customers and develop practical solutions and implement them to give this customer a competitive edge with in the enterprise.
 You will have breadth of experience in both engineering and architecture across technology disciplines and the unique challenges of each, including software development, automated test and quality assurance, data and integration.

 Delivering a high quality and innovative data driven solution to our client’s advance analytical needs. This will include, working within a team on the clients site: understanding the client’s pain, designing an analytical approach, implementing a solution, ensuring it is of high quality, and leading and mentoring multi discipline technology teams.

 Our ideal candidate

 5+ years of experience working as a solution designer in a Data / Business Intelligence teams building data lakes, warehouse & marts
 3+ years of experience working with Big Data technologies
 Strong knowledge of data solutions, data lakes, data warehouses, data marts and similar.
 Experience/Knowledge of IT infrastructure and cloud development - (e.g. AWS, Azure)... experience with cloud-based MPP technologies (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake, Hadoop, Spark)
 Experience supporting data scientists (e.g. Python, R, SAS)
 Experience in understanding and implementation of Data Governance principles
 Experience in Agile and DevOps model of Data Application design, implementation and operations
 Experience in leading multiple projects under a big program
 Excellent background of working with multiple databases – relational, dimensional, graph, unstructured/file based etc.
 Experience in Master Data Management, Data Quality, Metadata management, data discovery design and implementation.
 Strong application design and development skills, excellent communication skills with a strong emphasis on conceptualizing and designing architectures.
 Strong Data Analysis & Modeling skills
 Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
 Experience working in diverse multicultural environment with different vendors, onsite/offshore vendor teams etc.


 Nice to Have

 Good knowledge if not experience in at least one of Java, Scala, Python with knowledge of the others
 Experience in delivering big data solutions using a leading Hadoop distributions like Hortonworks / Cloudera
 Norwegian (or Swedish/Danish).


 What you can expect

 Become part of the ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
 Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
 Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
 Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
 Drive your own career
 Market conform benefits

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100:CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. post_title: Er du en erfaren Data Engineer med solid kompetanse, og vil bli med på vår digitale transformasjon? Da er det deg vi vil ha som vår nye Senior Data Engineer til IT-huset i Sporveien!
description:
Digitaliseringen i Sporveien skyter fremover i en rekordfart. Sporveien har ansvaret for å bygge opp og drifte neste generasjons tekniske plattform for å støtte oppunder fremtidens kollektivtrafikk. Vi er i ferd med å modernisere infrastruktur og rullende materiell, først ute er de nye og svært moderne trikkene som vi er i ferd med å sette i drift.
    
 For å finne morgendagens løsninger må vi utnytte teknologi på en klok måte som skaper mer kollektivtrafikk for pengene. Vår ambisjon er å være den beste nordiske løsningen på effektiv og miljøvennlig kollektivtrafikk. For å lykkes er vi avhengig av å utvikle gode, helhetlige løsninger. Stikkord er IT transformasjon, hybrid-cloud, supermoderne trikker, big data, cloud computing, sikkerhet, automatisering, AI, robotisering, IoT, smidig utvikling, mm.
    
 IT-Huset i Sporveien består i dag av 60 dyktige medarbeidere som leverer IT-tjenester og rådgivning til 3800 ansatte hos våre kunder: Trikken, T-banen, Infrastruktur og Konsern. Vi er inne i en transformasjon, hvor vi profesjonaliserer vår samhandling med våre kunder. Vi tør å påstå at vi sitter på noe av Norges med interessante data som innebærer; sanntidsdata og historiske data for trafikkpasseringer, tilstandsmålinger, ruteplaner, sensordata og vedlikehold av rullende materiell og infrastruktur.
    

Vi har mange spennende oppgaver foran oss!
 Vi er i gang med en oppskalering av vår data- og analyseplattform for å kunne møte fremtidens store datamengder og sluttbrukernes behov for tilnærmet sanntids oppdatering. I den forbindelse søker vi nå en Senior Data Engineer som skal være med å bygge en skybasert big data-plattform med moderne teknologistabler, samt gjøre et viktig bidrag til Sporveiens digitale beslutningsprosesser. Du vil få en viktig nøkkelrolle i vår spennende digitale reise.
    

VI TILBYR:

 en samfunnsnyttig arbeidsgiver med stor betydning for miljøet, bylivet og kollektivtrafikken (Vi ønsker å tilrettelegge for et grønnere samfunn, og jobber for å levere mest mulig kollektivtrafikk for pengene slik at flest mulig lar bilen stå, og heller reiser kollektivt)
 gode muligheter for videreutvikling og kompetanseheving, og en spennende og lærerik jobb i et selskap i stor utvikling
 et godt arbeidsmiljø med engasjerte og dyktige kollegaer og fagmiljøer, vi legger vekt på trivsel, mangfold og humor
 trimrom, treningsstøtte og bedriftsidrettslag
 konkurransedyktige lønns- og arbeidsvilkår
 mulighet for å få fribillett inntil sone 2 på Ruter sitt rutenett i Oslo og Akershus. Fribillettene fordelsbeskattes iht regelverk for dette

 ARBEIDSOPPGAVER:

 designe, bygge, teste og produksjonssette ETL/ELT, data pipelines, og datamodeller ved bruk av både tradisjonelle verktøy og i moderne skyløsninger
 ta eierskap til datainnsamling, harmonisering, integrering og visualisering av data for analyser og innsikt, samt sikre datakvalitet gjennom hele prosessen
 forvalte dagens løsninger ved å ta i bruk ny teknologi og nye arbeidsmetoder, samt bidra i data-science prosjekter, avanserte analyser
 bidra til kontinuerlig utvikling av vår skybaserte analyseplattform
 samarbeide med med forretningsbrukere, analytikere, og relevante 'stakeholdere' i ulike forretningsenheter i organisasjonen, for å samskape løsninger for datadrevet beslutningsstruktur i organiasjonen
 sette deg inn i og forstå komplekse forretningsbehov og oversette til data og tekniske løsninger
 levere resultater i smidige omgivelser (Agile)

 DU:

 har relevant erfaring innenfor Data Engineering, eller Analytics, samt solid kompetanse innenfor databaser som SQL, ETL/ELT og modelleringsprosesser knyttet til analysebehov
 har relevant utdannelse innen Science, Technology, Engineering eller Mathematics
 behersker språk som Python, Spark, eller R, og/eller andre objektorienterte språk
 har erfaring med utvikling av datapipelines ved bruk av Python, Spark, SQL, eller rest API, og gjerne forståelse for big-data rammeverk som Hadoop, Hive, og Hbase
 har erfaring med BI verktøy som Tableau, Power, BI, Qlik eller lignende
 har gjerne praktisk erfaring med Cloud Data & Analytics på moderne skyløsninger som AWS, Azure, GCP
 har erfaring eller kjennskap til Master Data Management, Data Quality, Metadata Management, Data Discovery
 har gode kommunikasjon- og samarbeidsegenskaper, og er innovativ og forretningsorientert

 Dette forteller en av de nærmeste kollegaene om rollen:
    

Sporveien har mange spennende muligheter og løsninger som jeg ser fram til å ta tak i fremover. 

 Det er viktig at du kan identifisere deg med våre verdier; 
    Pålitelig, Engasjert og Samhandlende og kan være en tydelig kulturbærer av dette.
    
 Vi er stolte av vårt mangfold blant våre ansatte og ønsker søkere uavhengig av kulturell bakgrunn, kjønn og alder. Vi er underlagt offentlighetsloven. Dette innebærer at offentlige søkerlister vil bli utarbeidet (§ 25).
    
 Sporveien AS samarbeider med Semac som er en ekstern leverandør om bakgrunnssjekk av aktuelle kandidater. Bakgrunnssjekken utføres etter samtykke fra deg som søker og innebærer at vi verifiserer CV og annen søknadsdokumentasjon i forbindelse med ansettelsen.
    
 Ble du nysgjerrig, er du velkommen til å ta kontakt med vår rekrutteringspartner Glasspaper Recruitment ved Rekrutteringsrådgiver Ludvig Sebastian Lohne (mob: 977 92 374) evt. kan du sende en e-post til ludvig.lohne@glasspaper.no. Du er også velkommen til å ta kontakt for en uforpliktende og konfidensiell prat.
    





Om arbeidsgiveren
Sporveien-konsernet er Norges største leverandør av kollektivtransport, målt i antall reiser. Sporveien AS er morselskapet i konsernet, og for øvrig inngår datterselskapene Sporveien Trikken AS, Sporveien T-banen AS, Unibuss AS, Bussanlegg AS, Sporveien Vognmateriell AS og Sporveien Media AS. Sporveien-konsernet har ca. 3800 ansatte og omsetter årlig for om lag 4,9 milliarder kroner.  Sporveien har store ambisjoner innenfor digital transformasjon og dette påvirker blant annet teknologivalg, kultur, kompetanse og organisering. Vår ambisjon er å være den beste nordiske løsningen på effektiv og miljøvennlig kollektivtrafikk, og dette stiller store krav til oss som organisasjon.  Konsernsenteret har ansvar for de strategiske og overordnede føringene for alle resultatenhetene og selskapene i konsernet. Senteret består av områdene Økonomi og finans, HR, Kvalitet og HMS, Kommunikasjon og samfunnskontakt, Markedstjenester, Dokumentsenter, Strategi og konsernutvikling, Digitalisering og innovasjon, IT, Konsernjuridisk og compliance og Eiendom. Konsernsenteret har 153 ansatte.
