CAPCO POLAND


Capco Poland is a global technology and management consultancy specializing in driving digital transformation across the financial services industry. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.

We also are:

Experts in banking and payments, capital markets, wealth and asset management
Focused on maintaining our nimble, agile, and entrepreneurial culture
Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there


Project:

Our Capco team is partnering with one of the our Client - Global Finance Organization to deliver an ecosystem of curated, enriched and protected sets of data – created from global, raw, structured and unstructured sources. We are utilising the latest technologies to solve business problems and deliver value and truly unique insights

THINGS YOU WILL DO:

Collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing of large sets of data
Choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them.
Responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company and to help build out some core services that power Machine Learning and analytics systems.

 We are looking for Data Engineers who have:

Ability to process and rationalise structured data, message data and semi/unstructured data and ability to integrate multiple large data sources and databases into one system
Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles and of the fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
Strong knowledge of the Big Data eco system, experience with Hortonworks/Cloudera platforms
Practical experience in using HDFS
Practical expertise in developing applications and using querying tools on top of Hive, Spark (PySpark)
Strong Scala skills
Experience in Python, particularly the Anaconda environment and Python based ML model deployment
Experience of Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (Jenkins/Hudson/Ansible)
Experience with using GIT/GITLAB as a version control system.
Experience in working in Teams using the Agile Methods (SCRUM) and Confluence/JIRA
Good communication skills (written and spoken), ability to engage with different stakeholders and to synthesise different opinions and priorities.

 Nice to Haves

Knowledge of at least one Python web framework (preferably: Flask, Tornado, and/or twisted)
Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 would be a plus
Good understanding of global markets, markets macrostructure and macro economics
Knowledge of Elastic Search Stack (ELK)
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (Data Proc / Dataflow)

Other

Preferable knowledge and experience in Data Quality & Governance.
Experience of big data programmes preferable
Enthusiastic and energetic problem solver to join an ambitious team
Attention to detail
Good knowledge of SDLC and formal Agile processes, a bias towards TDD and a willingness to test products as part of the delivery cycle
Ability to communicate effectively in a multi-programme environment across a range of stakeholders

CAPCO POLAND

Capco Poland is a global technology and management consultancy specializing in driving digital transformation across the financial services industry. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.


We also are:

Experts in banking and payments, capital markets, wealth and asset management
Focused on maintaining our nimble, agile, and entrepreneurial culture
Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there


THINGS YOU WILL DO

We are looking for Data Engineers to work on the collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing of large sets of data and be a part of the Clients' Wholesale Chief Data & Analytics Office. Our clients' Big Data Lake is the largest aggregation of data ever within financial services with over 300 sources and a rapidly growing book of work.

Deliver an ecosystem of curated, enriched, and protected sets of data – created from global, raw, structured, and unstructured sources
Collect, store, analyze, and leverage data
Integrate data with the architecture used across the company
Build core services that power Machine Learning and analytics systems
Data Engineering and Management
Data development process: design, build and test data products that are complex or large-scale
Promote development standards, code reviews, mentoring, testing, scrum story writing
Cooperate with customers/stakeholders

Challenges:
1. Refactoring the current technology stack and architecture from on-premise Hadoop to Google Cloud Platform
2. Integrating with an established, complex Multitenant Hadoop based


SKILLS & EXPERIENCES YOU NEED TO GET THE JOB DONE

Experience working with data pipeline building technologies: PySpark, Scala, Hive, Java
Good knowledge of Data warehouse concepts
Proficient in SQL and relational database design
Elastic Search experience (Elastic/Logstash/Kibana etc)
Google Cloud Platform knowledge
Knowledge and experience of Hadoop eco-system and data management frameworks
Knowledge of CI/ CD, Agile, DevOps, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and decision-making skills
Good English knowledge


WHY WORTH JOINING US

Employment contract and/or Business to Business as you prefer
Possibility to work remotely
Speaking English on daily basis, mainly in contact with foreign stakeholders and peers
Multiple employee benefits packages (multisport card, private medical care, lunch card)
Access to 3.000+ Business Courses Platform (Udemy)
Access to required IT equipment
Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
Being part of the core squad focused on the growth of the Polish business unit
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A work culture focused on innovation and creating lasting value for our clients and employees


ONLINE RECRUITMENT PROCESS STEPS

Screening call with the Recruiter
Home assignment if required
Technical/Competencies interview with Capco Hiring Manager
Client’s interview
Feedback/Offer

For our Partner, a professional Bank, we are looking for Lead Engineer.

Wymagania

Pre-Requisite Skills:
Linux / Unix Scripting
Advanced understanding of distributed systems (Pyspark / Hadoop)
Advanced Python
Advanced SQL / DB Admin / Data modelling
Git / version control
Preferred additional skills:
Experience with Network configurations
CI / CD Experience
Microservice development (PCF preferred)
Experience with Kafka / Streamsets

Kluczowe zadania

Responsibilities:
Development and maintenance of data pipelines for the In-Life Enablement team, will be a key role as we manage multiple data pipelines for franchises in parallel into the ILE Ecosystem.

Oferujemy

– employment contract
– different benefits
– great atmosphere

Work location: FULLY REMOTE within Poland

(with possibility to use our offices in Zielona Gora or Warsaw)

FULL-TIME

WHAT YOU WILL DO

As our Data Warehouse Developer you are responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data warehouse, which is just coming into existence. On top you are accountable to gather business requirements to meet business analysis and to ensure proper functioning of Business Intelligence team. You are expected to document all implemented ETL’s, the structure, data sources and procedures. You are responsible for monitoring and reporting on data quality, investigating and troubleshooting causes of incompatibility between applications which collect and utilize the company's data.

What you can expect:

Collaborating with various teams across the company to align development work to enterprise data strategies
Designing and implementing ETL procedured (Azure Data Factory) for intake of data from both internal and outside sources and ensuring the data is verified and its quality is checked
Maintaining and developing data marts, data objects and data models
Ensuring data integrity, performance of quality, and resolution of data load failures
Carrying out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis
Discovering new and creative ways to improve our day-to-day business with focus on efficiency and scalability

WHAT YOU BRING IN


Minimum of 5+ years of relevant professional experience
2+ years of experience with Azure SQL DB, Azure Data Factory and related Azure services
Experience working in reporting and analytical tools (best: Power BI)
Advanced knowledge and understanding of data warehouse concepts
Proficiency in ETL development
Ability to design and conceive solution frameworks independently
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Ability to obtain, analyze and synthesize information from multiple sources
Excellent problem-solving, analytical and critical thinking skill
Proficiency in English (both, verbal and written)

Additional qualifications


C# knowledge as a plus

WHAT WE PROVIDE

The DEVELOPMENT of each exponDOer is of the upmost importance to us:


You will be assigned to a buddy, who will support, advise and simply be there during there for you during the first 4 to 6 weeks of the onboarding.
Your opinion makes a difference, and you will help us to shape with us expondo’s future.
We provide free user accounts for both Udemy for Business and Babbel to promote your constant development.

We offer all our employees the FREEDOM to work how it is best suited to their needs:


Whether it will be remote, from the office or a hybrid of both, we will support any decision made and provide the needed hardware to work in comfort.
If you decide to work at one our locations, all the recommended protective measures are in place for a safe working environment.
Your working hours will be flexible.

In our CULTURE we respect our employees’ needs and care for each other:


We care about everyone’s physical and mental health, and that is why we provide the best possible conditions for a sustainable work-life balance.
We also grant expondo sponsored psychological support for all our employees around the clock.
You will be a part of a diverse team in which good humour, mutual support and respect are highly valued.

The expondo group is an international e-commerce company with more than 400 employees. We are a renowned manufacturer and online retailer of niche products created by experts for experts, operating in Europe and having locations in Germany, Poland, Hong Kong and China. Our focus is to provide our customers with an appropriate and scalable service.

To be a part of the extended expondo family is to be a part of an ambitious and dynamic global company. What lies ahead in terms of future is in the hands of our employees. It is their ideas, vision, skills, and talents which allow for us to succeed in this fast paced, globalizing world. It is the trust, partnership, and commitment that we have for each other which is the key to achieving further success, as we move forward together by owning our actions.

It’s time to get it done with expondo and the time is now.

post_title: Senior Data Engineer - Technology Innovation Office
description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Nike’s Technology Innovation Office (TIO) is passionate about unleashing the power of technology, innovation and talent to Deliver Revolutionary Technology Innovation Products and Services. Embedded in Nike’s Global Technology team, the TIO works across all of Nike and weaves together business and technology dreams, supports world-class products and innovation and relentlessly delivers new capabilities to achieve Nike’s long term vision and strategies!
We are looking for an Engineer who can explore, validate and develop new concepts and initiatives to serve our athletes* and make their lives easier. With teammates in Portland, Netherlands, Boston, San Francisco and Poland, you’ll be joining a global organization to conceptualize, define and deliver technology innovation solutions for use within Nike, as part of existing Nike products and for new lines of business.
TIO Senior Data Engineer will build Nike’s robust ML and AI solutions that have a direct global impact on the business and Nike's consumers. The person we’re searching for gets energized and excited by the challenge of crafting things from the ground up, loves to think outside of the box and bring the latest technologies in AI/ML models. We are searching for a candidate that brings an engineering approach and deeper experience in ML applications' development. The candidate needs to have a strong understanding of all parts of the machine learning cycle, from exploration to different strategies to bring ML solutions to production.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
Build ML solutions with the global impact, helping Nike’s business and consumers
Work on end-to-end ML lifecycle (from data exploration to model operationalization)
Partner with different teams and domains on crafting, explaining and implementing ML models
Play an active role in the research and innovation in terms of the applicability of ML to improve business objectives
Participate in the design and execution of A/B testing and model competition
Integrate your models with Nike’s systems or make them consumer facing through the mobile Apps or Nike.com
Ensure high quality solutions are delivered (through testing, model monitoring, in line with engineering standards)
Lead the collaboration with architecture and product on technical roadmap
Coach and mentor the team in delivering solutions
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will be part of an Agile squad of engineers, closely working with the Product Owner and other team members that drive to deliver innovative AI solutions for Nike and our global consumers.
Together with all the ML Engineers from the other squads within Nike and TIO, you form the AI Engineering chapter. You will contribute to the AI/ML innovation topics, standard ways of working and improving our engineering game.

WHAT YOU BRING
5+ years of experience in ML realm in delivering business value through applying various models
Experience with Python, ML libraries (scikit-learn, pytorch), SQL, Spark, Pandas and cloud technologies
Solid knowledge of applied statistics, both shallow and deep ML models, clearly articulating model choice trade-offs, neural network architecture and performance metrics
Experience in designing and running live model tests such as through A/B or multi-armed bandit testing
Have deep knowledge of the whole model lifecycle from exploring data to bringing ML solutions to production and integrating within Nike
Experience with ML containerization (Docker and Kubernetes)

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, a casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
We are committed to providing inclusive and impactful benefits to our teammates. Our industry competitive benefits start on your first day of employment:
Relocation support if you are moving to Gdansk area from a different part of Poland or from another country
Health & Well-Being benefits: Sports costs covered, Fully subsidized medical plan including eligible dependents.
Summer hours which allow employees to leave the office on Friday at noon all Summer long!
Performance Sharing Plan
Leaning benefits: Language training and online courses
Financial Benefits: Group Life Insurance, Disability & Accident Insurance

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Tripledot Studios - successful and rapidly growing Unicorn company based in London.
We create casual games actively combining creativity and science, data driven approach and cutting-edge technologies.
The studio was founded by a team of veterans from some of the biggest names in games such as King, Peak Games, Facebook, and Product Madness.
We enjoy problem-solving and love taking things apart and figuring out how they work.
Today, more than 30 million monthly active users play on Tripledot Studios products.
Most of our games are in the top 5 in the AppStore and Google Play.
Our most well known games - Woodoku and Solitaire.

Headquartered in London, Tripledot Studios has over 200 employees in offices worldwide including Minsk, Saint Petersburg, Barselona and Warshaw.
We are looking for a passionate Senior Data Engineer to join our best team!
Role & Responsibilities
Build and support ETL pipelines (python/pandas)
Build and support Data Warehouse and Data Lake
Develop and support platform for machine learning
Develop and support Data processing pipelines
Requirements
4+ years of experience in Data Engineering
2+ years of experience with Python and Pandas
Strong working knowledge of SQL
Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles
Working experience with Airflow and Snowflake
Experience with 3rd-party APIs
Experience designing & building systems at scale using AWS
Excellent English skills, both written and verbal.
Benefits
Competitive Salary
Exchange of ideas and daily interaction with a strong team from different offices
Yearly CPD allowance for learning and development materials, courses and seminars
Medical care program
Sport compensation
Sick days
Exciting perks and team events

Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
You will be part of a team whose focus is to solve cutting edge AI / MLproblems and deploy models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. You will be working on designing the data infrastructure and solve other interesting bottlenecks that are challenging at Zoom's scale.

Responsibilities :
Design and implementation of data infrastructure for Machine Learning (ML) projects for our Research and Development Org
Assembling large, complex data sets and make the data more discoverable and easy to be used by the AI / ML team to support various Machine Learning initiatives. This includes unifying pre-processing work flows for data for different AI tasks.
Build and manage data sets, also by identifying and using suitable big data technologies, such as Apache Hadoop, DVC, Apache Drill,
Write tools to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Python, and SQL
Deploy, develop and maintain tools for data collection, data crawling and data annotation, e.g. as web applications using Django and Angular or similar technology.
Along with looking at external sources of data, build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.
Requirements :
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields
Experience in building and optimising data pipelines
DockerExperience with AWS cloud services, e.g. S3Experience working with large data volumesBroad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystemKnowledge of technologies like DVC or HadoopGood understanding of one or more of the following : Python, JavaScript, C++, Django or Angular

Please note : This job opportunity is based out of Karlsruhe, Germany

able to apply data science and statistic techniques to real problems
well organized and able to succeed when no two days are the same

Data Engineer with Kafka

The opportunity
We are looking for a top-notch technology savvy specialists willing to move our projects on the new track! You will use the most advanced technology stack and have an opportunity to implement new solutions while working with top leaders in their industries.
Your key responsibilities
As a Data Engineer with Kafka you will be responsible for building robust data streaming platforms. You will implement efficient solutions using large amount of data from various sources.
Skills and attributes for success
Solving complex business problems at large scale. Participating in a cross-functional initiatives and collaborating across various domains. Interacting with data engineers, product/project managers and partners from all over the world.
To qualify for the role, you must have
3+ years of commercial experience in similar role
Experience in Apache Kafka: Connect API, Streams API
Experience in SQL
Proficiency in Python / Spark
Understanding of Distributed Data Processing of big data batch or streaming pipelines
Hands-on experience with cloud orchestration and automation tools
Understanding of data Modelling and data Concepts like data warehouse, marts etc.
Very good English (verbal and written)
Experience with version control system (GIT, Azure Devops, SVN)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Other streaming platforms like: Spark streaming, Azure Stream Analytics, Apache Flink etc.
Experience with Big Data technology
Experience in using Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Experience in enterprise-class solution implementations
What we look for
As we are a dynamic team of passionate specialists, and we work in international teams all over the world, we will look for the same business acumen. Facing with customers, we are 'out of box thinking' professionals. Our top performers have a team player attitude and they cope with challenges on the daily basis. If it all sounds familiar to you - we are looking forward to seeing you on board.
What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
About EY
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Senior Data Engineer
Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.
The opportunity
Leads the delivery of processes to extract, transform and load data from disparate sources into a form that is consumable by analytics processes, for projects with moderate complexity, using strong technical capabilities
Designs, develops and produces data models of relatively high complexity, leveraging a sound understanding of data modelling standards to ensure high quality
Builds networks with other departments across the business to help define and deliver business value, and may interface and communicate with program teams, management and stakeholders as required to deliver small to medium-sized projects
Your key responsibilities
Leading the production of high-quality data engineering deliverables, helping to ensure project timelines are met, and providing informal mentoring / training to junior members of the team
Leading the delivery of data quality reviews including data cleansing where required to ensure integrity and quality
Leading the delivery of data models, data storage models and data migration to manage data within the organization, for a small to medium-sized project
Resolving escalated design and implementation issues with moderate to high complexity
Analyzing the latest industry trends such as cloud computing and distributed processing and beginning to infer risks and benefits of their use in business
Providing technical expertise to maximize value from current applications, solutions, infrastructure and emerging technologies and seek to continuously improve internal processes
Developing working relationships with peers across other engineering teams and beginning to collaborate to develop leading data engineering solutions
Driving adherence to the relevant data engineering and data modelling processes, procedures and standards
Skills and attributes for success
Batch Processing - Capability to design an efficient way of processing high volumes of data where a group of transactions is collected over a period of time
Data Integration (Sourcing, Storage and Migration) - Capability to design and implement models, capabilities and solutions to manage data within the enterprise (structured and unstructured, data archiving principles, data warehousing, data sourcing, etc.). This includes the data models, storage requirements and migration of data from one system to another
Data Quality, Profiling and Cleansing - Capability to review (profile) a data set to establish its quality against a defined set of parameters and to highlight data where corrective action (cleansing) is required to remediate the data
Stream Systems - Capability to discover, integrate, and ingest all available data from the machines that produce it, as fast as it’s produced, in any format, and at any quality
To qualify for the role, you must have
B.S. in Actuarial, Behavior Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Econometrics, Engineering, IT, Cyber Security, or related field preferredExperience designing and building Data Platforms integrating disparate data sources
Knowledge of distributed computing
Expertise in ETL, SQL
Expertise working with MPP solutions to deal with massive amounts of data
Expertise in Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, Synapse
Expertise developing dataflows using NiFi/ADF, Databricks
Advanced, hands-on experience implementing large scale data warehouses and data lakes
Advanced, hands-on experience in Spark architecture and implementation
Experience working with Distributed Message Systems like Kafka
Hands on experience in Python, PySpark or R
Knowledge of working with structured and unstructured data sources
Expert in writing complex SQL and procedures
Knowledge or creating ingestion workflows using Oozie or similar tools
Knowledge of security measures like HTTPS and Kerberos
Ideally, you’ll also have
Knowledge in Graph Databases, preferably Neo4J, Cypher and Cosmos DB
Graph Data Modeling
Azure Data Lake Store, Databricks Delta lakes
Spark ML
Experience developing Microservices
What we look for
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability
A self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion
Excellent inter-personal, communication, collaboration, and presentation skills
Customer focused
Excellent time management skills
Positive and constructive minded
Takes responsibility for continuous self-learning
Takes the lead and makes decisions in critical times and tough circumstances
Attention to detail
High levels of integrity and honesty

potrafisz projektować pełne rozwiązanie techniczne wraz z wyszczególnieniem alternatyw na poszczególnych etapach oraz znasz zalety i ograniczenia ich zastosowania,

bo jesteśmy remote friendly, a jeśli zdecydujesz się na przeprowadzkę do Gliwic, możesz liczyć na wsparcie pakietem relokacyjnym,

szanujemy Twój czas - postaramy się przeprowadzić Twoją rekrutację w jeden dzień - w przeciągu 24 h po zakończonej rozmowie rekrutacyjnej, otrzymasz feedback techniczny oraz decyzję (tak, nie) wraz z ofertą finansową,

W międzyczasie dostaniesz od nas informacje o przebiegu procesu rekrutacji na Twoje stanowisko.
Zadanie domowe (opcjonalnie)
Zazwyczaj jest elementem procesu dla kandydatów poniżej 1,5 roku doświadczenia. Na jego wykonanie – w zależności od stanowiska, na które aplikujesz – będziesz mieć 3-4 dni robocze. Jeśli nie wyrobisz się w terminie, daj nam o tym znać, znajdziemy wyjście z sytuacji.

Po odesłaniu zadania otrzymasz od nas informację zwrotną wraz z komentarzami naszych ekspertów.
Spotkanie
Jeśli ocena zadania jest pozytywna, zapraszamy Cię na zdalną rozmowę. W spotkaniu uczestniczą rekruter HR oraz rekruter domenowy. Zazwyczaj trwa ono nie dłużej niż 2,5 godziny.
Decyzja i feedback
Wiemy jak ważna jest dla Ciebie nasza szybka odpowiedź. W drugim kwartale 2021 aż 78% kandydatów poznało decyzję dzień po rozmowie rekrutacyjnej. Dodatkowo, niezależnie od wyniku, możesz liczyć na obszerny feedback, który może pomóc w Twoim dalszym rozwoju.
Oszczędzamy Twój czas
Jednodniowa rekrutacja
Na czym polega ODR? W przeciągu 24 h po zakończonej rozmowie rekrutacyjnej, otrzymasz feedback techniczny oraz decyzję (tak, nie) wraz z ofertą finansową. Jednodniową rekrutację systematycznie staramy się wdrażać przy rekrutacjach na stanowiska techniczne. O tym, czy Twoja aplikacja zostanie rozpatrzona tym trybem decyduje wiele składowych. O szczegółach poinformuje Cię rekruter.

The time to change is now!
It's time to build a sustainable future and define how we evolve through technology with purpose.

At Lisbon Tech Hub we create value in the business digital transition, from Portugal to the world, and IT solutions with purpose. Our team has more than 1300 experts working in areas such as Analytics & Business Intelligence, Application Lifecycle Management, Cybersecurity, IT Infrastructure Management, IT Project & Service Management and IT Strategy & User Experience.
Lisbon Tech Hub innovates, designs, transforms the information technology solutions and services for Siemens through our delivery units.
Transforming our future starts with every day!
Lisbon Tech Hub is the home of the new technologists - Dream Builders, Impact Creators & Future Makers.
Are you one of them? Join us!
What role will you play?
Perform strategic data analysis to support business processes and strategy and discuss results with team leads and customers.
Process large amounts of data from multiple sources and extract relevant insights.
Build and operationalize predictive models.
Architect and build cloud infrastructure for both the data engineering and the analytics pipelines
Be part of an international team of data scientists and machine learning engineer with diverse backgrounds, utilizing AI and data analytics methods to accelerate Siemens internal digitalization
We are looking for:
A degree in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, a similar quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with statistical software and scripting languages (e.g., R, Python, SAS).
First experience with cloud technology (AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform)
Proficiency in SQL.
Experience analyzing and modeling data sets.
Experience with statistical and machine learning methods.
The ability to communicate technical concepts into simple terms to present to non-technical audiences.
Effective written and verbal communication skills
What we have to offer:
A flexible home office and schedule policy, virtual budget to improve your home office setup, health insurance, a Pension Plan and a Siemens Share Program time and financial support to your studies, medical center in the facilities, sport groups, 2 days for volunteering initiatives and a cool and relaxed environment.
Access to e-learning platforms (Learnlight, Bookboon, Linkedin Learning and more), discounts with partners.
#Siemens #LXTechHub #ITMakesUsMove
We recognize that building a diverse workforce is crucial to the success of our business. Therefore, Siemens provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, or non-disqualifying physical or mental handicap or disability.
We strongly encourage applications from a diverse talent pool and welcome the opportunity to discuss workplace adjustments with all our applicants to develop agile working and innovation.

International Environment

description:
Location:
Brasov, RO Bucuresti, RO Cluj, RO Iasi, RO Novi Sad, RS Remote, RO Sibiu, RO Timisoara, RO
NTT DATA is a leading IT service provider and global innovation partner headquartered in Tokyo, with business operations in over 40 countries. We help develop innovative business and IT solutions for organizations in the public and private sectors. NTT DATA Romania provides development assistance and expert advice to IT service providers, system integrators, software companies and customers across various industries.
It is time to rethink what you expect from your employer
At NTT DATA Romania, we understand you are not just building a career – you are building a life. Our main asset is our people and we believe that our success depends on the opportunities you get to expand your talent. With 119.500 colleagues, business operations in over 50 countries and with many of the Fortune Global 100 among our clients, a career at NTT DATA offers you countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. If you would like to be part of our stellar team, we invite you to apply online today.
Project Overview

We are looking for a Data Engineers to join NTT DATA Romania for developing ETL loads for our German client.

What you can expect & what we want you to do

Work on data exploration (data understanding)Set up and work on the entire data pipeline: starting from getting data from the source systems all the way to the visualizations in a BI dashboard (including data preprocessing)Be responsible for defining and implementing a data model, with which all requirements in the BI Dashboard can be fulfilledWork on ad-hoc requests to provide meaningful data insightsEvaluate data quality regarding missing data, outliers, frequencies, availability etc.Work hand in hand with other teams to give and get feedback to ensure good data qualityWork closely together with Business Analysts and UX Designers to review and ensure the feasibility of charts and KPIs with given dataShare your data and analytics knowledge and proactively identify areas in which analytics can add significant business value

What you are good at & what you’ll need to win

Solid experience with Python (Pandas, NumPy, etc.), PySpark is a plusExperience with databases and SQL (e.g., Oracle, MS SQL and similar)Experience with data visualization tools e.g. PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau or similarLinux (Basics) skills are a plusExperience with data and KPIs, generating insights from dataExperience in Data Engineering: ETL TasksExperience with Job Scheduling, e.g., AirflowExperience with Big Data Tools is a plus: Hadoop, Spark, KafkaSuccessfully completed studies in computer science, informatics, mathematics, or similar University profilesAdvanced English skills are necessaryGood communication skills, customer excellence focus, and organizational skillsTeam-oriented and solution-driven approachHigh level of self-motivation and a structured, independent, and result-oriented way of working
Are you up for the challenge?
This is the opportunity to do something impactful and be part of a company that is revolutionizing the IT industry. And we couldn’t do it without someone like you. So what do you say, will you make the career move of a lifetime? If this sounds interesting, we look forward to receiving your application and meeting you soon!
Join NTT DATA Romania, grow your career and take advantage of our Home Office perks, sponsored certifications, premium Online Library, Relaxation Lounges, fantastic crew and many other benefits!
Should you have any queries or require further information, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit.

Job Segment: Database, Engineer, ERP, Oracle, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering

Our client is a European leader in public cloud infrastructure 
 solutions and cloud-native application services who employs 500+ people in offices across Europe. They are an AWS Premier Consulting Partner, Google Cloud Platform Strategic Partner and a Microsoft Gold Cloud Partner. 
 
 Tasks 
 
 Building systems for ingestion, transformation and storage of vast amounts of data requires special expertise, which is why we are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing Data-Driven Business team. As a Data Engineer, you'll be responsible for designing, architecting and implementing modern cloud-based pipelines for our customers, making data accessible and usable for a new wave of data-powered apps and 
 services. 
 
 Requirements 
 

Our ideal candidate has:


3 years of professional programming experience and hands-on experience in building modern data platforms/pipelines
Programming languages: Python, Java, Scala
Frameworks: Spark/PySpark, Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Kafka
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, BI Tools
Databases: NoSQL, Relational databases (columnar & row-oriented), Graph databases
Data pipelining: ETL, ELT
Consultancy experience
Previous experience gained in mid-size/large, international companies

Skills that would be a plus:


Interest in or experience with machine learning and Artificial Intelligence
Search engines: Elasticsearch, Solr
Insight Geek that needs constant feeding
Cloud platforms: AWS, GCP, Azure and their data services
Strong communication skills, fluent English

Uddeholm’s production takes place mainly in Hagfors, where we have about 900 employees. Since 2007, Uddeholm has been part of the internationally listed steel group voestalpine AG, headquartered in Linz, Austria, with more than 50,000 employees.
Whom do we need?
We are now looking for a Data Engineer, experienced or at the beginning of the career, to our Digitalization department. A major focus now is on collecting data from various sources, such as machines and smart sensors, in order to visualize, analyze and optimize our processes. Hence, if you wants to be part of our digital journey, to take the next steps towards a connected and intelligent production, then it might be you that we are looking for!
What will you do?
As a Data Engineer, you will work at the interface between automation and data science, which means implementing, transforming and monitoring data pipelines from our processes to our Data Lake. This means that you will be working closely with our automation engineers and data scientist in order to enhance our processes.
Your employment will mainly include:
Data pipelining from machines and sensors to Apache Kafka
ETL pipelining in Kafka Streams, Airflow and PySpark
Surveillance and logging of data pipelines using Prometheus and Grafana
Data Warehousing using Apache Hive
Distributed systems such as Kubernetes and Apache Kafka and Spark
Virtualization techniques in Linux such as Docker and Podman
Software development in Java and/or Python
In this role, you will have weekly interactions with our international colleagues, and sometimes travels to meet with them. Moreover, you will primarily work with ongoing development activities, however, when problems occurs also assist in technical solutions within your areas of expertise. Finally, the employment is located in Hagfors with the possibility to work from our office in Karlstad or partly from home.
What do you need to bring with you to succeed?
We believe you are a Data Engineer who is technically interested, curious and have a willingness to develop yourself and the team. As a person, you are analytical, flexible and result and solution focused with a strong self-drive. The team is works in an energetic and collaborative environment. Hence, during the work you will have great opportunity to gain experience and develop your technical skills, international contacts and personal qualities.
We attach great importance to finding an employee with the right personal qualities. Hence, it is important that you enjoy social interaction, have the ability to work in teams, and can express yourself both orally and written in both Swedish and English. Furthermore, we believe you are prone to development and constantly seek new paths to take you forward.
Why start working with us?
We manufacture steel that shapes products we see everywhere in our everyday lives. As an employee with us, you get to be involved in shaping the world, in a sustainable way that is fair to both people and the environment.
With us at Uddeholm, you as an employee, your competence and your commitment are crucial to our success. Giving you as an employee, the opportunity to take on new tasks internally, develop and grow in your professional role is something we believe in.
Information and application
Submit your application through link below (we do not accept the application by email).

We work with continuous selection; hence, the position may be filled before the application period has expired. For more information about the position, contact Reine Lundin +46 (0)563-17271 or reine.lundin@uddeholm.com
Last day to apply is May 31, 2022.
Welcome with your application!
Vi på Uddeholm tillverkar verktygsstål som formar produkter som finns överallt i vår vardag. Vi formar världen på ett hållbart sätt som är schysst mot både människa och miljö. På så sätt kan vi fortsätta forma världen, idag och för framtida generationer.

Company Description
   We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.

 As a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation agency, we partner with Top 500 companies in the DACH region and in Eastern Europe. Originally from Switzerland, Merkle DACH was created out of a merger Namics and Isobar - two leading full-service digital agencies.

 Our 1200+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built, through providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, Mobile, Social Media, Intranet and CMS. We are part of the global Merkle brand, the largest brand within the dentsu group, who shares with us a network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.



  Job Description
   Expérience requise

5 ans d’expérience en langage SQL (de préférence T-SQL), en gestion de base de données et outils ETL
Expérience du développement avec les principes DevOps (gestion de version, CI/CD)
Expérience de programmation en Python ou autre laguage script (R, ...)
Expérience dans la construction de dashboards BI (Tableau, PowerBI par exemple)
Connaissances techniques au niveau des architectures des logiciels bancaires et de trading (langage FIX) est un plus
Très bon esprit d’analyse et de synthèse
Intérêt pour le travail en équipe
Parfaite maîtrise du français et de l'anglais (oral et écrit)

 Rigoureux/se, doté/e d’un très bon sens de la communication et très motivé/e, vous serez à même de travailler de manière autonome ou en équipe afin de mener à bien les différents projets qui vous seront confiés.



  Qualifications
   Formation
 EPFL ou équivalent
 Additional Information
   We work with highly motivated people, who support and enrich each other. We live the possibilities of the digital world through home office, meaning you can work anywhere with flexible (annual) working hours. We also value face-to-face exchanges - coffee or tea, biscuits or fruit are all welcomed on board and shared throughout our offices.

 If you ever feel the need to take a break from the digital world, we love to get hands on together and use pens, paper, and whiteboards for brainstorming sessions. Need to clear your head? Hit the foosball table, PlayStation, massage bench or yoga mat. For networking and (brain) food, we offer regular exchange formats, like meetings, tech labs and more. Not enough? We are full believers in education and support training, whether it be internally or externally. We support you.

 If you feel inspired by us, we’ll probably be inspired by you. Join us now and apply online to make sure we match each other’s expectations. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We welcome all qualified candidates - regardless of your gender or background, please indicate your salary expectations and possible entry date. We look forward to hearing from you!

 Personnel consultancies - we only work with selected partners.

Project Description
We're seeking a strong and creative Software Developer eager to solve problems of scale and work on cutting-edge and open-source technologies. In this project, you will have the opportunity to write code that will impact thousands of users every month. You'll implement your critical thinking and technical skills to develop cutting-edge software, and you'll have the opportunity to interact with teams across disciplines.

In Luxoft, our culture is one that strives on solving difficult problems focusing on product engineering based on hypothesis testing to empower people to come up with ideas. Great Place to Work Institute certifies us as one of the Top 5 companies to work for in Ukraine, and we do it with a truly flexible environment, high-impact projects in Agile environments, a culture focused on results, training, and strong support to grow your career.

In this new adventure, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with world-class teams in the field of Healthcare, Retail, or Media by building holistic solutions and interacting with multidisciplinary teams.

Code your career with us!

✨✨✨Вітання!✨✨✨
Нумо знайомитися? :)
Ми - продуктова команда Boosters (https://boosters.team/), і ми створюємо продукти, які покращують життя людей і несуть реальну цінність. Зараз у нас є 4 продукти, давай докладно розповім про них:
Words Booster (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/words-booster-learn-languages/id1460782849)– додаток для вивчення іноземних мов (входить у топ-10 мовних додатків у світі)
Avrora (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/sleep-booster-sleep-better/id1441091033)– додаток для покращення сну (топ-5 додатків H&F у понад 82 країнах)
Manifest (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/manifest-affirmations/id1551665207) – додаток з афірмаціями (більше 22 тисяч репостів наших афірмацій)
RiseSpace – платформа з лайф коучами, це наш новий напрямок (реліз був у грудні 2021)
Наша головна перевага - це люди. Люди, які націлені на те, щоб бути кращими за себе вчорашнього і перемагати разом. Зараз у нас в команді вже 60 людей, і ми плануємо не зупинятися.
Наразі у нас відкрита позиція Data Engineer, який буде відповідати за налаштування інфраструктури для отримання, зберігання та обробки даних, з метою постачання дата аналітикам та подальшого отримання з даних інформації, що впливає на прийняття рішень та розвиток продуктів.
У тебе будуть такі завдання:
забезпечення постачання та трансформації даних, шляхом роботи з API Facebook, Google Ads, AppsFlyer, інших рекламних мереж
побудова архітектури сховища даних та налаштування доставки даних до нього
оптимізація існуючих процесів ETL
налаштування хмарних сервісів (AWS)
обробка, підтримка коректності та опис моделей даних
Що потрібно, щоб приєднатися до нас:
від 1 року досвіду на аналогічній позиції
впевнені знання Python, досвід створення data pipelines та роботи з dataframe (з використанням Pandas, PySpark)
вміння працювати з API
відмінні знання SQL, основ архітектури БД та досвід роботи з різними СУБД
досвід роботи зі сховищами даних та хмарними сервісами (переважно з Amazon Web Services – S3, Athena, Glue, RDS, Lambda etc.)
вміння працювати з Docker
досвід роботи з VCS, розуміння принципів CI/CD
Буде перевагою, якщо ти:
маєш досвід роботи з Apache AirFlow, Jenkins
маєш досвід розробки на GoLang, Scala
працював з аналізом продуктивності, навантажувальним тестуванням та оптимізацією модулів/системи
Що ми пропонуємо?
Роботу в команді професіоналів та з аудиторією більше одного мільйону в місяць;
Філософію та умови для твого постійного росту та розвитку;
Великий простір для втілення власних ідей і впливу на продукт.
Також, ми пропонуємо такі бенефіти:
Корпоративний лікар та медичне страхування;
Допомога з релокейтом для співробітника та сім'ї;
Компенсація додаткового навчання на зовнішніх тренінгах і семінарах та Business і Management School для співробітників;
Велика електронна бібліотека та доступ до платних онлайн-курсів і конференцій, внутрішні бесіди і воркшопи, курси англійської.
Залишай своє резюме і приєднуйся до Boosters!

info_remote: Cosys - Global Head Hunter - Capital Federal, Buenos Aires
description:
Incorporamos para una empresa un Data Engineer para un importante proyecto de Estados Unidos. Buscamos un perfil entusiasta y dinámico, dispuesto a empezar y crecer en un entorno multicultural, motivador y desafiante. Que sepa comprender las necesidades del cliente y trabaje en estrecha colaboración con los equipos correspondientes El Data Engineer liderará y desarrollará soluciones sostenibles impulsadas por datos con tecnologías de datos actuales de próxima generación para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestra organización y clientes. FUNCIONES Desarrollar, construir, probar y mantener la plataforma de análisis de AdScience Diseñar, implementar y mejorar procesos ETL (extracción, transformación y carga) Crear informes/paneles usando herramientas de visualización Reunir, transformar y conservar conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos que cumplan con los requisitos comerciales funcionales y no funcionales. Crear y optimizar canalizaciones de datos, arquitecturas y conjuntos de datos Construir interfaces de datos de complejidad moderada, conectándose a fuentes internas y externas Participar en el diseño de estándares de arquitectura de datos. Diseñar e implementar modelos lógicos y físicos de bases de datos. Proporcionar soporte de desarrollo y producción para solucionar todas las interfaces de datos y problemas relacionados con el modelo de datos. Implementar sistemas para el seguimiento de la calidad y consistencia de los datos. Hacer que los datos sean visibles y accesibles para los usuarios empresariales Comunicarse y trabajar con éxito con el liderazgo del departamento, contactos externos y equipos multifuncionales para cumplir con las responsabilidades. Mantener la confidencialidad de la información personal. Interactuar con otros de manera profesional y ser una persona de confianza Otras funciones y responsabilidades que le sean asignadas

Empresa de consultoría tecnológica que cuenta con equipos de desarrollo. Nos asociamos con organizaciones que se benefician de nuestro compromiso de reclutar y cultivar un equipo de tecnólogos con una profunda experiencia técnica, la capacidad de aportar valor a los equipos internos desde el primer día y que entienden las prioridades y los impulsores comerciales.

Requisitos

¿Qué te haría un/a candidato/a ideal para éste puesto? Licenciatura en Negocios, Marketing (con fuertes habilidades analíticas), Economía, Ciencia de Datos, Análisis de Datos o un campo similar Fuertes habilidades matemáticas, analíticas y de resolución de problemas. Paquete de Microsoft Office: Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Equipos Gestión de bases de datos Postgresql, SQLServer y Redshift y conocimientos de SQL Experiencia con Tableau (escritorio y servidor en línea) Excelente comunicación por escrito y verbalmente. Trabajar bien en equipo y fomentar la confianza. Motivado y confiable con el cumplimiento de los plazos. Impulsado y creativo en la búsqueda de soluciones únicas. Valorar el conocimiento y la educación. Experiencia laboral comprobable como administrador de base de datos. Supervisar el rendimiento de la base de datos, implementar cambios y aplicar nuevos parches y versiones cuando sea necesario Inglés avanzado

Beneficios

¿Qué beneficios tenemos para ofrecerte? Regalo de cumpleaños Prepaga de primera calidad Picada de bienvenida Aguinaldo (en relación de dependencia) Descuentos en Cursos de idiomas, los mejores institutos de Tecnología y más beneficios corporativos

Opportunity to work with world class technologies and be a part of a highly driven team 
Permanent, full-time role – Flexible location Melbourne, Sydney or Perth
Rewarding remuneration and benefits 

About Alinta Energy:
 At Alinta Energy, we’re constantly striving to do better. Whether it’s lowering customers costs, providing world class local service or sustainable energy, our aim is to be better. And to keep getting better day after day. Better for our customers. Better for Australia. And better for our environment.
 It’s an exciting time to become a part of our growing team at Alinta Energy. Our people are our greatest asset and we’re committed to a culture that’s focussed on being better at providing great service externally and internally. An organisation where people truly matter. That’s better.
 We’re a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of 3,000MW, over 1 million combined electricity and gas retail customers, and around 1,000 employees across Australia and New Zealand. Supplying energy in Australia for over 20 years, today we’re a vertically integrated energy company providing generation, retail and wholesale supply of gas and electricity across Australia. We support the development of renewable energy generation and offer local customer service through support hubs in Perth, Western Australia and Morwell in Victoria.
 About the role: 
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our collaborative and innovative Data and Analytics team. As a valued member of the team, you will work on building out the new, Azure-hosted data and analytics environment and deploying and operating data pipelines against it. Responsibilities will include:

Work with project and end-user teams to build and define backlogs of work
Design solutions to meet business, technical and user requirements
Support the operation of Data & Analytics assets and data pipelines
Maintain, extend and document the metadata framework with an aim of minimising developer time, toil and cloud costs and maximising data quality
Build end-to-end data pipelines across the Azure Data Lake and Synapse Warehouse, with activities including data staging, ELT/ETL, data quality, archiving, and testing
Work as part of the Data Engineering team on profiling, sourcing, management and use of data

To be successful you will have:

Extensive Data Engineering pipeline design and implementation experience within a commercial environment
Experience working with metadata-based ELT/ETL frameworks
Experience using Databricks, Python, Scala or Java code against large-scale, cloud-based data warehouses that make use of big-data frameworks like Spark, Kafka, Hive and Map-Reduce
Prior experience working in/with DevOps teams and comfortable with DevOps/SRE thinking
Skill in data modelling and in designing Data Vaults and Kimball-based data models
Previous experience in working with legacy data warehouses and reverse-engineering designs from undocumented code
A results orientation, willingness to commit to a direction and drive operations to completion
Demonstrated experience in breaking down complex problems and projects into manageable goals

Experience with reverse engineering legacy code (Microsoft SSIS/SSRS), and/or Microsoft Azure Certified Data Engineer accreditation will be highly regarded.
 This a great opportunity for an experienced Data Engineer who is looking to work in a supportive and easy-going team that offers flexibility, on the job learning, and exposure to different projects across the business. If you are looking to work for an organisation that is renowned for its data and analytics capability, then apply now.
 Working at Alinta Energy you will have access to a range of benefits, such as:

Flexible work options for most roles where you can work a combination of days from the office and from home
Staff Energy Offer (where products are available)
Employee Referral Bonus
Salary Packaging options
Full access to Headspace Application
Salary continuance insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Purchased leave
Community volunteer leave

Let’s spread the positive energy together…
 Alinta Energy is a Circle Back Initiative employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
 Alinta Energy takes the safety and wellbeing of our people seriously. We require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be able to attend our workplaces.
 Please note that if your application progresses you will be required to complete background/pre-employment checks. These checks may include but are not limited to - right to work/immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, checks, qualification checks and additional finance checks for finance related positions.
 Click “APPLY” to submit your application. Closing Date: 13th of May

The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com. 
 

Let's talk about the team:
 Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.Due to continued growth within Capgemini's Insights & Data practice we intend to recruit a Analyst Programmer with relevant consulting and communication skills. If you are already working in a consultancy role, or have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations, we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you 
 

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:


Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets to meet functional / non-functional requirements
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration and collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions

Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:


University degree in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent Math's and Science Degree.
At least 1 year of experience in the following:
Knowledge or experience in programming languages, such as Java, Python, C++.
Knowledge or Experience with SQL development, an Understanding of Stored Procedures and Functions.
Knowledge or Experience in one RDBMS such as MS SQL Server, MySql.
Knowledge or Experience in version control platforms such as GitHub, Gitlab or AWS Beanstalk.
Knowledge or Experience in cloud platforms - AWS, Azure, Google.
Knowledge or experience in Software development life cycle and Agile Development methodologies.
 Nice to have 
 


Knowledge or interest in Data Engineering and ETL pipelines
Knowledge or interested in Data Science (Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing)
Knowledge of CI/CD DevOps practices.
Knowledge of Message Brokers Such as Jboss, Kafka, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Event Hub.
Knowledge or experience Big Data Technologies such as Hadoop, Cloudera, Spark, Scala.
Knowledge or experience in Machine Learning Platforms such as Knime,
Knowledge or experience working in Unix/*nic with Bash/Shell scripting
 Let's talk about what's in it for you! 
 Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. 
 As 'Architects of Positive Futures', Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways: 
 Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini and OutFront support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change. 
 Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days. 
 Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious 'A list' for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. We are focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models and committing to reduce our own carbon emissions (GHG) by 20% per employee by 2020. 
 Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 8 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, click here to listen to some of our employee's stories. 
 Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures. 
 
 Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. 
 #LI-YT1

info_remote: ANZ Banking Group - 1,160 reviews - Melbourne VIC
description:
About the role

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communites thrive, and to achieve this, we need talented Data Egineers to join our Home Loans tribe. The Home Loans tribe is responsible for making great home loan experiences possible by reliably providing easy to use products and services. We’re passionate about simplicity and meeting the needs of our customers today, while innovating to delight them tomorrow.

Our scope is the design, manufacture and management of a simple range of home loan products to bring the customer proposition to life.

In joining this Tribe, you will be working with a group of highly engaged, diverse and interesting people.

As a Data Engineer in the Home Loan tribe you will be responsible for designing and creating data processing solutions that enable value from analytic models to drive rapid decision making.

A key element of this is driving the data engineering agenda within the Home Loan Tribe, ensuring delivery of best practice end-to-end data engineering respecting ANZ architecture standards. You will challenge inefficient engineering practise in ANZ and influence change in your field to drive better business outcomes. To this end, in the role you will implement smart and relevant data engineering to drive E2E application delivery and support the uplift of data engineering capability in Home Loan Tribe, while linking in to the wider Enterprise Analytics roadmap.

What will your day look like

As a Data Engineer in our Forensics reporting squad, your role is to contribute to the Forensic tactical solutions and development of the Forensics Strategic eco-system to ensure that our portfolio is healthy and that ANZ is meeting our Customer Promise.

Liaise with business stakeholders to understand requirements and best practic of the Forensics eco-system;

Work collaboratively with stakeholders within and outside of your squad to build new components to the eco-system and transition tactical solutions into the eco-system

Source data from a variety of sources to combine, synthesise and automate to deliver the eco-system

Support transition from tactical to Strategic solution through assisting Data Analysts in running & maintaining tactical Forensic report

Support Strategic solution through creation of new reporting data modelling designs;

Actively participate in daily standups, Sprint Planning, Showcases and Retrospective ceremonies

Support a fact-based culture throughout the bank through ensuring the eco-system has accurate data sourced from proven reliable sources.

Clearly communicate and present updates to technical and non-technological stakeholders

Educate and upskill the squad and chapter on data engineering applications and methods to improve efficiency and accuracy and service to our customers

What will you bring?

Required

MS or BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent practical experience in Data Engineering

A strong background in data processing and software engineering and can build high quality, scalable data products

Strong Software Engineering experience with proficiency in at least one high-level programming language (Python, Java, Scala)

Experience with SQL, PSQL

Experience and proficiency in at least one high-volume data processing environment (Teradata, Oracle, Cloudera, BigQuery or equivalent)

Ability to quickly synthesis business requirements and translate into business & data requirements

Some experience wrangling data, understanding and validation of data from different sources to build effective, sustainable analytical assets

Experience working in a team environment

Advantageous

Analytical and inquisitive mindset to learn and continuously improve the delivery of data assets and how Data Analysts use the assets.

Analytical & problem-solving skills to understand the complexity of our data

Thorough approach to detail, ensuring a high level of accuracy

You will have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong stakeholder relationships both internally and externally

You will have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong stakeholder relationships both internally and externally

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture and we actively encourage people to try new things. So if this role interests you and you feel you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter. We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off

Great discounts on our financial products, and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap

Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads, with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us?

Click Apply Now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role.

Please Note: After your initial application you may be asked to complete an online assessment, this invite will be sent to you via email from our assessment partner SHL. Please action this request as early as possible, this will enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update in a timely manner.

Job Posting End Date

11/05/2022, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

Our client has made waves across Victoria with its Data and Information Management projects. Stable and provides cutting edge Data Services to essential services. You will be joining a new project for a Data Platform Build in Azure.
 Your Benefits:

Full time permanent
Hybrid – WFH/Office – very flexible
Latest Cloud Tech – Azure
ASAP Start
Established brand

Your role:

Leading the development of data analytics solutions such as data warehouses, data lakes and real-time data processing systems.
Contribute to technical client interviews and facilitating workshops with key stakeholders.
Gathering and documenting technical requirements and specifications.
Analysing and understanding a client's business and data to create data models to the required business specifications.
Using ETL tools and languages such as SQL and Python to move, prepare and transform data

You will need: 

Relevant Tertiary Education – IT or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated experience working within the local market on relevant systems such as data warehouses, BI & analytics solutions and real-time data processing solutions
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and data analysis skills
Demonstrated experience working in Azure or has worked on other cloud and happy to up-skill
Proficient SQL and ETL
Proficiency in Python highly desirable.
Proficient knowledge of data modelling fundamentals.

If you are looking for an exciting new role where you will be valued and want to work on longer term projects this role is for you. APPLY now.

We’re Slyp, Australia’s first and only independent fintech backed by all four major banks.
 We build solutions that are simple on the outside but complex on the inside. The type of solutions that make you wonder why they never existed before.
 Founded by former PayPal executives in 2017, Slyp has created the Smart Receipt. Set to be Australia’s new receipt standard, the Smart Receipt is sent right inside your bank app. Convenience at its finest, while taking action for our planet.
 Australia prints a whopping 1 billion meters of non-recyclable toxic paper receipts each year. But this is just the start of the problem. Paper receipts are also a missed opportunity to understand and engage shoppers’ post-purchase. 
We’re at a pivotal moment of growth. More than 13 million Aussies will have access to Smart Receipts in their bank app by the end of 2022. And we’re building even more solutions off the back of the Smart Receipt, shaping the future of data-driven in-store experiences.
 Our values – ‘the Slyp six’ – form the heart of everything we do. And they’re part of the reason we’re now 50 Slypsters strong and recently picked up a bunch of awards: Fintech Awards 2021 Australian Fintech of Year, CEO of the Year, Best Social Mission, and Best Fintech-Bank Collaboration & a Pause Fest “I wish I’d done that” award finalist.
 This is your chance to join as part of Slyp’s foundational team as we shape the future of data driven in-store experiences. 
What does a normal day look like

Build, maintain and improve Slyp’s data lake platform. This includes working with raw and optimised data formats and making the data accessible to external tooling
Build, maintain and improve a data warehouse. This includes building infrastructure, data lake integration and support for reporting and data products
Work with the data team to define data models.
Plan, scope and build data products and infrastructure.
Follow and contribute to engineering best practices.
Engage with engineering and product in planning, design, code reviews, and technical discussions.
Build data platforms and products that can cope with huge scale
Secure access to data to authorised users.
Experiment with new technologies. We're always open to solving problems utilising new thinking.

What experience or knowledge you will bring to the team

Passion about all things data and engineering.
This is not your first rodeo. You have some experience shaping Data Engineering in a start-up or the early stages of a data function before.
Highly efficient in python & SQL
Comfortable around data lake and data warehousing practices, and integration techniques
In-depth knowledge in Software Engineering, Design Patterns and Agile Software Development.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms, such as Elasticsearch, Hadoop, AWS Redshift, AWS EMR and Dynamo DB.
Experience with the CICD of data platforms.
Expertise in creating ETLs that are highly efficient and scalable.
A deep understanding of what it takes to build scalable platforms using techniques around eventual consistency, caching and monitoring.

Finally, a little on our technology 

Cloud based and AWS hosted.
We lean heavily on AWS serverless technologies such as API Gateway (including CloudFront, WAF and Shield), Lambda, Kinesis and SQS.
We store data in AWS Aurora (Postgres), DynamoDB and S3.
Our data lake is based on AWS serverless technologies such as Kinesis, Lambda, S3 and Glue.
We embrace native mobile and make it easier for our partners to integrate our SDKs.
We have traditional NodeJS services running in EKS / Kubernetes.
Our base is a mix of Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS, HTML5, CSS, React, Redux and some Angular.
We value customer data and keep security front of mind and at our core with AWS SecurityHub.

Benefits

Competitive salary + equity 
Uncapped annual leave. We dig deep when we need to, but know rest and recovery is just as important.
Giveback days.
Generous L&D program: we want you to continue to hone your craft.
Parental leave, flexible work, and the option to work from anywhere in the world for a period. 
Sweet offices, monthly (sometimes random) lunch and learns and always on team fun.
