Let’s start with an easy question: Do you get the thrills when talking about complex data and data models? Yes? Okay, so far so good. Let’s jump to the next one: Would you like to be part of one of the best fintech companies coming out of Copenhagen, Denmark with ambitions to expand to new markets? If you can answer YES to this as well then we are off to a pretty good start. Let’s continue.
We are Risika. Data lovers, Culture geeks, Visionaries, Doers, Leaders, Gamers, Learners, Explores, Moms, Dads, Dog lovers, Strategists, Foodies but most importantly we are People-People and we genuinely believe that our people are the most important part of our company. Still with us? Great, then please keep reading.
We are looking for a Data Scientist based out of Copenhagen that has the experience and skills to take us to the next level, but buying into the above and having a “we” approach to your job is an absolute must. Perfect, you are on board with that as well. Let’s dive a bit deeper into the role.
As a Data Scientist in Risika, you will be working with large amounts of Financial and company data. You will get to work closely with the development of our Data Science Pipeline in a production level environment. This includes everything from the IT-infrastructure and scalability of our pipelines to feature and model-development!
We would like you to
Feel comfortable with taking ideas to action in the least possible time
Have a broad background with statistics and machine learning
Help us understand the data that we get and convert it into value
Expand and develop our machine learning models and pipelines in a production environment
Take responsibility of models deployed in production (including troubleshooting and maintenance)
Be comfortable with being on a scaleup journey where things can be a bit chaotic at times
Believe and enjoy that data preparation and preprocessing is just as important as creating the actual models
An understanding of financial statements and models - this is not a must but a great plus
What we would like you to have
Experience from a similar role and it would be amazing if you have a master’s degree in computer science, statistics, physics, mathematics or equivalent
Experience with processing and working with real-world data, and intuition with identifying and mitigating potential data and modelling bias.
Experience with neural networks and other machine learning techniques
Great programming skills in Python and SQL
Experience with production level code
A driven approach to your work and being okay with taking responsibility
An open minded approach to coaching and willingness to always learn new things
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and other languages are just a huge plus
You’ll probably have some other topics and ideas that we need to solve and that’s why the above bullets are what we imagine the main focus would be but we expect that you lay down the cards and help us understand what we need to focus on achieving our goals.
Currently, our Data Science department consists of three people. We have 8 models in production delivering automated risk-assessments or probability of distress in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and the United Kingdom.
What you can expect from us
Of course we offer all the lovely benefits like an awesome location in the heart of Copenhagen, flexible working hours, lunch and all of that good stuff. But the most important part is that we offer you the opportunity to join a one of a kind startup journey where you can create real impact (not just the buzz word kind of impact but real impact where you take full responsibility of your area of expertise) and work together with the friendliest and brightest minds in the industry.
About us
In 2017 a small group of FinTech nerds from Copenhagen hatched a vision to challenge the faceless and old-school status quo within the exotic industry of financial risk management. We leverage machine learning to help companies predict paying and non-paying customers, while delivering more ideal customers, through the Risika platform. Our ever growing collection of nerdy teamplayers has origins in auditing, sales, data and computer science, all gathered to make sure that our solutions are as flexible, automated, and reliable as possible. We are trusted by more than 1000 finance and sales professionals across the Nordics, and we are closing in on 100 champagne celebrations since we started - a ritual that manifests our triumph virtue.

You'll be a key part of our tech team that is responsible for all data-related questions. Your role is to leverage data into an asset across the entire organisation. You will be working with our entire lifecycle of data: from collecting data to analysing data. You will also be responsible for developing complex models - in a way that is compliant with the regulatory frameworks.
You will be working closely with Tech, Product and our CEO while collaborating heavily with other departments to identify and provide solutions to data needs. You'll play an important role in shaping the way we think and interact with data as a business.
Data is the key to how we solve the infertility challenges for hundreds of millions of people that will face this challenge now and in the future. That is why this role is key to our success.
About you:
You have a strong computation or mathematical background
You have a passion for data. You will need to gain a deep understanding of our platform and support our Product team to generate more.
You have an understanding for making trade-offs on technical work against business impact.
Many of our biggest technical & data decisions are still ahead of us. You enjoy being a part of defining the company and making these decisions.
You have opinions on what good data standards and processes should look like.
You enjoy enabling clinics and patients to make better decisions.
Your responsibilities:
Building and maintaining our data set and warehouse
Structuring and maintaining our datasets.
Maintaining and scaling our analytics solutions
Identifying needs and opportunities from our Product & Tech teams to enable data-driven decisions
Deploy new models into production
Participate in navigating the regulatory requirement
What we offer:
At wawa, we offer everyone a competitive salary (including meaningful equity) and a flexible working arrangement with a great and inspiring team. We believe in providing our team with little extras that are high quality and meaningful. For example, we have a personal trainer on a weekly basis, have plenty of healthy snacks and a good coffee machine.
Why wawa fertility?
At wawa fertility our mission is to help more people get a chance to start a family. At wawa we are empowering patients going through fertility treatment - supporting them from diagnostics to birth.
We are working with consumer facing technologies as well as large quantities of complex data providing transformative insights on fertility treatments, lifestyle and outcomes to increase success rates and patient experience. Our first product is an intelligent fertility assistant empowering women and couples all the way from diagnostics to birth.
We believe that starting a family is a basic fundamental right. However, for many people it is not that easy. Infertility is the most widespread chronic disease for people between 20-45. Unfortunately, the current fertility treatment model is broken. There has been little focus on patient experience, no holistic view on patients and the success rates for assisted reproductive technology (ART) are only between 20% and 30%.
wawa fertility are working to create the future of fertility treatment where patients are an active part of their own treatment and data is used for improving patient experience and treatment outcome.
We are looking for people to join us in building a future where fertility treatment is accessible to everyone.
wawa fertility is the leading fertility platform in the nordics. Already now we have 30.000 users as a part of our community.
We are very proud to be selected by European VCs as one of the 15 health tech startups to watch in Europe
wawa are driven by the mission to transform fertility treatment. Join our team if
You want to give more people a chance to start a family
You love solving complex problems with data and technology
You want to work with something that will impact the lives of hundreds of millions of people
Finding the right people to build wawa fertility’s success has been crucial from the beginning. These are the qualities we look for:
Passion: We are looking for people who are driven to achieve something against all odds and enjoy it at the same time.
Creativity: Do you connect the dots in an original way seeing things that others cannot see? We need that kind of thinking to change a whole sector.
Impact driven: You are mission driven and not afraid to cross boundaries. Relentlessly focusing on going the extra mile to solve the problem that you are working with.
Proactive: You make things happen, instead of waiting for them to happen to you.

Elements Global Services is an award-winning HR Technology and Services Company revolutionizing the way employers expand and manage employees internationally. Our mission is simple. To simplify global expansion through a revolutionary technology that removes the barriers of globalization to give our customers the speed to market to EXPAND their business, ONBOARD employees, MANAGE compliance, and PAY worldwide! Global expansion is becoming more and more a part of the modern workplace, and with that comes things like remote work and spread-out teams. As Elements is a truly global company, we take care of our client’s employees worldwide. From Chicago to Manila, from Johannesburg to Delhi and Hong Kong, we provide top-class benefits to all the employees we serve every day. With offices all around the world and teams spread out between multiple time zones, you too can benefit from the “Glocal” team strategy, giving our employees the flexibility, they need to do their very best work the best way they can.

Position Overview

A revolution cannot be done alone, and we need the best and brightest talent to continue our growth into the new modern workplace. We are looking to expand our team by hiring a new Senior Data Scientist, a team player who is ready to make the role their own and bring their own ideas and innovations to the table. Reporting to the Director of Engineering, you will be supporting our data platform team.

Key Responsibilities

Work on and shape an uncharted domain/greenfield data science project.
Identify business problems and find the right data/mathematical techniques to address them.
Develop machine learning models to classify objects, identify patterns, support decisions, make recommendations, predict outcomes.
Create high-quality data visualizations.
Educate and train others on Data Science related matters. Present mathematical models in a clear and informative way.

 About You

You have a Masters or Ph.D. degree in applied mathematics, computer science, or other quantitative discipline.
You have 5+ years of experience as a data scientist.
Prior experience with SQL and NoSQL.
You understand the concept of distributed systems/computing.
You know a variety of classification, regression, clustering, dimension reduction, ensemble etc. techniques, for example, random forest, linear/logistic regression, CNN, SVM, PCA.
You have at least theoretical knowledge about the NLP techniques.
You are experienced with modern data science tools, for example, Databricks/Jupyter notebook, AutoML/MLOps/MLFlow/SageMaker/Azure ML.You have experience with some of Spark/MLlib and/or Python ML libraries, for example, NumPy, Scipy, SciKit-Learn, Pandas, TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch, OpenAI, OpenNLP, and you always know which one to use.
You understand why data wrangling is vital. You know how to build ML pipelines, tune hyperparameters train/test/validate/evaluate/deploy models.
You know data visualization tools, for example, Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib.
You feel comfortable with at least one of the Cloud providers.
Passion for building something new, explore uncharted areas, learning new techniques and methodologies.
Experience with productionalization of data science solutions.
You are a storyteller and have tens/hundreds of stories about earlier projects.

 What We Value

You have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
You are an out of the box thinker.
You have fluency in English.

What We Offer

Opportunity to work a company that is revolutionizing the market and is experiencing exponential growth.
Allow your inspirational ideas to come to life in a highly creative and executional environment.
Opportunity to work remotely.
Ability to work in an organization with over 40 nationalities all over the world, which embraces diversity, inclusion, and belonging at its core.
The opportunity to challenge in a high performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact.


This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required.


Elements Global Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Elements is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Elements is based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Elements will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Elements encourages applicants of all ages.


This role may be subject to a background check after an employment offer has been made and final employment will be subjective to a positive result, in addition, reference may be requested at the final stage of the process.

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team - one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.


Job Title
Data Scientist Consultant, Advisors

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for (COMPANY NAME), providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. We combine traditional management consulting with our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. While specializing in the payments industry, (COMPANY NAME) Data & Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.
We are looking for passionate and talented professionals, who share our vision for data-driven consulting, to join us and take a leading role in shaping the growth of our team.
Make an Impact as a Data Scientist Consultant
As a Data Scientist Consultant, you will have the opportunity to actively contribute to client engagements across a range of industries and types of projects in the field of data, analytics and consulting:
Work on data mining, model development, time series analysis, forecasting, segmentation tasks
Create predictive models using AI and machine learning techniquesGain knowledge on metrics, measurements, and benchmarking practices across multiple industry verticals.
Review analytics end-products to ensure accuracy, quality and timelinessBuild behavioral scorecards for target marketing and risk management solutions using econometric and statistical modeling techniquesGenerate key hypotheses and structure work at the stream or project levelGain an in depth understanding of the payments industry
Synthesize analyses into clear, sound recommendations; take responsibility for structuring and writing reports and client ready presentations
Develop collaborative working relationships with local and global teams including business partnersProactively seek new knowledge and be able to structure project streams with minimal oversight
In supporting the problem-solving process to drive high-value decisions, you will work closely with team members of various levels and contribute to the firm's intellectual capital and solution development. At (COMPANY NAME), you are expected to not only have a tremendous impact in transforming our clients, but also have a leading role in shaping the organization's future.
Bring your Passion and Expertise
We recruit for and value the following core competencies:
Passion: Actively seeks responsibility and takes pride in delivering the highest quality results and recommendations to our clients.Analytic Excellence: Demonstrates a strong aptitude for structured problem solving and quantitative skills.Project Management: Clear interest in project delivery with business clients, and intuition for the way that companies make decisions.Communication and Presence: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in client-facing situations, positioning (COMPANY NAME)'s solutions as high value solutions in sales and delivery conversations.Teamwork: Willingness to work within small teams to produce outstanding deliverables, with a will to win attitude.Integrity: Commitment to (COMPANY NAME)'s values of honesty and integrity with a willingness to embrace and learn from our mistakes.Diverse Perspective: Brings a unique skillset or approach to the table in every client engagement or internal activity.
Qualifications:
2 years+ of experience working with Python and/or RExperience with databases and tools: SQL, Hadoop technologiesExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills and ability to structure analyses to form data-driven solutions to ambiguous client challengesHave an understanding of hands-on business analysis, databases, modeling, end to end analytics solutions
Be able to speak in the language of data and the language of businessAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writing - in English and the local office language(s)Demonstrated ability to build trust-based relationships with colleagues and clientsAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environmentCandidates must be eligible to work in the country of which they are applying for a position in, as well as eligible to apply for travel visas as required by travel needs.
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside (COMPANY NAME) offices until further notice.
In the US, (COMPANY NAME) is a government contractor, which may legally require most (COMPANY NAME) employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter (COMPANY NAME) offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at (COMPANY NAME).
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to (COMPANY NAME) assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, (COMPANY NAME) is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by (COMPANY NAME)'s security policies and practices;Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;Report any suspected information security violation or breach, andComplete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with (COMPANY NAME)'s guidelines.

info_remote: WorkFusion - 5 reviews - Dublin, County Dublin - Remote
description:
About us
 Our mission is to accelerate the world’s transition to more meaningful work. By automating repetitive, data-intensive tasks and processes at scale, WorkFusion eliminates mundane business activities so companies can serve their customers faster and better. As a world leader in process automation for banking, financial services, and insurance, we offer an unrivaled digital workforce platform that enables enterprises to increase workforce capacity, enhance customer satisfaction, and ensure ongoing compliance. We compete in the world’s fastest-growing software segment and are growing at record pace with customers and team members spanning the globe.

 Position
 WorkFusion is looking for a skilled Sr. Data Scientist to join our NYC team in building exciting new automation capability through design and implementation of cutting-edge AI. This position requires a data scientist with a deep understanding of Machine Learning techniques and hands-on experience applying them to solve business problems. At WorkFusion, we apply machine learning and statistical techniques to classify and extract relevant information from vast amounts of structured and unstructured documents. This role encompasses data acquisition, feature engineering, model development and experimentation. An objective, data-driven approach to experimentation, combined with the ability to fit research to business objectives are key to success. In addition to active teamwork within our talented data science team; this role requires collaboration with Data Analysts, Professional Services, Product and other business stakeholders. This role presents the unique opportunity to apply machine learning and achieving tangible business outcomes while learning and growing professionally with a cross-cultural and talented Data Science team.

 Key responsibilities

Translating business requirements into ML model specifications


Collect, clean and study data


Design and conduct experiments


Design feature extractors, post-processors and other ML transforms as necessary


Design models and ML architectures, implement training, testing and collect metrics


Infer results from metrics and create visualizations


Present results to stakeholders


Build or extend machine learning frameworks as necessary


Troubleshoot customer problems related to WorkFusion’s AutoML framework


Support professional services engagements by implementing custom solutions


Research applicable Machine Learning techniques by reading latest academic papers, attending conferences and interacting with peers in the ML community


Follow ML best practices


Work with Engineering to help integrate latest research models into production environments


 Qualifications/Experience

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Math or Physics with 5+ years of professional work experience involving Machine Learning OR


Fluency with Python, Numpy and Pandas


Java programming skills are a plus


Expertise in data analysis, classical machine learning


Experience applying Regression, Classification, Clustering


Experience applying Decision Tree, Random Forest, SVM, Naïve Bayes


Familiarity with Deep Learning approaches (CNN, RNN, GAN, POS, BERT, Stanford CoreNLP, Spacy)


Experienced in applying Scikit-learn / TPOT


Working knowledge of Tensorflow, Keras or PyTorch


Experience with AutoML frameworks like H2O Driverless ai are a plus


 Benefits:

Location flexibility – we are a remote-friendly company 
High impact work on building and scaling cutting edge AI and ML products including ML Ops and federated learning
Comprehensive benefits package: 
    
Medical insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Life insurance
Pension plan

Ben jij momenteel werkzaam als Data Scientist en wil je de volgende stap in je carrière maken? Beschik je over sterke analytische vaardigheden en sterke Excel-vaardigheden? Houd je van het proces van het voorbereiden, transporteren en opschonen van data? Solliciteer nu voor jouw droombaan!
Voor onze partner in de omgeving van Zeist zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste en gedreven kandidaat. Bij dit bedrijf staat groei centraal. Je wordt zowel op persoonlijk als professioneel vlak uitgedaagd en het is mogelijk om diverse trainingen te volgen. Je wordt aangemoedigd om je te blijven ontwikkelen en er zijn volop doorgroeimogelijkheden. Heb je relevante (stage)ervaring in bovenstaande functies, dan leren we je graag kennen!

Taken en verantwoordelijkheden:

Het analyseren en structureren van databronnen door de inzet van nieuwe technologie
Analyseren van informatie om afdelings- en organisatiedoelstellingen te volgen
Het bedenken en uitvoeren van technische oplossingen voor verschillende onderdelen van de organisatie (procesoptimalisatie en of automatisering)
Je bent betrokken bij het bouwen en valideren van (voorspellende) modellen
Direct contact met belanghebbenden: het opschonen van data schetsen en verwachtingen managen
De integriteit van gegevens en informatie handhaven door regelmatig afstemmingen uit te voeren
Markttrends en veranderingen volgen
Uitvoeren van ad-hoc rapportages

Skills en opleiding:

Een bachelor diploma in IT (of een ander statistisch gedreven expertisegebied)
Je hebt meerdere jaren relevante werkervaring in vergelijkbare functies
Sterke analytische en Excel-vaardigheden
Kennis van en ervaring met één of meerdere analytics tools zoals R, Spark, Tableau, QlikView, Power BI, MatLab
Kennis van en ervaring met programmeertalen (Java, Python, R, Scala, SQL etc.)
Uitstekende beheersing Nederlandse taal en goede beheersing Engelse taal

Wat hebben wij te bieden?

Werken in een uitdagende dynamische omgeving
Er zijn veel carrièremogelijkheden binnen het bedrijf
Veel ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen en je vaardigheden naar een hoger niveau te tillen
Een goed bruto maandsalaris tussen €5000 en €6500 op basis van 40 uur, afhankelijk van relevante werkervaring
Toegang tot onze Walters People Academy zodat je je als professional kunt blijven ontwikkelen

Enthousiast geworden? Wij zien jouw sollicitatie graag tegemoet!

Ben jij momenteel werkzaam als Data Scientist en wil je de volgende stap in je carrière maken? Beschik je over sterke analytische vaardigheden en sterke Excel-vaardigheden? Houd je van het proces van het voorbereiden, transporteren en opschonen van data? Solliciteer nu voor jouw droombaan!

DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™
Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.
More information can be found at www.dsm.com.
DSM is the leader in health and nutritional solutions for human and animal applications, with a commitment to addressing these market needs in a responsible and sustainable fashion. In addition to our two primary R&D Centers located in Delft (the Netherlands) and Kaiseraugst (Switzerland), we have R&D sites in Europe, US and China and maintain long-term relationships globally with leading external research institutes and universities.


We believe that Data Science has the potential to disrupt the way Industrial Biotechnology and broader Biosciences are done and we have extensive ambitions in this area. Our global Center for Digital Innovation (CDI) works directly for business R&D projects, and plays an important role in all key processes (biotech, chemistry and formulation) including the continuous support of lab-automation and analytical groups. Next, we develop and apply advanced data analytics methods and digital twins for continuous improvement of processes in our factories globally and work on personalized nutrition and precision farming.
Within the global Center for Digital Innovation, we are looking to fill the position of Principal Data Scientist R&D who is williing be located in Delft, The Netherlands or Kaiseraugst, Switzerland.
As a Principal Scientist you will have the responsibility to oversee, challenge and contribute to the development of the Data Science capabilities within DSM R&D. You will shape a strategy for the Data Science teams, together with the four R&D Managers in the CDI and approximately 35 colleagues and apply this in R&D projects, varying from biotechnology, to food science, to human and animal studies, and support-to-business projects as a member of multidisciplinary project teams. You will also be member of the CDI Leadership team.
In those teams you will collaborate with R&D managers, bioinformaticians, experimentalists, biochemical engineers, process engineers and/or nutritional scientists. You connect to the global Data Science community of DSM, contribute to the Digital R&D strategy and translate it into business impact. You keep up with external developments in your field of expertise and contribute to the professional know-how of the DBC, the NIC and their business partners. As a Principal Data Scientist you are the most experienced member of the Data Science teams.
We offer
We offer a challenging job at our world-leading Biotechnology R&D center, fully supporting DSM’s purpose-led, performance driven strategy, high recent engagement figures and opportunity for working with the top of external and internal experts. You will work in a company with an international reputation as sustainability leader. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team performance. To learn more about DSM's HR vision and policy, please visit our website at www.dsm.com/careers.
Terms of conditions: local DSM contract

You offer
PhD or equivalent in mathematics, artificial intelligence, bioinformatics, cheminformatics, computer science, metabolic engineering, synthetic biology or a related field.
A minimum of 7 years (10+ years preferred) industrial or academic track-record after your PhD degree, involving data science applications in industrial biotechnology, nutrition and/or process industry.
Experience in FAIR data management, advanced data processing pipelines, data integration and visualization using cloud-based platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure).
Proficiency with scripting and workflow languages (e.g. Python or R) to manipulate large data sets.
Familiar with design of experiments and advanced statistics.
Experience in handling multi-omics data, microbiome data or data flows from high-throughput experimentations can be an advantage.
Experience in developing advanced data—driven and hybrid models for digital twins of either microbial strains, bioprocesses or food applications is considered a plus.
Team player, able to work with multi-disciplinary and multi-national teams
Highly innovative scientist with a drive to create and translate new ideas into practical advances, and a strong drive for results.
Strong communication skills, fluent in English.
Flexibility to travel between our main R&D Centers (Kaiseraugst, Switzerland and Delft, the Netherlands), and occasional travel to other global sites.
How to apply?
Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV & motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Clémentine Rolaff-van de Panne / Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner (Clementine.panne-van-de@dsm.com).
A Pre Employment Screening is part of this recruitment process. A reference check procedures and/or and assessment can be part of the recruitment process. You will be informed when these procedures are required.
Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and help solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.

Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on
At DSM, we believe that a brighter future is built on diversity. We’re proud to offer equal employment opportunities and to be an affirmative action employer. That means that we consider applications based on how well suited you are for the role – regardless of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status or disability.

DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™
Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.
More information can be found at www.dsm.com.
Your key responsibilities
You will be part of a global R&D team that is supporting a broad range of DSM Biotech and Food innovation, plant improvement and digitalization projects across various Business Groups of DSM from R&D, through operations to business and marketing.
You will primarily work on projects with the DSM Food & Beverages group, with it is main segments in food enzymes, dairy cultures, and savory ingredients, where digital technologies are key in the strategy to enhance ourselves as a solution provider.
You will develop and apply novel and established approaches for translating data into insights, using a broad set of data analytics methodologies, including ML/AI approaches.
You will work in multi-disciplinary teams and collaborate with experts in data science, ICT, food application experts and related business functions.
You develop deep understanding of business and user needs, translating business opportunities and pains into viable data analytics solutions.
You iterate quickly, translating two-way between domain experts in the business area and digital experts, and always keep the business problem on top of your mind.
About us
The DSM Science & Innovation community is made up of creative thinkers, who thrive in fast-paced environments and continually come up with innovative solutions to meet the changing needs of our customers. Through collaborating with people in different fields and not being afraid to try new things, we innovate exciting new products, processes, and solutions. Data and knowledge-driven insights which are unlocked through digital and analytical tools and technologies are hereby key.
Our global Center for Digital Innovation (CDI) works with all of DSM’s Science and Innovation (S&I) programs in Biosciences & Process Innovation, Food & Beverages, Human Health Nutrition & Care and Animal Nutrition & Health. We bring together data and knowledge from consumer, markets, science, technology, and translate those into insights to accelerate DSM’s innovations.
We Bring
A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business.
The chance to shape DSM and its impact for years to come.
Diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box
A team that truly cares about sustainability, each other and our customers.
A supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas.
You Bring
A flexible, agile, and solution-oriented mindset Enthusiasm and openness to learn on the job Brilliant collaborative skills a genuine passion to improve the lives of others.

Your experience
PhD in a quantitative science, plus 3+ years of additional professional experience in applying data science in a food and nutrition business setting.
 Master’s degree with a minimum of 5+ years of experience in a food and nutrition business setting.
Proven ability to translate science, business data and knowledge into actionable insights.
You are actively searching for new ideas, easily understand problems presented by the business and readily implement workable solutions.
Proven experience in data engineering, data visualization, building of self-service analytics tools, plus skills in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Expert user of data analytics software and visualization tools (e.g. Python, Power BI, Spotfire) as well as SQL and noSQL databases.
Experience with cloud-based solutions (AWS preferred) and web application development.
Experience in industrial biotechnology or the food industry is a great plus.
Strong and proven capability to identify and build digital solutions that combine information from different existing use cases and data sources of the business, through application of advanced data analytics and ML/AI.
Strong communication and explanatory skills towards non-experts and stakeholders, able to work with multi-disciplinary and multi-national teams.
Our recruitment process
The procedure will generally be in line with the DSM application process outlined on the DSM career website. Due to privacy regulations, we can only actively interact with applications via our career portal.
For further information on the recruitment process, please contact Sasha Washington at Sasha.Washington@dsm.com
Pre-employment screenings are part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be contacted when further information is required. In the Recruitment process, we will use the Occupational Personality Questionnaire to provide insight on your learning adaptability, preferred operating style and motivation for this position.

Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and
affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
At DSM, we believe that a brighter future is built on diversity. We’re proud to offer equal employment opportunities and to be an affirmative action employer. That means that we consider applications based on how well suited you are for the role – regardless of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status or disability.

For one of our top clients – a major international player in the consumer electronics sector – we are looking for a Data Scientist.

Key responsibilities:
You manage advanced analytics projects by connecting customer, marketing, and business data (Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure).

You manage data engineering projects for automatic ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) processes, as well as back-end processing and automation of marketing tools (e.g. Adobe Campaign Manager, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Target).

You manage machine learning projects on topics such as data mining for predictive marketing analytics (CRISP-DM based), customer segmentation, propensity, churn modelling, recommendation engines etc.

You support the strategy and roadmap for audience segmentation and personalization through the website, applications, CRM and digital media, and optimize performance through multivariate testing or machine learning.

You support simulation and data visualization projects (using Looker), and support ‘do-it-yourself’ analysis for end-users.

You communicate with various stakeholders in the business (mapping requirements, establishing global collaborations, evangelize data-driven marketing etc.).

Does this sound like you?

You have advanced knowledge on statistical modelling (Machine Learning and Data Science), data processing and data mining (Python and SQL), data engineering, API and cloud computing (Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure and Databricks), and data visualization (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Qlik or Looker).

You are fluent in English – both verbal and written, for communication, presentations, networking, project management and organizational skills.

You have a Masters’ degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, (Business) Economics, Quantitative Marketing or something similar.

You have at least two years of experience in a related field and function.

What’s in it for you?

The chance to work for an innovative, multicultural team within an established, well-known international player.

The possibility to work with enormous datasets and have a very big reach and power with your data efforts.

Lots of possibilities for self-development through knowledge sharing and trainings, together with the chance to grow within the organization (both horizontally and vertically).

An attractive salary package with interesting fringe benefits.

Wat doe je als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak?
Dat heb je ook zelf in de hand! Want als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak werk je in een datalab in oprichting. We maken als onderdeel van de Rechtspraak de Nederlandse rechtspraak digitaal toegankelijk. Met experimenten help jij rechters en andere medewerkers van de Rechtspraak meer datagedreven en dus beter te werken. Daarbij pas je de nieuwste technologieën toe. Spannend en ontzettend belangrijk!
Hoe je werk eruitziet
De Rechtspraak wil flinke stappen zetten in datagedreven werken. Vanuit het IVO Datalab krijg je alle ruimte om daar met experimenten aan bij te dragen. Je eigen team is jong en klein, maar je werkt nauw samen met data-analisten en data scientists van onder meer het datalab van het ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid en het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut. Genoeg sparringpartners en collega’s dus om nieuwe casussen en data-analyses op te pakken!
Bij het IVO Datalab kun je je creativiteit helemaal kwijt. Samen met collega-data scientists, juridisch medewerkers en rechters ontwikkel je allerlei analyseproducten. Dat gaat van een analyse op de datakwaliteit tot het inzetten van de nieuwste technieken voor natural language processing om relevante tekst uit een uitspraak te halen. En hoe geweldig is het om mee te werken aan een model dat alle uitspraken anonimiseert? Daarmee kunnen we ze online openbaar maken voor het publiek of wetenschappelijk onderzoek.
Aan de hand van experimenten inspireer je medewerkers van de Rechtspraak over de mogelijkheden van datagedreven werken. Zo vergroot je de datageletterdheid binnen de Rechtspraak. Dat betekent natuurlijk ook dat je goed duidelijk moet maken wat er kan en hoe dit helpt om beter te werken. Ook onderwerpen als privacy, ethiek en het operationaliseren van machine learning algoritmes staan op de agenda. Wat zijn bijvoorbeeld de randvoorwaarden om een AI-model in productie te nemen? En hoe houden we rekening met de menselijke maat bij de inzet van algoritmes? Jij denkt er allemaal over mee!
Hou je niet van een gespreid bedje, maar wel van uitdagingen, kansen en de ruimte om je ideeën in de praktijk te brengen? Dan is dit dé baan voor jou!
Wat we je bieden
Om te beginnen een leuke, informele werksfeer. We houden de lijnen graag kort! En je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn prima geregeld volgens de CAO Rijk. Wat belangrijke punten op een rij:
Je salaris is maximaal € 5.139 op basis van 36-urige werkweek. Je zit in schaal 11.
Je krijgt een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van maximaal € 841 bruto per maand (16,37%). Dit is inclusief je vakantiegeld en eindejaarsuitkering. Je kunt dit budget bijvoorbeeld laten uitkeren of in vrije dagen omzetten.
Je houdt werk en privé prima in balans, bijvoorbeeld door thuis te werken, de mogelijkheid van 4×9 uur of ouderschapsverlof. Bovendien krijg je 144 vakantie- en 21,6 IKB-uren op basis van een 36-urige werkweek.
Binnen de IVO Academy krijg je alle ruimte en is er volop aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke én vaktechnische ontwikkeling.
Bij IVO Rechtspraak stimuleren we reizen met het OV! Je krijgt een OV-chipkaart waarmee je gratis voor je werk reist.
Je pensioen is goed geregeld via het ABP.
Je krijgt in eerste instantie een jaarcontract. Functioneer je goed, dan wordt dit een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.

Meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je op www.p-direkt.nl.

Wat we van je vragen
Dit zijn de dingen waar je volgens het ideaalplaatje aan voldoet:
Je hebt minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Scientist
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis en ervaring op het gebied van statistische methodes en technieken, zoals beslisbomen, clustering, named entity recognition en process mining
Je kunt je mondeling en schriftelijk uitstekend uitdrukken: je weet complexe dataprojecten te vertalen naar de business en brengt de uitkomsten van een project helder over aan mensen van verschillende niveaus
Je bent proactief en herkent en creëert op basis van je eigen kennis en ervaring initiatieven voor data science
Je hebt hands-on-ervaring met programmeren in Python (of een vergelijkbare programmeertaal zoals R of Scala)

Kom je bij ons werken, dan vragen we ook altijd een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag.

Interesse?
Is een baan als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak iets voor jou? Reageer dan zo snel mogelijk via onderstaande button.
Meer weten? Bel Edwin Visser, Corporate IT Recruiter, via 06 55 48 18 26.
IVO Rechtspraak
Uniceflaan 1
3527 WX Utrecht
Meer weten?
Ben je benieuwd naar ervaringen van onze collega’s of naar onze andere vacatures?
Kijk dan op: www.werkenbijivo.nl

Job ID: 8948

Would you like to join crew of sharp analytical minds? We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our global team of highly skilled data scientists. We share the common passion to work with massive amount of data and deliver complex analyses and solutions, contributing towards Nordea’s digital transformation journey. A great day for us - Applying analytics to solve day-to-day banking problems using the latest technologies, big data, math & statistics.

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

Your Future Responsibilities are:

Welcome to an organization located in the Nordics and Poland with a wide range of profiles, from data scientists, engineers and statisticians to economists, researchers and IT. We add value by attracting and retaining talented high performers by being front runners in our area of expertise. We take ownership for our own development and the development of our business, and we expand competences through learning loops in a creative and appreciative rapid prototyping culture. We believe in high performing teams where everyone plays a role in reaching out for our mission to deliver world class analytics.

What you’ll be doing:

As a data scientist, you will help business areas to resolve data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing and modelling. Provide insights and recommendations through data analysis. Contribute to driving intelligent automation by through algorithmic and model-based solutions.

Collaborate with stakeholders and colleagues on using data to resolve a broad spectrum of business problems. Support and engage in teams discussions related to requirements, quality of data and methods for data manipulation
Gather requirements, extract, process and prepare data in an efficient manner for further analysis and modelling
Extract knowledge from data through visualisation, analysis and interpretation. Contribute to the dialogue on next steps towards business goals
Engage in development and prototyping of Machine Learning models to resolve identified business needs.
Make assessment and validation of model performance in development phase. Engage in optimizing the code for further steps towards model deployment
Process data according to Nordea’s data management principles and regulations. Follow AI lifecycle milestones in model development phase

You’ll join centre of excellence in Advanced Analytics team (unit of Group Data Management Office), driving Nordea’s goal towards omni-channel experience for Personal Banking customers

The role is based in Oslo, Norway.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that:
You have an excellent analytical skill and can influence others with your presentation and communication skill
You are driven by achieving concrete results and see your work leading to direct business value
You follow structured, creative & forward looking approach
You are self-driven, proactive and consult experts to take decisions in complex scenarios
You are willing to develop new skills & capabilities by working with other data scientists and leaning on Nordea’s proposed Learning framework.

Your experience and background:
You have experience working on data science projects delivering tangible benefits/outcome in the enterprise set up
You have experience processing the data in big data environment and have an understanding of associated challenges and way around while working with unstructured and real life data set up
You are comfortable in using one or more data science programming language i.e Python, Pyspark, R, SQL etc.
You have academic credentials focused on related data science field: mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering and information management etc. and you have strong understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models i.e reinforced learning, NLP, Random forest etc.
You are proficient in written and spoken English

Even better if :
You have delivered or worked in the area of automated decisioning, recommendation engine etc.
You have knowledge of basic digital marketing principles and familiarity with Nordic banking market in general
You have prior experience working in productionalized set up in-premise or cloud environment
You know your ways around tools like IBM Watson (Watson Studio), BitBucket, Hive, Unix Systems, visualization tool such as power BI, QlikSense
You have worked in SAFe agile environment

If this sounds like you, get in touch!


Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/05/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Alok Kumar, +45 23998600, alok.kumar@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

At Analyx we provide analytical services for business since 2006. Our teams apply data science to marketing strategy by developing techniques to optimize marketing spend effectiveness, churn prediction, sales forecasting and others. We use state-of-the-art marketing science methods and cast these into easy-to-operate software tools.

You will join one of our project teams to find business solutions through:

data integration and preparation,
defining and developing econometrical or machine learning models,
internal and client-side communication and preparation of main insights of the project.

We are interested in full-time cooperation. Presence in our Poznan office is expected every Tuesday and Wednesday, other days can be spent in home office.
Relevant skills:
Strong analytical skills, as well as understanding data relationships.
Hands-on experience in data analytics (at least 1 year in a similar role will be a great asset).
Experience with R and packages (or other programming language) for data preparation, visualization and modelling.
Good knowledge of MS Excel.
Familiarity with econometrical and machine learning models.
Educational background: Mathematics, Econometrics, Statistics, Computer Science.
Knowledge of English is required, knowledge of German will be appreciated.

What do we offer for you?
Experienced international team
Contributing to: Multisport, LUX MED & group insurance
Modern office in the city center
Annual bonus & annual salary review
Annual company retreats & company events
Training budget
Language courses
Wednesday lunches
Remote work
Full time
Contract of employment
Poznań

info_remote: Bayer - 5,605 reviews - Warszawa, mazowieckie - Hybrid remote
description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Senior Data Scientist Forecasting


Why Bayer?
“Health for all and Hunger for none” is our mission at Bayer. Every day, we are privileged to work on purposeful cutting-edge projects to bring our mission to life. Join us at Bayer to have a career that you can put your passion into practice and make an impact using Science for a better life.
For our newly established IT Hub, we are looking for:

Senior Data Scientist – Forecasting

 You will be responsible for:
Support of business and innovation projects in the Consumer Health Division in the areas of sales, product supply, and financial forecasting.
Independently perform statistical analysis, computer programming, predictive modeling, and experimental design.
Lead projects applying an agile approach to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions.
Establish a strong link with stakeholders in the business to help shape and execute the digital agenda strategy.
Deliver complex projects employing advanced simulation, modeling, and machine learning techniques integrating multi-layered data models from internal and external sources.
Maintain awareness of the state-of-the-art application of AI in life science and CPG/FMCG industries and research.
Develop sustainable, consumable, accurate, and impactful reporting on model inputs, model outputs, observed outputs, business impact, and key performance indicators.
Present compelling, validated stories to all levels of the organization, including peers, senior management, and internal customers to drive both strategic and operational changes in the business.
Lead scaling up activities transforming data science prototypes to end-to-end solutions by leveraging skills across a large IT unit working

 We would expect from you:
Bachelor's degree with 8+ yrs of experience or Master's 6+ yrs of experience or Ph.D. degree with 3+ years of experience.
Educational preparation or applied experience in at least one of the following areas: Machine Learning, Electrical/Industrial Engineering, Statistical Genetics, Statistics, 2 RESTRICTED Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Genomics, Computational Biology, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or other related quantitative disciplines.
Expert level knowledge in at least one of the following areas of Machine Learning: Timeseries analytics, Bayesian Methods, and/or Deep Learning
Passionate about using statistical and mathematical tools to make the world a better and more efficient place.
Very good coding knowledge in Python and/or R incl. ability to analyze data.
Strong business analyst skills and strong experience interacting with very diverse customers are required.
Good knowledge of database, data mining, and integration tools, e.g. SQL, KNIME, Trifacta, etc.
Good communication competencies include presentations and delivery of complex quantitative analyses in a clear, concise, and actionable manner to broad audiences and key stakeholders across multiple functions.
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and agile environment.
Fluent in English both written and spoken

 In the exchange we will offer you:
A flexible hybrid work model
Career development, 360° Feedback & Mentoring programme
Wide access to professional development tools, trainings, & conferences
Competitive salary, annual bonus & top performers awards
VIP Medical Care Package (including Dental & Mental health)
Pension plan
Holiday allowance (“Wczasy pod gruszą”)
Life & Travel Insurance
Co-financed sport card with unlimited usage
Meals Subsidy in Office
Home Office Setup & Maintenance allowance
New & exciting open office space coming in Spring ‘22

Our inclusive culture at Bayer:

Bayer is an equal opportunity employer. We care about inclusion in terms of gender, age, race, skin color, nationality, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, background, physical or mental disabilities and on every other grounds. Applying for our position, we assure you that we will assess your application solely on the basis of your competencies.

description:

We are looking for you if:
You want to be part of an international, diverse, dynamic and skilful team of peers
You are willing to learn and share knowledge within and across teams
You have at least 2 years of experience in the Artificial Intelligence domain or a strongly related area
You are an experienced Python programmer familiar with mainstream ML/analytics libraries (e.g. Sklearn, PySpark, NumPy, Pandas)
You are knowledgeable about statistical inference (e.g. predictive analytics) and machine learning, for example (un)supervised learning, clustering, regression, classification
You have a solid knowledge of Apache Spark and are familiar with Jupyter notebooks (e.g. zeppelin)
You are familiar with (or willing to learn) AIOps, CICD, ML pipelines
You are familiar with SQL, Linux systems, and command-line interfaces
You have some experience with data collection, organisation, and visualisation tools and techniques
Additionally, you will score for:
Experience with Big Data,
Skills required to develop, implement and continuously improve data pipelines,
More than 3 years of experience in the Analytics domain,
Practice in multi-national complex projects,
Being able to explain complex concepts in simple terms
A security background..
Information about squad:
The HUNT team uses state-of-the-art techniques to improve existing monitoring capabilities and monitor new risks on the security landscape. Hunters develop new solutions and test new products to improve detection and aid in analysing security incidents. As a data scientist in our HUNT team, you would be responsible for the entire lifecycle of our analytics models. You will learn and teach, interact with more experienced and junior colleagues, and be part of the data flow design, model selection, optimisation, and finally, deployment of AI-driven models. Those models cover a diverse set of use-cases within the domain of security detection.

tworzenie przyjaznego środowiska pracy dla data science,
 współtworzenie i rozwój platform ML Ops,
 wdrożenia rozwiązań AI we wszystkich obszarach banku,
 udział w pracach Chapter AI, gdzie współtworzymy best practice oraz standardy,
 popularyzacja AI w firmie poprzez aktywne uczenie siebie i innych.
 znajomość i praktyczna biegłość w zakresie machine learning,
 swoboda w tworzeniu modeli predykcyjnych takich jak: drzewa decyzyjne, lasy losowe, regresja logistyczna czy sieci neuronowe,
 bardzo dobra znajomość Python oraz umiejętność programowania obiektowego,
 doświadczenie w zakresie tworzenia segmentacji, w tym metodami nienadzorowanymi,

 Mile widziane:

 znajomość Java lub C++,
 doświadczenie w projektach technologicznych,
 biegły angielski w mowie i piśmie.

About us

Who we are? We are Big Data experts , working with international clients, creating and leading innovative projects related to the Big Data environment. We offer tailor-made solutions. It does not matter whether we are talking about building a Data Lake, conducting training in the field of data management, or performing detailed Big Data analysis. We don’t just focus on one technology, instead we specialize in a whole range of open-source and public cloud tools. Our team brings together over 130 specialists in their fields. We have participated in dozens of conferences, written countless amounts of code, we are the organizers of Big Data Tech Summit Warsaw, the largest Polish conference related to Big Data topics. We run webinars, share knowledge on blogs, creating whitepapers and more. Why? Because we believe that Big Data is an indispensable future of business.
Thanks to that, we always select the most optimal Big Data solutions.


Team

The GetInData Advanced Analytics team consists of analytics professionals, including:
Data Scientists
Machine Learning Engineers
Business Intelligence developers
MLOps enthusiasts
While the main goal of the GetInData and the team is creating value for clients using their data, we also do internal R&D work to grow our skills, create our solutions and practically verify others tools and approaches.

Example of projects

Ads personalization engine developed for a mobile app with over 250 million daily active users and 1 Billion daily ads impressions. The model predicted which ad category (e.g. healthcare, cars) a given user is interested in the most and gives such ads a higher chance to be displayed
In other project we are developing a Multilingual Neural Machine Translation model which will be translating 30 languages to English. The goal was to understand the context in which digital advertising inventory is sold. The technology stack includes AWS, dedicated neural net architectures and MLOps solutions for scaling and standardising the process
For a leading podcast-hosting app we are implementing personalised ads targeting models based on natural language understanding. We use AWS and IBM cloud services, as well as external data providers
User Suspension Model developed using Kedro and VertexAI. The model predicts whether the user is fraudulent and should not be granted access to the app. Multiple external data sources are used, such as social media data or user credibility based on a phone number
For a large Asian telecom, we developed time-series forecasting models. They are being used to predict hourly traffic volume for each of thousands of BTS in their network

Apart from commercial projects, we take part in internal initiatives, like:
Kaggle competition, where we develop a solution using Google Cloud Platform (Vertex AI, BigQuery, Looker) and our MLops stack (Kedro, MLflow)
Creating internal methodologies: Data Science projects methodology, Support for developing Data Driven cultures
Knowledge sharing sessions (Advanced Analytics Guild, Analytics Coffee etc.)

Responsibilities

Starting assumption is involvement in R&D initiatives utilising modern MLOps stack. The main goal is to deliver value on customer projects
Nurture your independence - take calculated risks, bring your ideas instead of just taking directions, take ownership of your growth- we promise to help :)
Be curious - look for opportunities to have fun with the problem you are solving - read, try approaches, learn from failure
Be honest and opened - say what you think is worth doing, be critical of your biases and opened to ideas, ask for help when necessary and give help when possible

Technologies used:

Core development: Python, Spark, Jupyter Notebook, Git
Model productization stack: Kedro, MLflow, Airflow, Kubeflow
Cloud stack: GCP, BigQuery, Google Cloud Vertex AI
Strong analytical and statistical skills
Understanding of machine learning models and concepts, e.g. logistic regression, clustering, decision trees, random forest, boosting, regularisation, etc.
Experience with machine learning libraries, e.g. scikit-learn, Pandas, Spark ML
SQL programming skills
Data visualisation skills

Nice to have:

Experiment design and model productization
Experience with Big Data technologies
Experience with advanced ML: Deep Learning, NLP
Familiarity with software development concepts and best practices
Experience with Cloud Platforms: GCP, AWS, Azure
We offer

Salary : 90-130 PLN net + VAT/h B2B (depending on knowledge and experience)
100% remote work
Elastic working hours
Possibility to work from the office located in the heart of Warsaw
Opportunity to learn and develop with the best Big Data specialists in Poland
International projects
Possibility of conducting workshops and training.
Clear career path and certifications
Co-financing sport card
Co-financing health care
All equipment needed for work

Primary responsibility
Develop AI/Client solutions for client s business problems to drive business outcome Banking/Finance/Insurance domain
Strong ability to decompose complex problems into sub-tasks and to translate business-requirements into Data-Science asks
Develop end-to-end integrated applications for operationalizing AI/Client models and Insights

info_remote: TRANS EU GROUP S A - Wrocław, dolnośląskie
description:
Data Scientist

Kogo szukamy?

Data Scientist,
Pasjonatów danych, mających pierwsze doświadczenie w obszarze Data Science zdobyte na studiach, w pracy zawodowej lub w prywatnych projektach,
Osób chcących doskonalić umiejętności programowania w języku Python.

Zbieranie, przetwarzanie i przede wszystkim analizowanie danych dotyczących giełdy przewoźników/załadowców itp z całego świata,
Prace badawcze i wykorzystanie zaawansowanej analityki w celu lepszego poznania zachowań,
Udział w procesach zapewniających odpowiednią jakość i kompletność danych (Data Lake),

Poznawanie i rozwijanie warstw danych (big data, small data, all data)

Silnych umiejętnościach analitycznych i podejściu do pracy polegającym na rozwiązywaniu problemów,
Wysoko rozwiniętych umiejętnościach analitycznych i statystycznych,
Dobrej i praktycznej znajomość języka Python,

Chęć nauki środowiska Aws i Snowflake.


Chcemy, abyś robił to, co sprawia Ci najwięcej radości, ale na pewno ucieszysz się dodatkowo z:

prywatnej opieki medycznej,
karty Multisport,
pysznych, domowych śniadań,
relaksujących masaży odciążających kręgosłup,
eventów integrujących zespół,
voucherów podarunkowych i bonów świątecznych,
ośrodka wczasowego nad jeziorem do dyspozycji pracowników,
jednorazowych dopłat do żłobka i przedszkola,
dopłat do wczasów pod gruszą,
zajęć i sekcji sportowych, organizowanych w firmie i poza nią.

Brzmi dobrze? Aplikuj!

The Role:
Building AI software to target ads to individual users in a high traffic environment.
LOOPME HAS OPENED IN POLAND! A full-time Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer position for an exceptional candidate who has a keen interest in multivariate modelling, machine learning and decision automation. You will be designing and building machine learning systems that will operate on real-world data making decisions in real-time. You will be working in the highly exciting area of real-time ad targeting.
This is a rare opportunity to be involved in creating an automated system to optimize hundreds of real-time interactions per second with online customers, and to quantify the benefits created against control groups in a live environment.
The work involves analysing billions of records of ad-serving opportunities, ad-serves and ad-server responses to understand what factors explain the variance in the expected response value. That understanding is then to be harnessed as an automated optimisation process capable of intelligently finding and servicing the most favourable ad-serving opportunities in a way that leads to higher returns on our clients’ advertising investments.
This is also an opportunity to become part of the UK tech start-up world and get first-hand experience into how tech start-ups operate.
Key Responsibilities:
You will report to the Chief Data Scientist and join a team of other data scientists, senior data scientists and data engineers to solve tough (but never dull) problems, such as:
Prototyping machine learning algorithms using cutting edge research
Developing applications to visualise and manipulate huge amounts of data
Ability to write production-ready code to handle many terabytes of data
Maintain and improve existing products and processes
Working to support the following steps in the analytical process with large (a multi-million record) data sets:
Basic data cleansing and preparation
Variable preprocessing/transformation
Performing statistical tests
Generation of graphical output
Preparation of data sets for predictive modelling
Robust predictive model building, validation and application
Automation of statistical processes
We are a small, highly interactive team working in an Agile environment where we prototype and then put into production machine learning solutions to solve real business problems. You will be involved with all stages of the development lifecycle from brainstorming ideas to the release of production quality code.
You will need strong communication skills. You will also be expected to care deeply about the quality of your code: its clarity, documentation, and testing.
Key Skills & Experience:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a mathematical discipline such as Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics
1+ years experience in Python
Working knowledge of R
Good experience of variable transformation and data preprocessing techniques.
Solid practical knowledge of different modelling techniques and a good grasp of the strengths and weaknesses of each. (Modelling techniques such as Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, Clustering, etc.)
Bonus Qualifications:
Practical experience of univariate and multivariate statistical analysis in R or Python with large data sets (millions of records and many tens or hundreds of independent variables)
Experience of Adtech
Experience in agile software development
Technologies: Elasticsearch, Clickhouse, Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform
Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka
About you:
Strong self-motivation, reliable and flexible team-player
High attention to details, ability to remain focused under pressure
Proactive attitude towards improving processes and finding new solutions to challenging business problems
As Data Scientist, you will be able to combine your expertise in Mathematics, Statistics, and Coding in tackling complex data problems whilst being comfortable in a job requiring agility, curiosity, and continuous improvement. We are looking for someone who can very quickly grasp technical concepts and understand how to rapidly solve problems associated with them. The ideal candidate will examine data from many perspectives, be able to think out of the box and efficiently communicate ideas and findings to technical and non-technical peers equally. A passion for new technologies and a drive to find simple and elegant ways to implement simple solutions to complex problems are key.

The time to change is now!
It's time to build a sustainable future and define how we evolve through technology with purpose.

At Lisbon Tech Hub we create value in the business digital transition, from Portugal to the world, and IT solutions with purpose. Our team has more than 1300 experts working in areas such as Analytics & Business Intelligence, Application Lifecycle Management, Cybersecurity, IT Infrastructure Management, IT Project & Service Management and IT Strategy & User Experience.
Lisbon Tech Hub innovates, designs, transforms the information technology solutions and services for Siemens through our delivery units.
Transforming our future starts with every day!
Lisbon Tech Hub is the home of the new technologists - Dream Builders, Impact Creators & Future Makers.
Are you one of them? Join us!
What role will you play?
Perform strategic data analysis to support business processes and strategy and discuss results with team leads and customers.
Process large amounts of data from multiple sources and extract relevant insights.
Build and operationalize predictive models.
Architect and build cloud infrastructure for both the data engineering and the analytics pipelines
Be part of an international team of data scientists and machine learning engineer with diverse backgrounds, utilizing AI and data analytics methods to accelerate Siemens internal digitalization
We are looking for:
A degree in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, a similar quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with statistical software and scripting languages (e.g., R, Python, SAS).
First experience with cloud technology (AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform)
Proficiency in SQL.
Experience analyzing and modeling data sets.
Experience with statistical and machine learning methods.
The ability to communicate technical concepts into simple terms to present to non-technical audiences.
Effective written and verbal communication skills
What we have to offer:
A flexible home office and schedule policy, virtual budget to improve your home office setup, health insurance, a Pension Plan and a Siemens Share Program time and financial support to your studies, medical center in the facilities, sport groups, 2 days for volunteering initiatives and a cool and relaxed environment.
Access to e-learning platforms (Learnlight, Bookboon, Linkedin Learning and more), discounts with partners.

Organization: Information Technology
Company: Siemens S.A.
